I had to Super Glue all but the Volume Buttons to keep My Father from switching something he didn't know he had switched.  The Menu Driven Center Rocker between the Call and End Buttons Should have been Better thought out also. A Senior Doesn't understand as easly as we more technologicaly adept persons about pressing menu, then OK the same thing you press to call someone, "Why I'm not calling anybody yet" then Menu, ect... And I know the Manufacture means well, but We Need Some way to get Rid of 911 on the Phone Directory Menu. It's the FIRST number that Shows up, and not everybody needs or wants to call 911 all the time.  That's what the Emergency Button on the back is for if you want to program it for that.  My Dad's situation Never needs 911, and he is in a Nursing home. I hope this Review helps people understand what this Phone Does more indepth than just the Hype on the sights.  I would Love it if there were Actually a Senior Phone out there that were actually Just a Phone, sized for Seniors, Without all the Cute Added Features they don't need.  They Just Need a Phone to call Family, Friends and keep in touch.Also I bought the Stand to hold the Phone upright and charge it when not in use, thinking it would be easier for Dad just to put the Phone into the little slot and pick it up when it Rang. Wrong! The Little Delicate charger plug pin in the base / phone makes the phone not easly set in the base. Further the base has absolutly No Weight, so when you try to pick up the phone the base comes with it, I even Taped the Base to the Table and that didn't work. When you set the Phone in the Base it can rock pressing buttons in the process. Very Poor Design Again.  Anyway hope this Information helps others, and the Designers Read this and Fix the Problems with this "Senior Phone"

Reviews.Title: A straight forward simple phone.
Reviews.Author: Tiger Hunt
Reviews.Content: I bought the Snapfon for my mother in law.  She was leery at first of something she had never used before.  She loves the keyboard's large keys and one touch speed call.  They work well with her arthritis.  She has accidentally hit the keyboard lock slide switch a few times, so we might tape that open.  There are five keystrokes to get to the address book and she will need to practice that.  I am amazed that cell phone providers do not carry a phone like this.  The smart phones, while they have large keyboards, they are way too touch sensitive for someone with arthritis, too expensive, and 10 times more features than most seniors would ever use.

Reviews.Title: This phone is smart enough for me!
Reviews.Author: Jayni Mosher "Tough Critic"
Reviews.Content: After struggling with a "smart" phone (Android) for over two years, I am thrilled with my decision to try the Snapfon.I make and receive calls easily--my prime objective for a telephone!The display is easy to read, and the buttons are easy to push.One of my favorite features is the locking keyboard . . . no more calling people with my a$$, then having to explain, and end up talking to people who make me wonder why I had their number in my phone to start with, LOL.Several people have commented that this phone doesn't have a camera.  I have a very good, and quite compact, digital camera.  I don't NEED a camera in my phone.  Furthermore, when I took pictures with my "smart" phone, I could never figure out where they went!  I know how to get to the photos in my digital camera.I am a very happy customer and highly recommend this phone!

Reviews.Title: GREAT FOR  FOR EVERYONE LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Macbeth
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my mother in law who is in a nursing home and due to ongoing repairs we cannot talk to her, so we decided to send a cell phone. This phone is just wonderful, it is simple, big buttons,very, but  very light which is very important with people with arthritis, and best of all , the volume, the ringer is really loud.So easily heard by people hard of hearing.It sends text messages, meaning it does everything any cell phone does, but better.Very easy to use. I just love it, to the point I will get another one for me. I wear glasses and travel a lot, so it is great having big buttons so I can handle a phone call easily at airports without having to search in my purse for the reading glasses, and is so so light, that for somebody like me with psoriasis arthritis in my hands.Another smart thing is the orange screen with big numbers which makes it easy to see in the dark.This phone is awesome and affordable

Reviews.Title: Excellent Senior Cell Phone
Reviews.Author: JP Russell "JP"
Reviews.Content: I have been really pleased with this phone. I keep it by my bed for calls from my wife who has her own business as a pet sitter and is often out on calls while I am still sleeping. Plus I have frequent migraines that send me to bed. This phone allows me to answer without putting on my reading glasses or make calls, without putting on my glasses. The large numbers on the keys are easy to read without my glasses, plus I have a few important numbers programmed into the speed dial feature, so one number is usually all I have to dial. The advertising says the battery life is 120 hours on standby, but I have been getting much more.I read comments made by one reviewer indicating that the 91 year old woman that he got the phone for was perplexed by various aspects of the phone which he admits have to due with her lack of familiarity with cell phones, etc. Yet he rates the Snapfon a 3. He seems to forget, the Snapfon is advertised as a Senior phone, not a phone for people who are, as he says "elderly", the kind of person who is very unfamiliar with any modern technology and often is both easily confused by it and unwilling to learn how to use it. Nevertheless, I saw several reviews by folks who bought this phone for their 80 year old parents who loved it and rated the phone a 5. I am going on 70 but don't really think of myself as a senior yet and I would rate this phone as a 5 plus if I could.The SOS button is an excellent feature that I have not seen on any other phone. You press it and an emergency message goes out to the three numbers you have programmed into the phone.The only thing I feel could really be improved is the owners manual, but face it, that is something that could be said about most products today. I have contacted Snapfon's Customer Support with questions about programming my phone several times and they have responded with very clear and helpful answers so I am well pleased with customer support as well.Most recently I contacted customer support for clarification about programming the message that goes out when you press the SOS button. I wasn't sure if it was only a text message or if you could program a voice message but customer service said it is text only. However, it is possible to modify the text message and they gave me instructions on how to do that.I really like the simplicity this phone has for using certain features such as key lock, the flashlight and volume. Instead of having to go into the menu, these are all easily controlled by simple slide switches on the side of the phone which make using these features much more practical.{ASIN: B005CWSF3U, Snapfon ezONE-C Senior Cell Phone}

Reviews.Title: Good Phone, but has a few issues
Reviews.Author: Judith, Barbados
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my elderly husband of 89 years, whose hands / fingers lack strength.  The numbers / pads are good-sized, but, particularly for the "speed Dial" I found that they needed to be used with some force, ditto the emergency button,  i.e. not very sensitive, and therefore needed some practice.I found the instructions for setting up the phone adequate, but not particularly easy to follow, and far more complicated than the regular mobile phones, i.e. Nokia!Apart from the above, it seems to be a model with some very good features.I live in Barbados, and am happy to confirm that it works well here.

Reviews.Title: Big buttons were the only thing I liked.
Reviews.Author: SMM "smm"
Reviews.Content: Recently bought this phone for my Mom after a stroke left her with double vision.  Her current cell phone is a pay as you go T-mobile.  Be sure and save your contacts to your sim card before transfering it to the new phone.  Editing/searching names and numbers was extremely difficult with the Snapfon.  The emergency button on the back of the phone is a great idea.  However, the phone is so small, accidentally hitting this button was becoming a problem.  Had to turn that feature off.  The big buttons were a definite plus.  However, it was all the other buttons that were a problem.  I agree with other reviewers that the radio and flashlight were unnecessary.  She would turn these on by mistake, and thus drain the battery.  The solution was to tape those buttons down.  All in all, not a good product for my Mom.  I returned the phone and got my money back.  No complaints with this company, just not a good fit.

Reviews.Title: Not so good - design/technical issues
Reviews.Author: Silicon Valley
Reviews.Content: I bought it for my 70 year old father. Although he liked the big numbers, he didn't like it overall and here are the reasons -1. Speaker quality is very bad. Cheapest Nokia phones have better speaker. Switching on/off speaker is not convenient.There should be a separate switch/key for speaker.2. Dialing a number from phone book is cumbersome. You have to press buttons so many times. See Nokia, where its so convenient.3. Screen size is small.for manufacturer - it would be better to concentrate on phone and you can remove flashlight, AM/FM radio. I don't know how many people use light or radio on phone.

Reviews.Title: Basic and simple
Reviews.Author: fizik
Reviews.Content: Got this for my dad, who is in his 80's. Used with T-Mobile prepaid SIM, sold on Amazon, with no problems. Quite simple in operation, although certain parts of user interface can be somewhat confusing. Overall, recommend to anyone needing basic cell phone with clear layout and little in terms of the "learning curve."

Reviews.Title: excellent for seniors! and others
Reviews.Author: amazon user 2
Reviews.Content: This is a practical phone, the size of buttons and more important, the LED screen letters/numbers makes this eminently practical and easy to use. The big red button is the feature that helped me decide to get this--because when help is needed--one big button is the best feeling.

Reviews.Title: Overall seems like a good phone
Reviews.Author: B. D. Pfaff
Reviews.Content: The SnapFon ezONE-C Senior cell phone seems to work as advertized. Not very good for messaging, but not too many seniors of advanced age will use this. Gave the phone to our friend who is 87 and she is using it without problem. AT&T; have a better deal than the sim card that comes with the phone.

Reviews.Title: Snapfon
Reviews.Author: Bonn
Reviews.Content: This item bought for a 91 year old woman. She is finally able to make calls. I read the review about older people not grasping the hold to shut off the phone opposed to tapping once to end call. This proved to be correct. we have to enlist a neighbor to go by the house and turn her phone on when we cant reach her. But we are working on it and she is getting better.

Reviews.Title: Mom called me without prompting!!
Reviews.Author: Cammy Torgenrud
Reviews.Content: The addition of the rear red "SOS" button made me decide to buy this Snapfon exONE-C for my mother, but the size of the (speed-dial) buttons is the feature she most appreciates. Although she's had a flip-phone for 3+ years, she had never spontaneously called me from it - I think it was too hard for her 80 year old eyes to see the numbers. During the holidays she called me 3 times from the new Snapfon and seemed quite pleased with herself and the device. Go mom!!I'm glad the phone has the lock slide button on the right hand side to safeguard her from speed dialing someone by accident. I doubt mom uses the fm radio feature, but I know I would if I owned the phone.Plan on having someone with nimble fingers and good eyes add entries in the phone book.I do wish the Snapfon itself was more durably constructed, but my mother's not too likely to abuse it the way a teenager might. I also wish it connected to the cradle (a separate purchase) a little more smoothly - I have to nudge it around a bit for the light not to flicker between red and green. Still, the battery holds the charge for about a week with minimal use, so I'm really quite happy overall.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Simple Phone
Reviews.Author: Judith Jennet
Reviews.Content: This phone is simple,  easy to set up, no contract,  very solid, incredible battery life.  Would like it to be louder on a call, but I am hard of hearing.Recommend!

Reviews.Title: Great phone!
Reviews.Author: Carolyn J. Jenkins "subjenkins"
Reviews.Content: Hated having to be in the position of NEEDING a phone with big buttons, but I was, so research everything I could for "big button phones"- and since T-Mobilehad nothing to compare,I got this one.  It's totally just what I needed!  And the sound is terrific, I like the way it lights up...love the flashlight feature,the sound choices (I use theme from the Andy Griffith show)....It's just perfect! And using it with my T-Mobile server was no problem either.In fact, T-mobile could learn something from the Snafone  folks....not everyone who needs a cell phone has great eyesight!

Reviews.Title: My Mother-in-law likes this "Elderly" cell phone.
Reviews.Author: capndino "Dinoz"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this phone last year for my wife's mother, who is now 101 YEARS OLD.  She recently moved into a "care" facility and this phone is her main link to the outside world, besides TV and personal visits.  She loves the phone.  Despite failing vision she can select and dial pre-programmed numbers with only the occasional error.  My sister-in-law placed some very small rubber bumpers on the phone to help her stay oriented on the keyboard.We live two hours away and this phone allows us to communicated with "mom" regularly.My wife liked the phone so much that I also bought her one.  Recently, we purchased an extra case and a car charger, which seem to be of good quality.Initially we had some problems programming the phone's features.  The included instructions were a little vague in places.  It is also suggested that a "large print" user manual be provided.  After all, this phone is designed and provided for "elderly" people, who often cannot read as clearly.

Reviews.Title: One word - Junk Piece
Reviews.Author: Max Payne
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my father (He is not in US). It got broken within a week. Doesnt start up. Upone restart the display shows just the 'snapfon' image. It is made up of cheap plastic. Not sure if it is eligible for return. Will never recommend anyone to get this.This is my first ever negative review.

Reviews.Title: I like the the phone but....
Reviews.Author: Marco
Reviews.Content: The Phone broke the first month of used. The locked slide button doesn't work anymore. My Mom barely used the phone.I like the product and the concept but the quality is not that good.

Reviews.Title: beyond it's expectations
Reviews.Author: tam i am
Reviews.Content: I bought this for for my vision impaired son as an alternative to an expensive smart phone with accessibility software. The large buttons that speak their number when pushed make it accessible for him.He told me he had put his coat in the laundry hamper because he had spilled ketchup on it. When I threw it in the washing machine I did not check the pockets. When the wash cycles were done I lifted the coat from the machine and heard something rattle to the bottom. I knew instantly what had happened. I looked down and there was his phone, it's little flash light feature brightly lighting up the wash basin. I was sick, he had only had the phone for a month.I took the battery and sim card out and attempted to dry it with a blow dryer, waited until the next day, put it back together and turned it on. The phone loaded up, even rang when I called it, but none of the buttons worked. My son assured me he would replace the phone with his own money.Four days later I put the phone back together and tried it one more time, without much hope. Amazingly, this time, everthing worked!

Reviews.Title: NOT THRILLED WITH SNAPFON
Reviews.Author: Paul  Weber
Reviews.Content: I love the big buttons and the large display.  Also, sound quality is very good.  Otherwise the phone is difficut to operate. It is not something that I would buy for an elderly person.

Reviews.Title: Well pleased!!
Reviews.Author: dixie
Reviews.Content: Got this phone for my 90 year old aunt and it is wonderful..  Got the phone quickly and I was able to put the sim card in myself and it worked with her AT&T; service.... The numbers are so big and she was able to see them just fine and it is simple to work and each # pressed speaks the number loud and clear.

Reviews.Title: Great for parents with bad eyesight and hearing problems
Reviews.Author: jose
Reviews.Content: My dad loves this phone he needed it. I'm happy with it and so is he. Glad I got it.

Reviews.Title: PERFECT
Reviews.Author: Barbara Hartsfield "Avid and devoted Reader"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for an 80 year old man who is not tech savvy at all.  He loves this phone.  It is easy to use, large display, color is good.  A basic phone but well worth the price if you know someone who wants to keep it simple.

Reviews.Title: This little phone rocks
Reviews.Author: William C. Hast II
Reviews.Content: My wife had hers stolen, I sent her this one, she will leave it withher elderly folks, when she returns home. She says it works betterthan some of the smart phones she has had and the design forolder people is really good.

Reviews.Title: Snapfon quality save y our money
Reviews.Author: Mel
Reviews.Content: Good & not so good. Pretty easy using feat ures but I don't think the signal strength is as shown. Both my wife and I use phones in very populated Phoenix area and reception not good. Have tried to use it in other populated area with same poor results. Other family members use AT&T; like snaphone and get much better results in the same areas.Made for seniors but does not have quality they claim. Camera very poor only good in emergency. Cannot download pictures from desktop to phone not enough memory. Could have purchased better phone at not much higher price.

Reviews.Title: Hard to hear the person using this phone
Reviews.Author: James M Wuertz
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone for my mother in-law as she wanted one with large buttons.  However, it is hard for us to hear her after she started using this phone.

Reviews.Title: My 90 years old mother loves it!
Reviews.Author: My take... "gloria"
Reviews.Content: I simply transferred my mother's T-Mobile SIM card from her old flip cell phone to this phone and it works well.  We like the clear sound, no flip style, and look of the phone.  It was easy to set up applications and ring tones, and the videos on Snapfon website are great help when I had a question on set up.  It does have speaker phone (just press zero while talking is one way), silent setting, and other good features.  I think it was the best choice for my mother after extensive researching all options available.  The only thing so far I would improve would be the clock time display to white numbers over black background for easier visual for my mother since she is vision-impaired due to macular degeneration.  The purple tuff case is very pretty on this phone.

Reviews.Title: Great for senior citizens
Reviews.Author: Boris Kustin
Reviews.Content: Large buttons and large clear displays without all the clutter of the previous phone incauraged both my mom and my father in law to use cell phones instead of their regular land lines. Saves them both a bundle

Reviews.Title: Use Your Own Cell Service
Reviews.Author: Julie M.
Reviews.Content: We got this phone for my elderly mother to replace the Snapfon ezOne she has been using.  The contacts is much easier to navigate, there is more ability to customize with different ring tones, etc.  and the voicemail actually works.  I think this was a big improvement.  The cradle this comes with is also an awesome accessory that makes it so much easier to set the phone up to charge.  Overall this is a good phone for an elderly person as it doesn't have lots of bells and whistles but is easy to use.  An extra bonus is that you can use your own cell provider or choose one they recommend if you desire.

Reviews.Title: Snapfon esTwo for Senior cell phone
Reviews.Author: D. Plotts "Dottie"
Reviews.Content: Lives up to their description. Numbers are large, screen is bright, when pressing the numbers the phone voices the numbers as you press. Very nice phone for seniors, especially the hearing and sight impaired. My father-in-law is 89 and I got one for him. After a few instructions, he is using it with no problems. My husband like the phone so much I ordered one for him and he loves it.

Reviews.Title: Bright, Good Sized, Easy to Use for Seniors
Reviews.Author: Jaki Taj Mahal
Reviews.Content: My low vision, hard of hearing husband in his 80s loves this phone.  The super bright display looks exactly like the photo; I can see the time, phone number 4 feet away!  The ring is loud, the buttons are bright and fat and that makes it so easy for seniors to dial.  I set up speed dial very easily.  The contact list is just one click away.  It has a handy flash light on the top of the unit.  Best of all, the emergency button on the back can be set for 911 or any number.  I set it for me and I get a text message and a phone call when he uses this function.  My SIM card from ATT fit inside, right out of the box!  Could not have been easier.  Great little phone.  One last thing, it arrived in perfect condition, in a few days.  I really appreciated that.

Reviews.Title: Really goog phone for my mother in law.
Reviews.Author: Maria E Santa Olmeda
Reviews.Content: Easy to program and use, just needed a couple of features like being able to secure the contact list for her. She does love it otherwise. The phone works great and like I indicated really great features for older eyes and ears. I would readily recomend to anyone with some years tagged on them.

Reviews.Title: Mother in law can use the phone
Reviews.Author: Bradley Sitton
Reviews.Content: We had gotten the simplest "free" phone with the biggest buttons and still my mother in law would have trouble dialing, hearing it ring, and would sometimes get the settings messed up.By contrast the Snapfon is working great for her, after a couple of months I have not heard a complaint.Being unlocked allowed her to keep the AT&T; pay as you go plan by just moving the SIM card over, the AT&T; store even helped out with that.  This was a significant feature since she does not use the phone much and this plan gives her service for $8-9/month when paying a year at a time, which is much cheaper than something like Jitterbug or other options we saw.

Reviews.Title: I Love It!
Reviews.Author: John Bowdle
Reviews.Content: I have trouble with my eyesight, and this phone is wonderful. My partner bought it for me as a Valentine's Day gift. Big buttons and backlit so I can actually see the display. So easy to use!

Reviews.Title: Great phone for elderly
Reviews.Author: J. Lobb "avid reader"
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone for my 85 year old father who was having difficulty using his cell phone which was small with very small keypad and too many unnecessary buttons.  I had never bought a phone other than from our carrier, so wasn't sure I could set it up to work, but it was incredibly easy!  Just took SIM card out of his old phone and slid it into this one.  Voila, working phone!  Didn't have to change carriers or worry about reception of alternative company, etc.  Easy to program and just super simple to use!  He has problems learning anything new but got onto this phone very quickly.  I highly recommend this phone for the older senior citizen!!

Reviews.Title: The phone works good, but (read below)
Reviews.Author: rstick
Reviews.Content: I am legally blind (65 years old) and I am happy with the phone. The screen is big and the buttons are easy to use. It has a camera, but you cannot do anything with them. There is a socket for a micro SD card to store the pictures, however you can't send them out in a MMS text message. There is no option for a data plan even though their on-line manual says so. SMS texts and fine and the rest of the options are great. I had a Snapfon ONE and this Snapfon TWO is a great improvement. You can import the pictures into your computer with the USB cable, but you probably not buy this phone for the camera.  It is the best phone out there; I have done a lot of research. My son just took the SIM card out of my old phone and it was operational. I also bought the charging cradle and the and the protective cover (it makes the phone easier to use). I am on the AT& T network so I do not know about the other plans. I hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: F. P. Martin
Reviews.Content: Purchased for my 91 year old Mom, and it is a great phone for her.  Very simple, easy to use.  Looks like a hand held calculator.

Reviews.Title: good not great
Reviews.Author: beliefpatrol
Reviews.Content: well, this phone does have big buttons, and has important functions on the side, but some of the functions (like adding contacts) are more difficult to do than most phones.  i tried to add some phone calls to contacts that my mother received, and i was not able to figure it out initially.  i am the one always helping others with their new phones and it is usually a breeze to add contacts.  the on/off and dial/redial and other functions are pretty straight-forward though.

Reviews.Title: This phone is great for visually challenged people
Reviews.Author: mfdockery
Reviews.Content: Got this phone for my dad who is struggling with sight issues. It is a GSM unlocked model which we put in ATT prepaid sim and works fine. Also has a speech function so when you press the buttons it will tell them what button they pushed.

Reviews.Title: Cheap, unattractive phone with poor, harsh speaker
Reviews.Author: rb
Reviews.Content: Bought for my elderly in-laws. Simple enough to use, but the speaker sounds harsh and distorted. The phone looks and feels cheap, like a kid's toy. That is a better use for this phone.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: bobtherr "bobtherr"
Reviews.Content: We bought this for my 89 year old Mother-in-Law who has macular degeneration. She says it is easy for her to see the buttons and screen and can hear people's voices clearly. I just took the sim card from her AT&T; Pantech phone and put it in this one and it was good to go.

Reviews.Title: Really simple
Reviews.Author: Valerie S.
Reviews.Content: It does everything it claimed - easy to use very large numbers  The voice on phone is really easy to understand

Reviews.Title: Snapfon ezTWO
Reviews.Author: Kenneth R. Cain "kencain"
Reviews.Content: Bought for my mother. Best phone for the elderly. Don't buy any of the other "Senior Phones". I have bought two of these phones. I for my mother and one for one of her friends. It is an unlocked phone.

Reviews.Title: Gift for my Mother
Reviews.Author: chesskix
Reviews.Content: My Mother is getting on in years and like many in her generation needs a simple phone.  This one seems to fit the bill and although she had some trouble at the start she seems to like it now.  I live a few hundred miles away from my Mom so I couldn't help her set it up.  I tried to talk her through it on another phone to no avail but a family friend got her up and running without any problems.  The on-line videos are very instructive and very well organized.  One of the main reasons I purchased this phone was that it was compatible with the AT&T; SIM chip ... that worked perfectly.  I will set up the other features of this phone on my next visit but overall I consider this to be a good value.

Reviews.Title: Initially was very satisfied.
Reviews.Author: Boggie "Bogwan"
Reviews.Content: Now after having and using the phone for several months I have found a major discrepancy. That is its poor to no receptionin enclosed buildings. No problem in a house with windows but in an enclosed brick or concrete building with no windows, forget it.Otherwise I do like the phone and its loud rings.

Reviews.Title: My Mom Loves It
Reviews.Author: Jaded "Rat"
Reviews.Content: This is a great phone for an older person. My Mom is almost 97 and she loves it. Someone will probably have to set it up for the older person.... that is enter names and numbers in the phone book. The instructions for doing this are iffy.  You have to enter Alpha characters using the phone dial keypad. But once its set up finding names in the phone book is simple. The large keypad is there in case a name/number isn't in the phone book. There is also a Red Emergency button on the rear. Let me tell you it works. I had my number my wife's number and 911 in that order in the Emergency list. I thought it would dial first one then the next etc. So I tested it thinking I would stop it after it called me. Well that ain't the way it worked. It called all three at once. I had to call 911 and tell them the call was an accident. The phone also has Txt Msging and a camera but I haven't tried to teach Mom how to use those...... maybe some day when I have lots of time and patience.

Reviews.Title: My mother loves her new phone
Reviews.Author: Cat Lover
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my mother, who was really having trouble using a cell phone of any kind. I set this up for her in about 10 minutes, showed her how to use it and she was off and running. She has been using it for quite some time now and she just loves it. It is easy for seniors to use as it is not complicated. The buttons are large, which is a plus, both for sight and dexterity issues. I visited several cell phone stores in my area and looked at many different phones for my mother and this one is by far the best I could have found for her. One sales representative in a well known store even took me aside and recommended that I look for this phone on-line, he had purchased one for his parent too!

Reviews.Title: Great phone but ONLY 2g
Reviews.Author: William Ryalls
Reviews.Content: This is the PERFECT phone for my elderly dad except for one HUGE flaw. It's only 2g compatible!!!!  I tried it on my ATT plan and once it worked and three tries it didn't. Called the company that makes them and they told me it won't work on my 3G plan. Called att and they said 2g/3G doesn't matter EXCEPT that 2g won't be supported in near future so had to return this phone.  Haven't been able to find anything CLOSE to this phone in 3G. :(-------------//-------------AFTER it was explained to me by ANOTHER att person that whether it's 2g or 3G does NOT matter she could make it work I ordered ANOTHER one!  It arrived and I took it to ATT and after an HOUR of trying this and that the phone could NOT be made to work on my ATT family plan!!  They gave me a free phone for my troubles which isn't half as useful as the track phone. I am now sending back my second phone!  MY ADVICE?  Go ahead and buy it, try it, and if it works...super , you have the best phone for the elderly and if it doesn't... Just send it back.

Reviews.Title: 90 year old senior
Reviews.Author: S
Reviews.Content: Purchased the Snapfon because it offers a combination of phone and medical alert.  My Dad is out and about so we needed something usable anywhere rather than standard function that only works within the range of the base module.  .  The keys are large and the phone works well with his hearing aids.  We have tested the alarm and the phone sends text messages to family members when the alarm button is pressed.  The only problem so far is that the volume button (on the side of the phone) can be turned down inadvertently when placing the phone in a holder.

Reviews.Title: Mom loves it!!
Reviews.Author: Dan Wilhite
Reviews.Content: My mom is 92 and loves her new Snapfon. She is legally blind but gets along real well with her new phone.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for senior
Reviews.Author: jan
Reviews.Content: We purchased this phone for mom who wants basic service with numbers and buttons she can see.  She loves this phone, brags on it all the time.  She has tested the emergency button and feels secure it will help if she needs it.  She wears it on the lanyard around her neck at all times.  Her only complaint is the clip from the lanyard to the phone gets stuck on some clothing.  So we may look around for another lanyard.The phone was easy to set up.  We just put in her sim card and everything was there.  The menu list for all functions is easy to read.I am so glad we bought this phone for mom.

Reviews.Title: Not so easy to use.
Reviews.Author: Vielka C
Reviews.Content: I bought this unit specifically for a person who is legally blind. Previously the person was using a Motorola phone, which was quite good and friendly to use, but the battery died, and I decided to search for another brand. Mistake made!! Even-tough the buttons are big, is not reliable to identify the top part of the phone. For example, if you need to look for NAMES: the way that it works is not friendly. For a person with visual limitations is a challenge to be able to touch the ( - ) at the right superior part of the phone, then the names are not displayed in a color that helps. I won't recommend this cell phone. I am not sure if may work for "seniors" but definitely not for a legally blind person.

Reviews.Title: Best phone for Seniors, yet!
Reviews.Author: Grand"mo"
Reviews.Content: We have tried several different phones for our elderly Mom and found that this version is the best we have tried; it is simple and easy to use, and she can see the numbers without her glasses, another plus.

Reviews.Title: For my Mom
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: So far she loves it. We upgraded to this phone from an older Tracfone. She loves the fact that the buttons are larger and easier for her to use. I immediately noticed that she has fewer mistakes in her text messages. Using the PureTalk service and so far so good. The phone comes with a PureTalk chip, so it is ready to go with their service but you can get chips from other providers if you wish. The big red button on the back is programmable, so you can choose whether or not it will call 911 or text relatives or sound an audible alarm.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy
Reviews.Author: John Vukovich
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't give one star but had to in order to write a review. The phone was too difficult  to work, not only for my aging parent but myself. Then it broke 2 weeks later.

Reviews.Title: This one works!
Reviews.Author: linda b
Reviews.Content: I searched for a cell phone many times over the years. All failed me, mostly because I couldn't hear what was being said, at least not clearly. This phone works just as well as advertised. I am absolutely ecstatic! I can even hear without my hearing aid and I have severe loss in the ear I use. If you need a cell phone and have a hearing loss this is the one to get.All the other factors are as advertised and are terrific bonuses for me. I have no connection with the company. However I just had to write this review.Linda B

Reviews.Title: Nice phone, easy to use, decent battery life.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Nice phone for an elderly friend. For her using even a regular phone can be a struggle so this is still a little complicated. We disabled the emergency button as the fear of an accidental press was to worrisome to her. This phone combined with Puretalk's $5 a month plan makes for a great little emergency phone.

Reviews.Title: Not all it is cracked up to be!
Reviews.Author: Swift Stoney
Reviews.Content: Voice quality is poor and reception even poorer. Would not recommend this product. We are going to toss it and go to AT&T;, our service provider, and bite the bullet and get something that works.

Reviews.Title: Repair Question's
Reviews.Author: Tina S.
Reviews.Content: The Phone is simple to Use, Has Good Volume but the problem is spending the money & no one can fix my broken Screen unless you buy insurance, Nobody will Help you find a Repair Shop

Reviews.Title: Great Phone for Vision Impaired
Reviews.Author: Robert Savitzky
Reviews.Content: Great phone for vision impaired seniors. Simple to use, load speakerphone. SOS button on back for emergency help. Excellent call quality.

Reviews.Title: I have now purchased three of these Senior phones for both my parents and father-in-law
Reviews.Author: JAMES N SMITH JR
Reviews.Content: I have now purchased three of these Senior phones for both my parents and father-in-law. The one-button SOS on the back will send a text message to me and my wife rather than calling 911 in the event they need help. It will also call me and put the phone in speaker hands free mode if my father-in-law has fallen and can't reach the phone but can talk. This is better than the very expensive Life Alert systems that cost hundreds of dollars and have monthly service fees and only work when they are home. I highly recommend this phone for anyone who has a aging parent that needs a simple to use, big button phone without all the smarts that can't and will not ever use. I use a really great rate plan for just $10/month for the first phone and $5/month for each additional phone and they get plenty of minutes that they will never use. I use puretalkusa.com Family Plan that looks to be a reseller for the AT&T; network becuase they have excellent coverage.

Reviews.Title: Keep their OLD fingers off the volume button
Reviews.Author: Richard E. St Pierre
Reviews.Content: Mother in law keeps accidently pressing the volume button while talking thus running the volume to a minimum and then can't hear.  She can't figure out how to remedy it so I have to drive to her house and put the volume back up.  At this time I have a piece of plastic taped over the button and it seems to be holding....  the ring is loud but she is 'deafer'. (embarassing in public)

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the non-computer/smart-phone person
Reviews.Author: SSF "words2offer"
Reviews.Content: A great phone for seniors who want the safety and comfort of a carrying a cell phone and none of the "extras" that are excessive and confusing.  Light-weight, easy to handle and carry around.  Highly recommended for a non-electronic personality.

Reviews.Title: Practical phone for a senior
Reviews.Author: G. Fanning
Reviews.Content: Purchased this product and its accessories for my father.  The phone is everything it was purported to be and we are very happy with it.  He had become too frustrated with the standard phones that are available due to small key sizes and too much technology.  He wanted a very simple-to-use phone with easily readable display and buttons with a mechanical feel when touched.  He was never sure he was hitting the correct button and was having trouble verifying that he had the correct number/contact.

Reviews.Title: Great buttons.
Reviews.Author: jamie kneisley
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my dad. He wanted a phone that was easy to dial. Most phones have tiny buttons.  He loves this phone.

Reviews.Title: Worked for our needs
Reviews.Author: LookingGlass
Reviews.Content: Had a few issues initially when using with AT&T; SIM card.  Customer service felt that it just wasn't going to work and suggested sending it back.  After pushing back a bit, they suggested I sign up for PureTalk just to see if the phone worked at all.  It didn't.  Sent it back - was repaired or replaced (not sure which) and now it accepts the existing AT&T; SIM card.Although the service calls were frustrating with lack of knowledge, now that the issue is resolved, we are very happy with the phone.  My 91 year old mother who uses hearing aids was having great difficulty hearing anyone on her old EZ-One model.  With the EZ-TWO, she hears clearly, the screen is larger and easy for her to see.  She is VERY happy now that she can connect with the world and when Momma is happy, we are ALL happy.

Reviews.Title: Phone works as promised and with ease for my 92 yr old mother in law
Reviews.Author: MARK
Reviews.Content: We live on the west coast and my mother-in-law lives in Florida.  After using Verizon phones on the family plan and the selection being pretty sad and the  phones do not last long for a simple non data phone we decided to try the SnapfonTwo.  Programmed it in California and sent it back to Florida, she turned it on and no problems whatsoever.  The monthly no contract plan very affordable from $15.  The SOS button was programmed to our phones here and the one time it was used by her, did what it was suppose to, we had the fire/rescue at her door in minutes.  Even if not a senior and you want an unlocked affordable phone, would pick this one up.

Reviews.Title: So Far So Good.........
Reviews.Author: James Zelenka
Reviews.Content: For the most part I'm impressed. I don't see how the over all functioning can be improved upon. The only obvious shortcoming is with the materials it's made of. As is it should retail for $50. or better yet use polycarbonate and gorilla glass, not low quality painted plastic.It would seem there is a huge untapped market for this kind of phone so maybe this is only the beginning. It might need to be simplified even further for the elderly but for those like myself who are just burned out on the endless complexity of technology this is sweet.

Reviews.Title: could be simpler, louder, but unlocked and inexpensive
Reviews.Author: Robert P. Dorais "TuneHistory"
Reviews.Content: For a senior phone, it actually has too many options,  like the camera. It has good features, like speed dial and voicemail speed dial by pressing and holding the one button.  It would be great if the volume was louder or if you could make hands free the default. Also, a flip phone might be a better design, like the jitterbug. You flip it open and get a dial tone. And volume should be clearly marked. On the side is too easy to accidentally touch it. I do like being able to put in my t-mobile sim and it works.

Reviews.Title: snapfon
Reviews.Author: Seajewel
Reviews.Content: Really like the phone.  Nice display with large numbers.  As I am getting older I like print larger and this is the phone and easy to use.  Simple for the type of phone that I need.

Reviews.Title: Like it
Reviews.Author: Mike McLennan
Reviews.Content: Bought it for my 95 yr old father in law who lives alone. The emergency button was the selling point.

Reviews.Title: I love this phone
Reviews.Author: Carlene Wright
Reviews.Content: I just wanted a simple cellphone That I could read the screen when a call came in.  This phone has it and more.  I love the tone feature that repeats the number I have hit when dialing.  I can read the screen without my reading glasses.  Call quality is great. And the adjustable volume for the phone should take care of those with hearing difficulties.  I highly recommend this phone.

Reviews.Title: my 78 year old mom LOVES IT!!!
Reviews.Author: L. Grantham "LJG"
Reviews.Content: Thank you Snapfon for an easy to use phone.  You have given my 78 year old mother piece of mind!  :@)

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: JoAnn Clark
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone for my 88 year old mother. Very easy to use, number size, clarity is great. The battery life is excellent.  I definitely would recommend this phone for any senior.

Reviews.Title: ezOne-C Senior Cell Phone by Snapfon
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Jay (KE5IFU) Buck"
Reviews.Content: Does just what it says, but the documentation could be a bit clearer.  Took us a while to learn how to program it with numbers, etc,. The phone itself is perfect for someone with any hand issues - shaking, arthritis etc.  Loudness is good, to for those with hearing issues.  I do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: SNAPFON HAS GLITCHES
Reviews.Author: lmcclosk
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my mother who is visually impaired and hard of hearing.  The appealing features include: backlit easy to see large numbers, voice-back numbers as keys are touched, a very loud ring, and easy to access voicemail once programmed. The phone is small - easy to transport, but maybe a little too small.There have been some "glitches:"  - When my mother is on the phone and the phone rings her call has been interrupted and she hears the voice from another party;  - The battery does not hold a charge.  If the phone is unplugged for even an hour there is no charge, and also of course no calls coming in.My mother wants to return the phone because of the battery problem, understandably.  It cost with tax and shipping about $90.00 and unfortunately is unusable.  The battery worked okay the first two weeks or so but is no longer functioning.Because of this last glitch I can't recommend it.  But it is not easy to find a phone that addresses all the needs of an elderly user, and expensive to keep trying one model after another

Reviews.Title: Bought this for my senior mum
Reviews.Author: S. Sharma
Reviews.Content: Ill keep this short. I bought this phone for my senior mum that needed something simple and conventional. She doesnt really text. I wanted something as simple as turn on, dial, click ok. I wanted to stay away from complicated navigation or any touch screen features.  The buttons are large and clear, the phone display is bright orange  with clear and easy to read. When you dial a number, an internal  voice  repeats the number back. It does the job. The only con, this phone should not cost more than $40, it almost feels like a toy phone from a  Xmas cracker, but its perfect for ma, so we are keeping it. If you need something really simple this is a very good option. My Ma has early signs dementia and forgets things easily, but she got the hang of this phone on the first day. Oh, I really like the SOS feature. One of my biggest fears is Ma falling over or needing help when alone, I programmed my cell into SOS. One touch immediately alerts me.

Reviews.Title: better than expected
Reviews.Author: james
Reviews.Content: purchased for my 91 year old mom. tried to find a phone from one of the local cell companies.NO WAY.. this is a great phone and easy to use. and I just added it to my own cell account. smart buy

Reviews.Title: GREAT HELP!
Reviews.Author: Charlie
Reviews.Content: We are really pleased with this phone and with the quick service that we received.I have suffered a stroke and I am impaired on the left side and my wife has MS so this is a life saver for us.It is easy to use and all the instructions were easy to comprehend.We both highly recommend this phone.

Reviews.Title: Great for Grandma!
Reviews.Author: judy
Reviews.Content: We bought this phone for Grandma and it is great. Not too confusing. The audio number reader is great. The light doesn't work. Oh well. At least Grandma will carry it!

Reviews.Title: Great for Low Vision, not for elderly
Reviews.Author: Door Diva
Reviews.Content: I bought the Snapfon for my 84 year old mother with Macular Degeneration.  Once I was able to program in the speed dial #s I was very excited that she could just press the # which is verbal, then it would dial me or other contacts she had memorized with her old cell phone.  Unfortunately, due to moderate dementia, she was unable to follow the direction of pressing the # and holding for just a second to dial.  Ending a call was even more confusing to her.  If this were a flip phone, it would have made all the difference.It's wonderful because it had a loud ringer, the buttons were easy to find, though the display is not all that easy with advanced macular.The directions are not that clear for speed dial.  I actually found it by accident.

Reviews.Title: All a phone needs to be!
Reviews.Author: Annie W.
Reviews.Content: I helped my 85-year-old dad order this phone so he could eliminate his $77/mo. landline (which included no long distance). He is legally blind and severly hearing-impaired. This phone has been great for him -- he can actually see the buttons/numbers and read the text. He can hear it ring and it has really clear sound. I only have to forgive him for choosing the theme from "Dragnet" for his ringtone!

Reviews.Title: Must have for seniors !!!
Reviews.Author: Michael Marceaux "mrgutter"
Reviews.Content: Big buttons and works great. Load speaker,my father is blind and death and this phone has really helped us stay in touch.Thanks Michael

Reviews.Title: Great for grandma!
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth Cockrell
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mom it is much better than the flip phone sold to me by my carrier. Every mobile operator offered this phone for older customers. I love the larger keypad and the simple intuitive design.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone for my Grandma!
Reviews.Author: Michelle Denise
Reviews.Content: Got this phone for my Grandma.She's 85 years old and just needed a phone for emergencies.This phone is unlocked, so you can use any gsm carrier in the US.Not too sure if it's quad band.She loves it because it's really easy to use.Big numbers and big screen for numbers.Simple to use.Looks like a house phone which she liked.We ended up using the service that comes with the phone.Affordable and just the right plan for her.

Reviews.Title: SnapFon Senior Cell Phone
Reviews.Author: El Gato
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this for an elderly parent in a nursing home who has right side paresis from a stroke 14 years ago. She had been unable to manage a regular land line as well as a flip phone. With minimal repetitive instruction she is able to make and receive calls, see and feel the buttons working. Now I just have to figure out how to assist her with charging  the phone.Set up w/ AT&T; chip was easy. Well worth the money, rapid delivery (less than predicted delivery time), easy to set up and use.

Reviews.Title: Wondeful for people with limited hand usage
Reviews.Author: paula wright
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful easy function phone for people with limited hand control. the big buttons and the simplicity makes it very simple to operate.

Reviews.Title: Bought for 81 year old Mother.
Reviews.Author: J. Fisher
Reviews.Content: My Mother has been having trouble with her sight so I bought this because of it's big number pad. The voice that pronounces each number as she dials a phone number was a nice surprise. I also liked the fact that it had a "panic" button on the back that I was able to program all four siblings's number's in.  if she needs to push it, the phone will dial each number until it reaches an answer. (I believe all numbers are alerted that the button has been pushed.) I bought a (cover and) lariat for her phone and told her to wear it around her neck every time she goes outside to get the mail or move the trash etc. so if she falls she can call for help.I programed all her family and close friend's numbers for her but I think she will have problems trying to pull the phonebook and/or caller ID up. Maybe it can not be made any simpler but for the difficulty in pulling them up I thought about giving this a four star instead of a five but I really doubt there is another phone out there that would make it any easier.I had no problem putting this phone on my ATT cell phone plan. No contracts, No data plan. One detail I totally did not think about was that Mom lives in another city then me and will now have to dial the area code when calling her family/friends who live close to her (but not when she calls me!) I would have looked into getting her a number that more local for her if I would have thought about it.Very easy to dial, hang up, charge, add to plan and a huge relief to know she has a panic button if needed.

Reviews.Title: Needs a few more improvements to be a great senior phone
Reviews.Author: Narayan S Raja
Reviews.Content: Good things:1.  Really loud ring.2.  Really big letters on keys.3.  Just pop in your SIM and you're ready to go  with your previous GSM number.Bad things:1.  Voice volume is way too low for seniors.2.  No speakerphone.I would give it five stars IF:1.  They greatly boost the sound volume.2.  Add speakerphone feature.3.  Add alarm feature.Raja.

Reviews.Title: Still too complicated for the elderly
Reviews.Author: David H. Scott "Dave"
Reviews.Content: Great little phone.  Good volume and the numbers are large and easy to read.  For my 89 year old elderly friend, it is still too complicated and the slide controls on the side of the phone are constantly getting moved to the wrong position.  The "phone book" feature is far too complicated for an elderly person to use.  I had to write detailed directions so my friend could access the contact list in the phone to dial the number automatically. I would recommend this phone, but it still needs to be more simplified for the elderly.  The company should consider two models, one for seniors and one for the elderly.

Reviews.Title: Too many features making phone too complex to use
Reviews.Author: DanNY
Reviews.Content: Bought this for an 85 year old senior. Phone has more features than necessary like radio, flashlight, keyboard lock, etc., which just drain the battery and make it more complicated to use.Biggest problem is the address book. My assumption was that you can scroll through the address book by using the arrow button -- not so. Have to navigate through a menu to get to the address book first. What the...?Buttons are nice and big, so is the display, but the phone is useless as too many menu options to navigate just to place a phone call (unless you just dial the number on the keypad).  No option to lock-out menu choices, so not a good product for an elderly person looking for the simplest phone possible.Reception is good, so is volume. Ability to block incoming SMS is a plus. SOS button does work, so that feature is worth keeping -- all others should be removed. Too complex for most seniors. Keep it simple.  Remove all features and menu choices besides the address book.

Reviews.Title: Small
Reviews.Author: Aimee
Reviews.Content: I suppose we should have looked at the dimensions when we bought this for Grandma, but we didn't, and it's a whole lot smaller than what we expected. She wanted a bigger phone like the size of her home phone. Oh well. The buttons are still bigger than other phones. And it works just fine.

Reviews.Title: Vhugo
Reviews.Author: Vhugo
Reviews.Content: I bought this cell for my mother who is 77 years old, and she likes it very much . Thanks for this invention

Reviews.Title: Good basic phone
Reviews.Author: Tim Mac
Reviews.Content: This phone is a good basic phone for someone that doesn't need all the bells and whistles.You just have to watch the 911 button on back as my wife called twice by accident.

Reviews.Title: OK Phone Just kills address book
Reviews.Author: Louis L. Carter
Reviews.Content: When the phone arrived I tried to copy the phone numbers from the old phone to the sims.  Then sim to the new Snapfon.  It erased all the numbers in the address book and sims card. I can count the address but cannot retrive them. My farther is 80's and he having trouble adding numbers.  Simple software and a 3/5 cue card would help. Just a week ago it kill the entire address book again.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Elderly with Bad Eyes
Reviews.Author: daughter-in-law
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone for my father-in-law who has lost the majority of his eyesight.  This phone is wonderful, the buttons are large enough for him to navigate and use easily.  The only problem he had, because he can hardly see is finding the on and off button.  These buttons don't feel like the number buttons and to him felt like one surface across.  But, he has figured it out now & loves the phone.  It has several neat ringtones and is very loud if you want it to be. One other nice feature is that it announces the numbers as you dial and for someone who has a hard time seeing this is a great feature.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic phone at good price, for the right user.
Reviews.Author: KG
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone for an elderly family member who didn't have the need for, or patience to learn how to operate, a more advanced, feature laden mobile phone. I am happy to report it has been a good fit, with no complaints to date. The phone is almost intuitive in its simplicity to use, and the buttons are over-sized for arthritic joints or poor eyesight. Also, the ringer volume is adjustable to a higher volume level that what is usually found on standard cell phones, and it is hearing aid compatible. If you or a loved one have any of these concerns, this is absolutely the right phone for you!

Reviews.Title: They are very happy with their new Just5 cell phones
Reviews.Author: Daughter
Reviews.Content: I have been looking to buy a cell phone replacement for my parents.  Their cell phones are nearly 8 years old and heavy.  All the new cell phones are made for 18 year olds with eyes of eagles.  My parents are 79 and 81.  They only want a cell phone with 1) hard keys (not something that you have to find the right screen), 2) no Internet (charges), 3) a large display that can be seen outside during the day (they play a lot of golf:-).I bought these phone (one in red for Mom and one in black for Dad).  They are light weight, have large keys and a display and were easy to convert to.  All I needed to do is copy their phone books onto the cell phone card and move it to the new cell phone.  It worked flawlessly.Best of all, there is a PRINTED manual, so as they have questions are want to read how to use the phone, the manual is available.I would score these a 10 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: Snapfone meets the need
Reviews.Author: rchamber
Reviews.Content: We got the Snapfon for a 93 year old father. The simplicity of the phone made it easier for him to use or miss-use. The only draw back was the inability to remove the 911 number from the contact list. The phone did work well and gave great talk time as well as standby time. I would buy it again.

Reviews.Title: All problems with Snapfon One Have been  fixed
Reviews.Author: Donald A. Ostrower
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the snapfon One and called it iseless.  I gave it one star -which was one star more than it seserved.All my problems with the first version have been fixed - wonderfully.  It is now legibile font is larger, contrast is much, much greater.I can ese it.I am impressed!!!

Reviews.Title: as advertised
Reviews.Author: Yehudah
Reviews.Content: The phone is easy to use, has adequate functionality, and even looks good.  Its built well and is just the right size.  The ringer is very loud, which is a plus.  Very good product.

Reviews.Title: Snapfon
Reviews.Author: Bainesguy
Reviews.Content: Got this for a person with Parkinson's who has trouble using smaller phones since none of the regular phone companies have something for disabled people.  IT works good.  The one button feature alerts me when he is calling.  Some of the buttons could be better.  The red button and green button can be confusing to him, but we are working on that.  The red button turns the phone on, and can confuse you when you are trying to get it to work.  (Red means stop and green means go...pressed the green button numerous times until I called and found out it was the red button that activates it).  But it is helpful and the only phone out there for disabled people that I could find.

Reviews.Title: My Grandpa LOVES it!
Reviews.Author: Krista R. Shweid
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that my Grandpa is a very curmudgeonly person and very few things make him happy. Vanilla ice cream, M*A*S*H, his pair of boots that his pinky toes hang out of and his cigarettes are about all that I can think of. He can't hear well, he has little to no feeling in his fingers and he refuses to wear his glasses. *sigh*That being said - he freakin' loves this phone! He used to have one of those gianormous brick cell phones from the 80's. He had to give that up about 7 years ago - no - not kidding!! Since then he's had the same Nokia. Unfortunately he dropped it on the cement and it broke into a few dozen pieces. Never fear, he had a plan! He enlisted my mother to go down to the AT&T; store and buy him an identical phone. Surely they would have it. Surely! After almost 2 days of arguing and ATTEMPTING to explain to him that his phone was OLD... they didn't sell it anymore... and no you can't buy used phones from AT&T...; why don't they keep the used phones and sell them - IS  a good question, but we don't know the answer... Go ahead and write a letter to the president of the company... telling him we understood that he wanted to move to Canada now, to get away from the "Commies" who make cell phones... (He really needs his own show. He's quite animated and hysterical when he goes on rants) - my mother and I gave up! Then... I went on Amazon and searched for cell phones for seniors.I found this gem of a phone. I almost want one myself, I love the big numbers, its so cute. Before purchasing it I read that the numbers are almost as big as dimes - they are! I ordered 2, one in white and one in black - on a subsequent rant he complained first about not being about to see white lettering on black and then later, vice versa. He is currently using the white one and loves it to pieces. He can read it, the numbers are big enough for him to see, and the ringer is ear-shatteringly loud. He walked out to the street at our family business which is located on a frontage road along a busy freeway, and we stayed in the office and called him and we could hear the ringer from there - and he could hear us over the freeway traffic. Its very basic, no confusing screen or displays. Its got a programmable emergency button on the back. And the radio is fun too.The only cons we've run into is that he turns the radio on, on accident a lot and it does feel a little flimsy. BUT he is in is 80's and he still drives a big ol' bobtail truck and delivers palettes of goods for a living. He carries this phone around with him everywhere and has dropped it, left it in the back of a freezer truck and sat on it several times - and it still works.Give it a chance, its a good little - big numbered - phone.

Reviews.Title: Senior Cell Phone
Reviews.Author: Carolyn E. Murphy
Reviews.Content: This is perfect for an elderly person or someone hard of hearing. After accidently washing her first one, she was lost without it. Not only does it have an extra loudness it has a flashlight installed plus a button on the back to install emergency numbers in case shes fallen. If this was to happen, all she has to do is push this button (5 numbers which the owner programs in) and the phone automaticly starts calling these numbers. If no one answere, it dials 911. Perfect for anyone living alone or in bad health.

Reviews.Title: Too late!
Reviews.Author: Rambler
Reviews.Content: Looked great with large numbers, SOS button, and nightlight. Main issue was speaker phone cannot be left on.  It is only operable once a call is connected and 0 or OK button is pressed twice.  Once in position it's difficult to push a button and then relocate.  Also very lightweight and not formed to hand.  Be sure it's what you want before transferring a number.  Reactivating is painful!  Not for us, but might work for others.

Reviews.Title: 85 YEARS OLD SENIOR
Reviews.Author: Ismael
Reviews.Content: WE LOVE THE PHONES MANY FEATURES AND THE FACT THAT THE DIAL BOTTONS ARE LARGE BUT WE DID FIND ONE MAYOR PROBLEM THE VIEWING SCREEN IS VERY SMALL AND WE CURRENTLY AND NOT USING THE PHONE BECAUSE OF THAT SO IT SITS ON THE CHARGER NOT BEING USED...

Reviews.Title: One of the best unlocked phones available
Reviews.Author: El Viejo "El Viejo"
Reviews.Content: Although the Snapfon is designed for and marketed to seniors, it is also well suited for an entirely different market:  world travelers.  The phone is both "unlocked" and a quad band phone, which means that it will work on virtually any phone system in the world that uses SIM cards.  Since the phone number is associated with the SIM card and not the phone itself, simply swap out the SIM card to have a local phone number in the US, Mexico, China, New Zealand, London, and most of the rest of the world as well.  Non-US SIM cards are typically inexpensive, usually less than $10 when purchased outside the airport.  As an added bonus, it's also a nice little phone that takes standard Nokia batteries and accessories.

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: stephen alan tramontano
Reviews.Content: Great phone both easy to use and see set-up was a snap. Anyone who wants a simple phone this is for you  .

Reviews.Title: no title
Reviews.Author: djohnst
Reviews.Content: I bought the Snapfon through Amazon.com for my husband, who has low vision. It's basic functionality, large numbered buttons and display, and incredibly loud ring are prefect for him. It is exactly what we were looking for - no frills and no buttons he can push accidently that cost us.

Reviews.Title: Good phone for those with limited sight
Reviews.Author: Susan Acosta "Shadowpins"
Reviews.Content: I have purchased this phone (more than once) for someone who is sight impaired. This appears to be the only phone made that has numbers big enough for sight with limited sight,'The first phone I purchased, a slide came off the side, shortly after purchased, after the warantee had expiredA dog thought the second one was a squeeky toy......We're on our third.  He likes the phone tremendously (so did the dog)

Reviews.Title: Great for mom in the nursing home
Reviews.Author: K. Lehman "Soccer Mom"
Reviews.Content: This phone has worked out so great for my mom in a nursing home.  She had a hard time with the "regular" phones.  She was constantly dropping her phones in the toilet or in the sink full of water and then of course they didn't work.  The SnapFon had an optional lanyard that we ordered and this was the lifesaver.  She now doesn't lose the phone when getting up from her wheelchair.  Also the 911 button on the back, this is a great feature, what I wasn't sure and people should take note, you can DISABLE the text feature and you can program whatever number you want it to call when using the emergency call button.  Mom has severe arthritis, her fingers tend to push things accidentally as she has little control over them, so we programmed the emergency call button to call the nurse's station at the nursing center for help.  We disabled the text option.  So if she accidentally pushes the button, its not calling 911 for non emergencies and its also not texting people in the middle of the night creating a panic for something that isn't a panic.  The big numbers are so helpful to her, she is able to use a knuckle or thumb to push the buttons that we have preprogrammed to help her call with just 1-touch.  The ring tones are SUPER loud, yay!  We did choose one that wasn't terribly obnoxious as she does have a roommate in the nursing home.  She can hear so well on the phone, so even if the phone isn't right on her ear (she doesn't quite get the idea of where the speaker is for the phone since its not like a home phone), but she can still hear because the volume is set at a high enough level, in fact, we were able to turn it down.  I recommended it to my father in law because he can never quite hear the conversation when he's at a fire camp working and the buttons being so large make it easy to make out in the middle of the night when he's woken by a fire call.

Reviews.Title: minimal usage
Reviews.Author: scrabble
Reviews.Content: We use the phone mainly for emergencies, also to call the other when away from home.  Written Instructions were not clear enough but a phone request gave us the basics.

Reviews.Title: Exactly What I Wanted
Reviews.Author: Jerusalem Hill
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Snapfon for my 88 years old mother, who carries it with her even in her own house, just in case of emergencies.  She likes the panic button and the speed dials I have set up for her.  She likes the big screen which stays lighted long enough for her to see if it's me or my brother phoning her.  And she likes the big numbers.  It began to work immediately when I placed the ATT SIM card in it from her previous cell phone, an older one of my own, which gave her (and me) instant confidence in it.  It's exactly what I wanted when I began to look for it.  I can't understand why ATT doesn't offer this phone or something like it when I know there are many customers like me who have extra lines for their elderly loved ones.

Reviews.Title: Good but needs some improvement
Reviews.Author: ppete
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Snafon ezONE-c for a relative who is in her mid 80s . This phone is works pretty well for the most part (had to cover side switches with tape) . I would like to see some well thought out senior friendly improvements in the next model.The prepaid GSM MVNO that she is using has no option to disable text messaging or voicemail. We just want basic voice service.  I hope to switch to another service provider that offers those options.Pros-Large buttonsPanic buttonAvailability of simple drop-in charging standCons-Display (improve it for visually impaired)The menu system is confusing and needs to made simpler for an elderly personNeeds a separate on-off switch or a longer press time for the "end" butting . She has inadvertently turned off the phone ending a call but holding the "end" button too longDurability ? (it doesn't have the durable "feel" of a major brand cell phone and I wonder if it will stand up to being dropped etc.)

Reviews.Title: Awesome little machine!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Not surprisingly, I got this phone for my mother, because her previous $250 phone was on the fritz. And I have to say, I love this thing. I'm 22 years old, and if I didn't need the expanded capabilities of my Nokia smartphone, I would buy another Snapfon for myself! This phone's reception and performance is utterly amazing. My mother hasn't had one dropped call, dead battery or capability issue since we bought it. I will say that the only thing I wish got an upgrade are the menu options/functions. I installed dozens of contacts into the phone, and my mother accidentally deleted all as she was trying to find someone on the list...yeah, I wasn't about to start over, so now she just carries a little phone book in her purse. But other than that, this phone is wonderful. I highly recommend it for anyone who is sick of the fancy-shmancy models that can't hold a call in dense areas to save your life. You could literally be at the bottom of a ditch and I think this thing will still receive and send calls perfectly. Awesome little machine.

Reviews.Title: Snapfon evaluation
Reviews.Author: Donna M. Pinnow
Reviews.Content: I purchased the phone for my 95-year father recently.  I consider the phone to be a good phone purchase for Dad because the buttons are a good size for him to use & are easy to read for him.  The phone is simple enough to understand how to use for someone who, naturally, at this age is not medium-high technology savvy.My only complaints are that there is not a speaker-phone option on the phone nor is there a way to increase the amount of the # of rings before the call rolls into voicemail available on the phone.  Seniors have difficulty hearing well and the speaker-phone helps my Dad immensely and it doesn't register soon enough that it his phone ringing in time for him to get it out of the holster we bought him (which helped) before the call rolls into his voicemail which in my opinion is a wasted feature on this phone.Otherwise, we like the phone & it serves it's purpose of us being able to reach him during the day while he is out doing whatever he wants to do at the retirement community he resides in.

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: Brian Gittins
Reviews.Content: i got this for my brother-in-law, he never leaves the house but sometimes calls family and friends out of state but only like 35 mins a month so he can get service for $10, just like adding a line on most contract plans but it allowed us to get out of our verizon contract and switch to straight talk from walmart for $60 for our 2 phones (we save $70 per month) and hes still paying the same $10 he was with a phone that is more suited to him.. it has large #'s and it even has really cool ring tones like dragnet theme song lol.. just make sure the pure talk service works in your area and it'll be great,, this phone has better signal (4 bars) than my lg chocolate touch did in sanford and fayettville nc with verizon..

Reviews.Title: snapfon for my 85 year old mother
Reviews.Author: Vivian Tannor "vivian"
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my mother to use. It works perfectly with international sim card (we live in Israel). Big buttons are great, loud ring which she can hear. Am thinking of getting the same for my husband (who has no patience for tiny buttons since he has large hands!) Was easy to program speed dial

Reviews.Title: Perfect
Reviews.Author: J. Rodrick
Reviews.Content: This phone is great for my uncle who is visually impaired! Tried many others and they don't come close to measuring up.

Reviews.Title: changes
Reviews.Author: Felo
Reviews.Content: The "new" model is worse than previous one. The display size and numbers were reduced. The product is intended for use for visual handicaps..........so ? We returned it.

Reviews.Title: Agree with J. Norvell
Reviews.Author: Sally A. Quinn
Reviews.Content: I purchased this senior phone, the desktop charger and the lanyard for my 90 year-old mother, who, in addition to suffering from macular degeneration, is forgetful.  The concept is good and this phone is one of the few designed for seniors on the market. Followed J. Norvell's recommendation and went straight to ATT, bought their SIM card and had her home phone ported to the mobile device. The minuses are the fact that the phone is too lightweight, the display is too small for the elderly, it is not foolproof. Somehow my mother has set the phone to reject all calls. The desktop charger is also too small and lightweight for the elderly. This phone needs to be bigger, heavier and with fewer features. Waiting for some manufacturer to get clever and invent a cell phone that looks and feels like a land line.

Reviews.Title: Well Pleased
Reviews.Author: Tenngeezer
Reviews.Content: The product is well priced and seems to be well built. I just wanted a simple phone with big keys, loud and big read out. This phone fits the bill. I plugged in my ATT Sim card and it worked first shot no hassles. The instruction sheet is about 1 page of simple directions instead of a book. I really like not having to sign another contract with ATT. The radio isn't very good and could probably left off to further simplify the phone. The only negative I have is the SOS button - WAY - to easy to hit. This button was supposed to be factory disabled - it wasn't, so I got a visit from a sherriff's deputy when it was accidently pressed.  The SOS button is now disabled - I don't think it is too much of an effort to press 911. They offer a very good unlimited talk/text plan at a really good price to which I am considering changing. Amazon shipped this phone quickly and I'm pleased with the purchase and will probably buy my wife one also.

Reviews.Title: Good, simplified phone. Paerticularly for the elderly
Reviews.Author: SupDoc
Reviews.Content: We bought this phone for my wife's grandmother. It has selectively few, large buttons with a large display. The phone is not as big or bulky as you may fear.

Reviews.Title: Did not work well for my mother
Reviews.Author: Miss Tootie "Miss Tootie"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone for my 82-year old mother.  She finally gave up on trying to use it because it was so complicated for her.  Not at all "Easy to Use" as stated in the description. I gave it two stars because she did like the big, lighted numbers, and the ringer is very loud.  Aside from those pros, she hated it.  The areas on the sides of the phone where she was to hold it are so small that she couldn't help but hit the buttons on the side.  She kept accidentally turning down the volume, and then could not hear people speaking.  I set up her phone book, but it was so complicated for her to actually use the phone book and she had to press so many numbers that she might as well just dial the whole phone number outright anyway.  She previously used an old Nokia phone that has been discontinued.  The Nokia is simple for her to use so I just bought another battery for it online.  The Snapfon was not the right choice for my mother at all.

Reviews.Title: Snapfone
Reviews.Author: Wendy Maschek
Reviews.Content: I bought the Snapfon for my mother and it is exactly what she needed. Large buttons, loud ring and theemergency button works great! The simplicity of usage is great!

Reviews.Title: Exactly Right
Reviews.Author: Paul Gans
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my 92 year old father who suffers from very poor eyesight complicated by hearing problems, as well.  We have programmed the phone with single-digit speed dial numbers, so he is now able to immediately call me or other frequently used numbers.  Additionally, the ring tone is loud enough to wake the dead, the speaker is deafening, and the recharging cradle is effortless.  In short, we have found the phone to be EXACTLY RIGHT for someone in my father's age bracket.

Reviews.Title: Good but needs tweeking
Reviews.Author: sargent pepper
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my husband, he likes it but would like for it to display how many minutes used. Other than that it is easy to use, very straight forward.

Reviews.Title: Visually impaired phone...
Reviews.Author: Gregory C. Dunican "GD in Maine"
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my mother. She is 85 years old and is legally blind. Recently I had to put her in assisted living. I wanted a way that she could contact me. I had ALLOT of trouble finding a phone that was designed for the visually impaired, UNTIL this phone. I bought an AT&T; SIMS card ($8) as I wanted to add her to my AT&T; phone plan. It all worked great together. No problems with activating this phone through AT&T;!! My mother has no difficulty with this phone. Well, sometimes she holds down the end key after talking to me for TOO long and the phone shuts off. A few more lessons on this and all will be fine. Could not speak more highly of a phone designed with site impairment! Well done!

Reviews.Title: Snapfon Great for Seniors
Reviews.Author: Davide
Reviews.Content: This was perfect for my Mother who has difficulty dialing on standard cellphones and who is confused by all of the other options standard cellphones have.  She was able to understand and master it's use immediately.Snapfon ezONE-C Senior Cell Phone with Big Buttons and Easy to Use: Cell Phones & Accessories

Reviews.Title: Simple, Easy Cellphone
Reviews.Author: B. Schehl "P-3Hoser"
Reviews.Content: Purchased for my mother-in-law who is not very technical. She really loves the large buttons and ease of use. I have programmed my cellphone into the speed dial and the Emergency button. (Note - Emergency Button does work with key-lock active - however the only way to stop is to remove battery!!!)
