That was the only thing that I noticed could be a problem.Also, my father-in-law loves the FM radio. He just takes phone on balcony with him and listens without any problems. And battery lasts long time, even with extended radio usage.I would purchase another, very handy phone!

Reviews.Title: My 65 year old dad loves it.
Reviews.Author: K. Fry
Reviews.Content: My tech-challenged dad loves his new phone.  The buttons are huge and the phone's speaker is easy for him to hear.  He appreciates that it comes with such an easy-to-follow instruction manual.  It may not be very intuitive for me to use as an iPhone/Android user, but it's perfect for his needs.  Perfect if you (or a non-tech-savvy loved one) want an easy-to-use phone that is just a phone!

Reviews.Title: snapfon
Reviews.Author: suezjet
Reviews.Content: I think overall it a good phone, I just which the screen and the phone could have better color options..especially for the elderly with bad eye sight.Seems not to work as well with hearing aids or in a noicy area in the background.Everyone at T-mobile including customers were impressed.Which there would be more versions of options ex: easy and simple, just phone, Med. like what it is, Advanced for those who may want to incl internet options.Overall pleased ESPECIALLY being able to have it unlocked.

Reviews.Title: Good Phone -- Less Would Be More
Reviews.Author: knowbd
Reviews.Content: Product is just as it presented and am pleased with what was received. Was able to switch AT&T; SIM card with no problem. Works well and is MUCH simpler than the "senior-friendly" phone sold by AT&T; (how clueless can these people be?!).  For the elderly, I have seen no better option on the market (at least, if you need to work with a recognized national carrier).For our needs (80-something elders), however, the ezOne is still too complex.  An "ezZERO" WITHOUT text messaging and FM radio would be even better.  Getting messages is confusing, but I'm not sure that is something that can be solved with the phone hardware/software design.  Too many button pushes to get to the stored phone number scroll.  A physical on/off switch might be less confusing to some seniors.  A physical switch for QUIET mode (no ring but buzz, not speaker phone, no speak-number dialing) vs. LOUD mode (ring, speaker phone, speak-number dialing) would be nice. For an ezZERO phone, assume a more technologically-savvy family member would set-up the device. Hide the set-up interaction away from day-to-day user... they should never see a "set-up" menu.All-in-all, the phone is a much better design for the elder user... best on the market that I have seen.  It addresses sight and mobility limitations quite well with big numbers and large simplified display.  Still problems for elders with memory/cognition/complexity difficulties.

Reviews.Title: Mixed feelings on this device!
Reviews.Author: C. Peterson
Reviews.Content: I purchased this device for my 60 year old mother, she does not want nor need nor know how to use a Smartphone, and even basic flip phones can be confusing to her.Pros1. Great Screen2. BIG Font for onscreen use3. Big Buttons for dialing.4. Loud speakerphone and when you "can" make a call the sound quality is good.5. Great Battery LifeCons1. Picks up T-Mobile signal terribly, my mothers old Nokia flip phonepicked up at-lest 3-5 bars at all times at her residence, but thisdevice even has NO signal, or 1 bar.2. Feels cheap.Of course being able to use the phone is the most important function, and the device just seemsto have a weak antenna.

Reviews.Title: Great for seniors
Reviews.Author: Michelle Anaya
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my 83 year old father.  For the most part it is very user friendly. It is much better for an elderly person than a standard phone.There are some problems- The phone book is a little difficult to use. There are too many steps between finding a number and placing the call.- The text is too large for the screen, so the top of each name is cut off.

Reviews.Title: Nice phone - but it could be so much better!
Reviews.Author: sailprog
Reviews.Content: As another reviewer wrote, this is a nice phone for a senior but may be overly complicated for an enderly person.There are 3 sliding switches on the side for unnecessary features like a radio and a flashlight. They only served to further confuse my father-in-law. The volume up and down buttons are too easy to press when holding the phone because of their location. The lock switch is hard to slide for someone with a little bit of artritis.When an SMS message arrives (gosh, I wish someone would make a phone that would just *NOT* receive SMS messages!), the keyboard locks until you ack the message by pressing the NO (red) button). But if you press the NO button too long, the phone powers off!The keys are big (good), but a bit plasticky which sometimes leads to missed keystrokes.There have been several cases where the phone apparently didn't ring. However, when it does ring, it is very loud (which is _very_ good).A nice surprise is that the phone supports multiple languages. The spanish voice has a madrileña accent which is warm and easy to understand.The manual has sections in english and spanish. However, as is typical of most chinese manufacturers, it is a real challenge to understand either version as the text often makes no sense whatsoever.The phone does not come with any lanyard so we bought one from Snapfon. It is very overpriced, feels very cheap and worse yet, it separates easily so it is rather useless at keeping the phone around your neck.Note that there are several fairly similar phones out there. The inner parts are probably the same, with only the plastic outside changing.

Reviews.Title: Well, That Works!
Reviews.Author: Jerry
Reviews.Content: This phone does exactly what it says it'll do. There was a little difficulty with getting the SOS button to send text messages, but the customer service folks were very responsive and sent the needed information right away. All functions work correctly now. Great job Snapfon! I definitely would recommend this phone to anyone with an elderly family member.

Reviews.Title: Snapfon ezONE
Reviews.Author: Deltabreezedried
Reviews.Content: Phone is smaller than I had expected, & with the intention of attracting the visually impared, (Audio keys when dialing), the keys & screen are too small to see, & use. Redialing is also tedious for some unknown reason, taking 4 presses of the green call key to complete. Also found a problem with the address book, with same name, different number, isn't easy to pull up on the screen.If your elderly family needs a user friendly phone, this isn't it.

Reviews.Title: The MOM Phone
Reviews.Author: jim in fl.
Reviews.Content: Got this for my 83 yr. old mom and to say she is nontechnical is putting it mildly.But she likes it and keeps it with her all the time. It has big buttons and reads back the number as you dial which she loves. She had a cell phone before but never used it because she had trouble dialing.Now she makes all her calls on it.I like the emergancy call button that you preprogram with four numbers. Makes me feel safer. I highly recommend the MOM phone as we call it.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Phone For Seniors
Reviews.Author: James E. Tudor "Jim"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this on Amazon for 85 year old dad with diabetes who could not use other phones with smaller keys.  This phone fits the bill for those who just want to be able to make calls.

Reviews.Title: Worked well for 2 years
Reviews.Author: Momof4boysNC
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone for my mom 2 years ago. She is legally blind and has been able to operate this phone well on her own.  We programmed the emergency button and sure enough she had to use it one evening.  I just bought a replacement phone for her as her other unit was 2 years old and shutting down unexpectedly.  I would say my mother has well used this phone, she wears it around her neck 24/7.

Reviews.Title: Perfect phone for elderly in-laws
Reviews.Author: Michael Porter
Reviews.Content: In 2011, I helped my in-laws cut the cord from their landline and moved to just a cell.  Initially we purchase the Just5 brand which is almost identical.  They have been happy with it.  However the wall charger cord got cut.  Since I couldn't purchase just a wall charger for that phone, we purchased the Snapfon.  We like the availability of more accessories than the Just5.  Now both my in-laws have their own phones.  My mother-in-law is legally blind but has no trouble answering calls and making calls.  They had no issues activating a line with AT&T; and getting a SIM card.  Put the SIM card in the phone and she was talking on it in minutes.

Reviews.Title: THE SNAPFON PHONE IS OK  WOULD NOT BUY AGAIN
Reviews.Author: Gang
Reviews.Content: I bought two Snapfons and had them shipped to my mother in Florida for use in Jamaica, WI.  She was going on vacation and one phone was for someone living there.  She used it but enjoyed the radio and light most of all.I bought one for myself.The reception was very bad, weak.  I had trouble hearing communicating on it.  It was nice to have the radio and light, but I would prefer to phone to have worked....  My friends phone fell apart, buttons started falling off and just stopped working.

Reviews.Title: Great phone, runaround from AT&T;
Reviews.Author: Larry in Baltimore
Reviews.Content: We bought the Snapfon ezOne-C for an elderly relative who recently moved from his own home into an assisted living facility. The "home" suggested that the local landline carrier would require 4-6 weeks to get a landline installed. We looked into the landline cost and decided that a cell option would be better, faster, cheaper. Turned out to be the right thing to do. After a bit of research we decided that the Snapfon would be the better choice among only a limited set of options for large-button, large-display, minimum-complexity we could find on the internet. Our family carrier (AT&T;) didn't have such a phone available. Amazon delivered the phone in three days - order to arrival! We had decided to add the phone to our AT&T; family plan, so we had to wait until we got the phone before we could register it with AT&T;, based on a conversation with the AT&T; help line - get the phone, call AT&T;, get the new chip in a couple of days, good to go!We received the phone and called AT&T.; The person this time said that to add a phone to our family plan we had to actually purchase a phone from AT&T;! He suggested we could order a smartphone for a dollar, wait for it to be delivered, transfer the line to the Snapfon for a $40 registration fee, and then throw the smartphone away or sell it on eBay. I didn't believe it either!So, the same afternoon I visited the local AT&T; wireless retail outlet. There I was able to get the Snapfon registered on the spot, with a $40 charge for the new registration and no smartphone - what a deal! Since then, the phone has been great. Our 95-year-old relative has been completely satisfied. The second day he had the phone, he needed to contact a staff member for assistance. His "lifeline" - a red cord connected to a switch on the wall - had fallen on the floor and he couldn't reach it. He called me on his Snapfon (my phone number is one of the few he has memorized), I called the home, and they were at his door in a couple of minutes. We now have the home's number programmed on the 3 key (1 is messages, 2 is 911).Numbers on both keys and display are large and bright enough that he has no trouble seeing them with his compromised vision, and the phone audibly repeats each number as it is pressed. His major remaining issue is that he almost always forgets to press the red hang-up button - with his old land-line phone it disconnected when he returned the handset to the cradle. This wastes a minute or so of talk time while the system detects hang-up at the other end of the connection - an issue common to any cell phone.

Reviews.Title: Love my phone
Reviews.Author: Happy
Reviews.Content: I love my Snapfon ezONE-C Senior Cell Phone.  I fought getting a cell phone but my family insisted.  I needed one that I could see and hear with no frills. It has large numbers, I can hear it and it is simple.  It took this 85 year old a little time to figure it all out but once I got it working I was and am still pleased.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: wdsome
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone for my mother-in-law. I also bought the desktop charger and lanyard. It is very easy to use and light enough to wear around the neck with the lanyard. The features with, FM radio and built-in flaslight with the recessed key for emergency dial and one button dialing are great. My mother-in-law has a vision problem, so the only shortcoming I feel is the lack of raised numbers. The 5 number has a raised dimple on it. I glued plastic jewels on the answer and end keys, this helped her to answer the phone without even looking at the keypad. The plastic jewels and the raised dimple on the 5 number also gave her the ability to dial without looking at the keyboard. I would recommend this phone for a senior.

Reviews.Title: Just what we needed...
Reviews.Author: hummingbird
Reviews.Content: This phone is ideal for my elderly mother.  When her old Nokia phone (which we really liked with it's large profile and large keypad)quit working, I purchased her a new phone from our local carrier but the phone was too small.  In fact, she couldn't use it so I had to return it which began my quest for an alternative.  Thank goodness for Snapfon!  It is simple to use with a large keypad and backlit screen.  It is easy to find the volume controls on the side.  The lanyard which I purchased separately was a must and I'm so thankful Snapfon makes it available as, before, mom's cell phone would easily get misplaced.  Not so anymore.  When I took Snapfon to my local carrier to have the SIM card switched over from her Nokia, the representative was astonished at the quality of the Snapfon and said he was going to recommend it to his customers who are looking to purchase for the elderly person in mind because he realized there is no better alternative for elderly cell phone users at this time.  I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: good phone
Reviews.Author: Cleve O. Brown
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone for my for husband because he wanted one that had an easy to use dial.  The only thing I don't like is how hard it is to get any information out of the phone.  To many steps to put in contacts and check voice mail, but it works for an emergency phone for my husband.

Reviews.Title: simple, but could be simpler for the elderly
Reviews.Author: logan
Reviews.Content: Wish someone would design a cell phone for the elderly that is designed like a land line handset.My mom (83) keeps turning the phone off instead of simply hanging up.  She is frustrated that the voice volume can't be increased, as she is having trouble hearing people. She has no interest in the light or radio, but they don't cause a problem being there.  I still need to read the directions and teach her how to pick up voice messages.  I have some problem hearing her as I believe she may have the microphone pressed against her cheek.  A longer design would help that.  We bought this for her assisted living apartment.  A land line would have been $40 per month plus $.90 per minute for long distance.  That said, it does work, the buttons are large enough for her to see, and we were able to add her to our AT&T; plan for much less than $40 per month.

Reviews.Title: good points, some challenges
Reviews.Author: Donna Price
Reviews.Content: On the whole, it's a great phone for seniors.At 93, anything new to learn is a challenge.  After 2 long lessons, I think my mother may get it, but she wants a cheat sheet to remind her, since she only uses it for emergencies.The one flaw is the way the speaker is engaged.  My mother is extremely hearing impaired and wears 2 hearing aids.  She can only hear voices with the speaker.  On snapfon, my she has to answer the phone in the regular way.  Since she can't hear on the phone, she has hope her caller can hear her tell them to hold on while she puts them on the speaker, then hold the ZERO button for a few seconds which emits a loud tone that the caller hears before the speaker is engaged. Once connected it is  tricky to get the caller's voice to be loud enough without getting reverb.It isn't perfect, but it will certainly work in an emergency and you can't beat the monthly fees.The good points are the numbers are large, it is relatively simple, has a flashlight which we have used and an SOS button.

Reviews.Title: Snapfon ezONE
Reviews.Author: J. Smith
Reviews.Content: For the price, I was disappointed in the quality of the phone.  It was very light and looked cheap.  I hope it holds up.  Customer service was only available during working hours.  The phone was very easy for me to teach my mother to use.  The big numbers are a plus and she liked the flashlight.

Reviews.Title: Very good Cell phone
Reviews.Author: Francisco Moggio Palacios
Reviews.Content: It is an excellent cell phone for senoir people. It is very easy to use and to carry and is very cheap

Reviews.Title: WONDERFUL  TO  HAVE
Reviews.Author: azian mama
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my mother and she loves it. She doesn't have the best sight so the big numbers is a PLUS and the SOS feature is really nice to have. It is really nice to know that all she would have to do is just hit one button in case of an emergency. We also like the size of the phone...it is not bulky or too small. (JUST PERFECT) We don't have anything bad to say about this, so if you are looking for a phone that is easy to use, easy to deal with, and is SIMPLE, then this would be your PERFECT PHONE! Thank you Snapfon!!

Reviews.Title: Everything is good except
Reviews.Author: alvie
Reviews.Content: It does look like it was made of cheap plastic. The build quality of the phone is not the highest, but it is really extremely senior-friendly. my 90-year old professor seemed to like it, found it easy to use and compact to carry in his suitcase. $60 is slightly over-priced, but it doesn't have a competitor that matches so you are stuck with that price!

Reviews.Title: Nice Phone.  Good Customer Service.
Reviews.Author: ugot2begood "music_junkie"
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these phones:  one for my mother and one for a friend.  My mother's worked beautifully with her T-Mobile Sim Card.  Although my mother had prohibited us from giving her amy presents this Christmas, she gladly accepted the phone once she saw it.  She can read the numbers and buttons without using her reading glasses, which is what I want her to be able to do if she has an emergency!With the second phone, my friend told me she was not able to get her T-mobile SIM card to work in the phone.  My mother's T-mobile SIM card, however, worked great!The company accepted my return of the 2nd phone and promptly credited my account.  I appreciated this as there may be nothing wrong with the phone.I like this phone so much, and am so impressed with the customer service, I may get one myself.

Reviews.Title: Snappfon ezONE-C Senior Cell Phone
Reviews.Author: ecc
Reviews.Content: This is an easy to use cell phone for our senior parent. The numbers are easy to see and the voice prompt is an additional plus. The SOS button is an addition that allows for peace of mind for both our senior and us. The flash light and radio are also nice features. We entered important numbers and set up the plan with Snapfon. It was easy and very competitive. Thanks for a simple but effective product.

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: james
Reviews.Content: I LIKE EVERY THING ABOUT THE PHONE I INJOY MY RADIO WHILE WAITING ON TIMES I AM SITTING  WORKS GRATE WITH THE EAR PLUG PLUG IS LIKE AN ANTINA MAKES RADIO MORE CLEAR LOVE THE BIG NUMBERS  AND THE INCOMMING SOUNDS ARE GRATE ONLY THING IS THE INSIDE SCREEN BRAKES VERRY EZ  PHONE FELL FROM MY LAP ON A WOOD FLOOR BROKE THE INSIDE SCREEN AND CAN NOT FINE ANY LOCAL SHOP IN MY AREA AUSTIN TX WHO CANE FIX THE PHONE  NO ONE HAS PARTS NOW I CANT SEE TEXT , PHONE NUMBERS ARE CALLER I D MAY HAVE TO BUY A NEW PHONE

Reviews.Title: Perfect for Mother
Reviews.Author: Gooddaughter
Reviews.Content: Mother received this phone as a gift for Christmas.  It is her first cell phone ever so it will take a little while toadjust but she loves it.  I am impressed with the emergency button (even though she wears life alert),the flashlight andradio.  Mom's hearing isn't good so the volume and loud ring is good, as are the large buttons.  Will she like it in 6 months?We'll see.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Jeanne
Reviews.Content: The phone is great. It was just what I need for my husband.He can see the number and hear the phone ring now. Thanksfor creating a phone like this for elder people. I likethat he got the car plug free. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: senior phone
Reviews.Author: SL
Reviews.Content: I loved this phone.  I got it for my 92 yo mom.  I had an at&t;  pay as you go sim card and itslipped right in and worked the first time.  No worries.  Even the numbers she had stored were still there.  My mom had stopped using her previous cell because she could not hear out of it, and had trouble with the buttons.  This one has big buttons, easy to push, easy to understand.  The sound quality was great.  She can hear even though she is a little hard of hearing.  We can hear her as well, so life is good.  I bought the lanyard and charging station to make things easier for her.  She loves the charging station....doesn't take time to try and find where to plug it in.

Reviews.Title: Great Simple Phone
Reviews.Author: C. Lambert "Card's fan"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone for my mom who is 75 and has had problems hearing on other phones. She can hear great on this phone and can hear it ring too. Love the nostalgic ring tones

Reviews.Title: Pros and Cons for Snapfon ezONE-C Senior Cell Phone
Reviews.Author: Bob H
Reviews.Content: I bought this cell phone for my wife who has hearing and sight (legally blind) difficulties.  Overall, she's very pleased with the purchase.Pros:- The buttons are very easy to see and use.  They have a good tactile response.- The phone is indeed unlocked.  I popped the CIM card (ATT purchased from Amazon for $6)out of her old phone and put it in the Snapfon and it worked immediately.- The antenna sensitivity is quite good (important in our rural area).- The sound quality is also very good, both incoming and outgoing.- The setup was reasonably easy as you would expect from a cell phone with very few features.Cons:- No speaker phone option.  Since it already has a speaker for the audible keys, you would think that a speaker phone option would be automatic.- No usb interface.  This would be nice for adding a unique ring tone or syncing a phone book.- The FM radio feature is pretty useless.  Poor sensitivity and bad sound.Bottom line: It's very useable for easily sending and receiving calls and texts.

Reviews.Title: Works with Telcel in Mexico
Reviews.Author: O. B. Gaxiola
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my Mom. It feels better constructed as I expected. Works fine with the Telcel SIM card we bought in a convenience store.I just wouldn't ever use this for text messaging, it is somewhat bothersome.Otherwise, It's a perfect fit for my mom's needs. Now we can reach her when she's out.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for seniors
Reviews.Author: K. Vancura
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased this phone for my husband's elderly parents & was pleased to find that the glowing reviews of this product were accurate.  The parents appreciate the talking keys function, as well as large buttons & display.  They also appreciate the simple menu the phone has; they didn't want anything too complicated.  The only thing I would improve would be a slightly more detailed instruction manual, but the one that comes with the phone is adequate for anyone familiar with computers.  I highly recommend this phone, especially at the very reasonable price I got it at.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Mark L. "texas2step"
Reviews.Content: This phone is very easy to use and as you can see from the pictures, it has a big keyboard and large numbers and letters on the screen. It connected seamlessly to our ATT account. It has various ring tones over a wide spectrum of sounds so that the hearing impaired can find a tone that suits them. It is lightweight. The built in flash light is a plus. All in all, a good phone for seniors.

Reviews.Title: Mom can use this phone easily!
Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: Mom has had very little trouble learning to use this phone.  She is calling me on it and answering it when I call.  With the holder we bought, she also carries it around with her.  Everything about it is made for the elderly in mind.  Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Snapfon for Mom
Reviews.Author: G-Man
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my 84 year old mother.  Simple, basic features and a good loud speaker.  Just what the doctor ordered.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for elders. Make sure to take rebate from seller
Reviews.Author: SF
Reviews.Content: Its a great phone & as per description. My mom wanted a simple phone & this is the simplliest one that i could find. It has all these side keys for lock, flashlight, volume & radio so you dont have to keep on looking at the settings menu. The speaker is also very loud & clear. I would say its worth it for senior citizen but make sure you check out snapfon website & know their current rebates on the phone before ordering.

Reviews.Title: Great basic mobile phone
Reviews.Author: HoneyDoShopper
Reviews.Content: I do not want a phone with all the bells and whistles. I just want a basic mobile phone and a reasonable monthly rate for 100 minutes or so. This fits the bill perfectly. I also bought the desk-top battery charger. The phone looks great sitting on my desk and it is always charged up and ready to go. I have it on a wall switch so it is only charging when I turn on the power strip to the desk in my home office, but it is more than enough charging time for it. When fully charged, a green light goes on and it trickle charges. Works great! I am not using the FM radio or the emergency button, just the phone features.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for poor eyesight
Reviews.Author: Chris E. Pettus
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my father who has some trouble seeing the small numbers on a standard cellphone.  I inserted the SIM card from his prepaid AT&T; cellphone and the Snapfon worked right away.  The numbers are large and easy for him to read and the ringer is nice and loud.  It took him a couple of days to realize how to lock the keypad with the switch on the side to prevent the phone from accidentally calling from his cellphone holder.  I don't think he uses the FM radio function but the LED light is a nice bonus since it helps him read in low light situations.

Reviews.Title: That's the one...
Reviews.Author: Y. Chih
Reviews.Content: This is the one I am looking for...My mom loves it! Excellent quality and easy to operate. And the 4-band / unlock spec will be a great convenience for traveling around the world.

Reviews.Title: Decent choice for an underserved market
Reviews.Author: M. Hook
Reviews.Content: Bought for my 93-year-old grandmother.  She finds the 4 switches arrayed around the sides a bit confusing (already she has switched on the flashlight a couple of times by accident and run the battery down) and the FM radio might have better been left off (can't pick up much without a headset anyway) but overall it is serving her pretty well.She has very low vision and can't plug in a micro-usb plug so the Nokia-style round post charging plug is very welcome.  I also bought the charging dock and that facilitates easy charging for her quite a bit.It is pretty small and feels a bit flimsy but it's a 60-dollar cell phone.  Works great with AT&T; service and overall I would recommend it for older folks who need to stay in touch.  The SOS button works as advertised and that could come in really handy as well.

Reviews.Title: incoming call can not be heard!
Reviews.Author: MobilityO
Reviews.Content: Phones speaker was not working out the box! This was a replacement for the other snapfon which stopped charging after a year.

Reviews.Title: dissatisfied with snapfon eztwo
Reviews.Author: john m sandoval
Reviews.Content: I own a snapfon eztwo.It is useless - sometimes, I get calls and it does not ring .I get missed call notices, because sometimes it does not ring.I get wavering, unintelligable sounds at the beginning of a call.Sometimes I try to call and it does not work at all, as if the battery is low,I charge it for eight hours and it is erratic!I am trashing it - buying a more expensive, workable phone!Snapfon should not manufacture such a worthless un useable phone.When I make or receive a call I cannot hear the voice - I have to put it on"free hand" to hear the voice.Guess I have to send it in for repair or return.addition;The phone is OK I just have to get used to all the trickery to use it.

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware! Worse phone ever... Chinese junk
Reviews.Author: S. Hart "S. Hart"
Reviews.Content: This is by far the worse phone I have ever tried. I bought one for my 58 year old mother who hated it! I hate it! For anyone looking for an "easy to use" cell phone for seniors STAY AWAY FROM SNAPFON. I even tried snapfon ezone and it was worse. Im gonna keep looking. Buyer beware... NOT, easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Mom's in Love again
Reviews.Author: Vinny
Reviews.Content: I bought the phone for my mom because (according to her) the ones they sell at the AT&T; places are made for people with good eyesight and hearing. She has been divorced for the past 10 years and said that she would never find something to love again. Well, I think she found it with this phone. She is absolutely crazy over it. Now she calls people just so she could use the phone. Nice package - thanks again.

Reviews.Title: Phone did not work!
Reviews.Author: Craig Stout
Reviews.Content: I was extremely disappointed after buying this seemingly well featured phone for my Dad's 89th birthday. We went to AT&T; to buy the SIM card and found the phone did not work! The number 9 would not work at all and when pressing number 5,it repeatedly entered multiple 5's. the phone was a disaster.  Great concept, poor quality control.

Reviews.Title: Not that good for seniors
Reviews.Author: dunegoon
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my 96 year old father to replace his Motorola cell phone because it was becoming difficult to operate.  He just no longer has the dexterity to use small buttons and open and close the flip-style phone. The Snaphon looked like a good idea but it was actually more difficult to operate.  The main problem is that the volume control is on the left edge and this is exactly where you need to hold the phone to answer and place calls.  When he tried to use the phone, there was seldom any sound level because the volume was often turned down by accident.  Another problem is the complexity of the address book.  Several steps are needed to traverse the menus to the phone book application and place a call. It is overly complex and is not as easy to use as the old Motorola phone.I hope to get a refund, I sent it back to Amazon with a note stating it was not as described (not easy to use).

Reviews.Title: Phone is good for seniors.
Reviews.Author: Everest
Reviews.Content: Phone is good for seniors. that is all i can say. this is very simple and easy to use.. would recommend to seniors.

Reviews.Title: Not so senior-friendly.
Reviews.Author: Joo
Reviews.Content: The lock-key pad slider switch at the right side is so hard to operate in general specially for an elderly person. I had to return it due to this. Hope the company will see this comment to re-design their product.

Reviews.Title: Works in Latin America
Reviews.Author: Adolfo Sanchez M
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a cellphone that my father who is 80 years old could use easylly. I have seen other brands but this one is quad-band so it will work with practically every carrier. I just inserted the chip sim and it started inmedatly so there is no to insert the pin code.The only cons of this cellphone are that the call sound is to loud and you can't change it, and that there is no way to change the languange.

Reviews.Title: not great
Reviews.Author: sandra kohler
Reviews.Content: This phone does not have great reception.  My mother has a hard time hearing on it.  If you do not hold the phone just right it is difficult to understand the person on the other end, even if your not a senior.

Reviews.Title: Please beware of this product. A warning from the son of a Senior.
Reviews.Author: SnapFon Purchaser
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my elderly mother. Out of the box it felt loose and of rather poor quality. Similar to a plastic toy. I assumed it just needed to have the battery put in it to give it some heft. I got the battery in it and charged it up. We got the phone set up and began testing it. I followed the instructions and could not get the SOS button to function at all. I figured I had done something wrong. I called tech support and a guy obviously in a home office answered. Just as he answered I happened to flip on the flashlight button and it didn't come on. Again I thought I was doing something wrong so I started out by simply asking him how to turn on the flashlight before I got into the more complicated SOS button question. He said, "push the button up and down a couple times", so I did. I told him it was fully charged and the phone was turned on. His response was, "I guess it don't work". I politely told him the phone was of such bad quality I would just return it and didn't need him to next tell me that the SOS button that may be needed to save my mother's life also "don't work."A phone specifically designed for seniors needs more than big buttons, a loud speaker volume, and an Andy Griffith ring tone. It needs to be at least as well made and a prepaid Walmart phone and functional. Stay clear of this phone. I suspect they just want you on their cell service and want to sell you their badly made accessories to use with their badly made phone. Frankly seniors deserve more respect than this.

Reviews.Title: It does not work, keep asking insert sim, even sim already in!
Reviews.Author: Edison "hightech lover"
Reviews.Content: I had ATT sim phone for few years, so I know sim card. When this phone kept displaying "insert Sim", I tried check and recheck, the sim card inserted exactly matching the description and picture.  However, the phone kept showing "Insert Sim". I currently use Verizon phone, so I don't have a sim card to try if the problem was sim card.I have to return this phone and order another one, wait for another few days. It is disappointing the manufacture did not test its preducts completely.Two stars for it does sound pretty loud. That is the reason I am trying to get this phone for my mother.After returned the phone, I ordered another one. This time, the phone seems working with 1 bar signal strength. However, having ordered one before, I can tell this package was not new. Someone already opened it and it did not packed as well as factory new.  I don't know why they ship the returned product as new one.  I will find out later, if this phone working in Australia.  No matter what, it missed the Holiday for me to give it to my mother as a present.

Reviews.Title: Good tech support not so good product...
Reviews.Author: map
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone for my 86 year old mother who lives in another state.  When it arrived she liked all the features it had, hearing aide user friendly, large buttons, an emergency button, etc.  However, the phone did not function as expected so she contacted the company that sells it and was able to get tech support who determined that there was something wrong with the phone.  They suggested returning it to the vender (Amazon).  I can say that her experience with their tech support was satisfactory however since the phone didn't work I gave it the lowest rating.

Reviews.Title: Activating this phone is a royal pain in the arse
Reviews.Author: Fay N. Prozora "Bookjudger"
Reviews.Content: I tried and tried to get this phone activated and could not get it going. I was supposed to get free activation and added minutes and the like, at least according to the activation kit that came with the phone. I got the $14.95 plan but I had to pay the activation fee and they charged me for a 2nd phone on top of that. Tomorrow I'm going to call the snapfon people and tell them to take the charge for the 2nd phone off my account. I should not have had to pay for the activation fee or the 2nd phone. But on the other hand there will be another phone if this one gets lost or misplaced. I'm not sure about this co. but that was ridiculous to have to pay for another phone when I just got this one today. I emailed customer service so we'll see what happens. I can't really give a review because I have not tried to call any one as yet so will do that tomorrow. Will see how things go but it is nice I can change providers if things don't work out. Thank you

Reviews.Title: Quality is good. My 82 yr.old dad had no patients. Too many buttons to press before the call. I'm out of 90.00, my dad threw it
Reviews.Author: Jean
Reviews.Content: out. He needs an easy braile big button loud cell phone. The radio & lock is unnecessary for my dad.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't use it because the back wouldn't come off
Reviews.Author: Nobody
Reviews.Content: I phoned the company for help in getting the back cover off the battery compartment, but the instructions were no help. Nor was the online video they have to show how to remove the back. It absolutely would not budge despite my using all my strength and trying for at least a half hour.When I talked to customer service at Snapfon, the rep told me they don't check the backs of the ones sold through Amazon to make sure they'll open, but if the phone is bought directly from them, they do check the back before sending it out. That made no sense to me. Wish I had paid more attention to other review that mentioned the problem getting the phone open. It would have saved me the trouble having to return it.Also, like others, the Pure Talk sim card was not included in the package (not that it mattered since I couldn't use the phone anyway).My impression of the phone otherwise is that it looks and feels like a toy.

Reviews.Title: key number 7 is not working properly
Reviews.Author: L. R. Purba
Reviews.Content: For some reason, key number 7 is not working properly. When I press that key, it stays pressed. In order to use the phone, I have to be very careful to press that key.Since my mother is going to use it, she is 76 years old, so it is kind of difficult for her.I hate to give you a bad review, but that's the fact. Other than that, everything is as advertised.

Reviews.Title: They Got It Just Right
Reviews.Author: Wayne Eason
Reviews.Content: They got it exactly right., April 11, 2012Amazon Verified Purchase(What's this?)This review is from: Snapfon ezONE-C Senior Cell Phone with Big Buttons and Easy to Use: Cell Phones & Accessories (Wireless Phone Accessory)After a month of use I am completely satisfied with my Snapfon ezONE phone. It is as easy to use a regular desk phone and has big, lighted keys, a large high-contrast very readable display (even outdoors in bright light), and plenty of ringer and speaker volume. An unexpected bonus for me is, that at my residence, I have a consistent four-bar signal strength whereas my previous phones the signal strength just vacillated between zero and one. The phone is attractive in appearance, light weight, easy to carry and the battery charge also lasts longer than my previous phones.The emergency button feature is also well thought out and should eliminate the need for the expense of the "I've fallen and can't get up devices." The built in LED flash light is another handy item as is the built-in FM radio that would be very desirable in a disaster situation.The operational menu is straight forward, simple and intuitive to use. Other than the keypad there are only 3 big clearly marked buttons to deal with. The keypad lock, flashlight, volume and FM radio are controlled by four separate switches located on the sides of the case.I cannot think of one negative thing to say about this phone It is one of those rare cases where a need was identified and a device designed and built to fulfill that need and they got it exactly right. I would recommend this phone to anyone and I hope they sell millions of them.

Reviews.Title: very easy to use
Reviews.Author: Marisa
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my mother. Great, simple to use, phone, easy to understand how to use. The numbers on this phone are really big. The SOS button on the back is a great feature that can be programed to dial my number for example and send Text to additional phone numbers.

Reviews.Title: Lessons learned
Reviews.Author: Techman
Reviews.Content: I had some problems with the power and menu buttons until I learned that the power button has to be held down for 4 seconds before it turns on the phone, and the menu button won't always respond if pressed in the middle.  You need to press it at the the bottom to get into the menu.

Reviews.Title: quit working after a week.
Reviews.Author: D. Poffinbarger "engineer"
Reviews.Content: The phone quit working after one week.  It was a gift for my 86 year old dad so he could take it with him or speed dial family members.  He had never used a cell phone before.  So there was some "learning curve".  Unfortunately, he just couldn't get the hang of using the middle toggle button for speed dialing.  Since it quit working, I will try to return it.  Will update this after I see how that goes.

Reviews.Title: Great for seniors!
Reviews.Author: crh
Reviews.Content: Very good telephone for a non tech savvy senior with failing eyesight.No frills but a great "basic" telephone. Try it!

Reviews.Title: Relief to find a phone for a senior
Reviews.Author: B. Kessler
Reviews.Content: This phone really fills a needed niche. We got one for my mother-in-law, who appreciates the simplicity and larger buttons. She's in her 90s and just doesn't have the dexterity to use a small or flip phone. The phone seems sturdy, is still pocket sized (for a large pocket) and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: Very good phone, a few minor bugs, excellent customer service!
Reviews.Author: Bob
Reviews.Content: I am not a senior citizen.  I purchased this phone because I want a cel phone that is mainly just a phone.  If I want to access the Internet, then I use a computer or laptop with a regular keyboard.Additionally, for me, a cel phone is for the car.  No, I don't regularly yak on a phone when I should be paying attention to the road -- I just like having the phone in the car in case I'm running late for something and I have to call ahead, or if I need to call for help.  I occasionally take the phone with me if I'm expecting an important call -- or if the car is being serviced and I'm waiting for a call from the mechanic -- but I have no need to walk around, oblivious to the world around me, constantly talking on a cel phone.Since they no longer make permanent-mount car phones anymore, this phone is the next best thing.  The same things that make it good for senior citizens also make it good for the car -- big buttons, easy to read display, and no complex menus.  I bought the car charger with the phone, and I also made a docking station for it that allows me to have it mounted in the car -- it would be nice if a car docking station with speaker phone was an accessory you could order, especially since the phone doesn't have Bluetooth.So, why 4 stars instead of 5?  Because there are a few minor design flaws, mainly with setting the volume of the ringer and keypad tones.  The instruction manual decribes the procedures to change the volume of the ringer and keypad tones from a set-up menu, and when you follow those steps, the display indicates that your changes are saved... but they are not!Customer service was extremely helpful and friendly in helping me figure this out.  It turns out that, those menu selections to change the ringer and keypad volume settings just do not work on this version of the phone.  To change the ringer volume, you just use the volume buttons on the side of the phone when you're not on a phone call, and then hit the green OK button when you're done.  As for the keypad tones -- as of now, there is no way to actually change the volume of the keypad tones, but that isn't really a big deal.Another oddity is that, when I first charged it and set the clock, the time and date erased and needed to be reset after I simply turned the phone off and then back on.  After that, the time and date continued to work no matter how many times I turned the phone off and on.  Customer service confirmed that this, too, is a minor design flaw for this version of the phone, and not just a defect on my phone.Finally, if you receive a text message, sometimes the characters of the message are broken up in an odd way when you scroll through the message.  Once again, customer service confirmed that this is normal.  I hardly ever send a text, but my prepaid phone account sends me a text with my remaining balance after each call, so it is nice to have text messaging capability on the phone.As for the phone itself, it works fine.  I was able to put in my AT&T; SIM card for my prepaid account, and once I had AT&T; unlock the SIM card, it worked right away.  Calls are clear, and the battery life is great!  The other features, such as the FM radio and flashlight, are easy to use and nice to have.  So far, the phone works just as advertised -- reliable and easy to use.  As I said above, it would be nice if the company made a car-mount docking station with hands-free speaker phone for it.

Reviews.Title: Good senior cell phone
Reviews.Author: E. Stinson
Reviews.Content: This is a good starter cell phone for a senior. I got this for my tech phobic mother an she actually is using it.  Lately however she is advancing in her abilities and is using texting more as she is a little hearing challenged.  I can see getting her a phone which is better suited for texting in the near future.

Reviews.Title: Easy to read display and fairly simple to use
Reviews.Author: MaryEtta
Reviews.Content: The phone was purchased for my 90 year old mother and is her first cell phone. She is pleased with the sound quality, the large keys and display, and the features. However, the written instructions are not very clear and if we did not have cell phone experience to help her as she learned to use the phone, it would have been very difficult for her.  All in all, we feel like this was a great choice, though.

Reviews.Title: Great!!!
Reviews.Author: lorelar
Reviews.Content: My mom is happy, great performance, the unblocked worked in southamerica. especial for seniors is really!!, buttons are good size, is very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: STUPEDELY MADE
Reviews.Author: Ari "Arka3"
Reviews.Content: Purchased this phone for my 90 years father. Before he has Snapfon 1 and was happy. This one has the better display and accessoires, but one thing is made very stupidly - it is a volume button. They located this button right where should be your fingers when you grab the phone and my father definitely push the button and minimise the speacker level - he can't hear me. The second problem - when you push this button you are not changing the voice level ( like in other phones), just ring tone level. To change voice level, you have to be on call with somebody and just during the call could change the level - stupid!!!

Reviews.Title: Senior cell phone
Reviews.Author: Patricia Stone
Reviews.Content: Most reasonable price and very useful for  a senior  in a wireless home. The large buttons are great for her arthritic fingers.

Reviews.Title: Recommended
Reviews.Author: Stan Bennett
Reviews.Content: very satisfied...easy to read...easy set up...good range...good battery life...delivered when indicated...price was reasonable...color was nice...construction is satisfactory and I would recommend to others

Reviews.Title: Nice and HUGE!
Reviews.Author: Lara M. Lichten
Reviews.Content: Gramma loves her new phone. The buttons and numbers on the screen are nice and big. Simple and large menu. Easy-to-press&hold; speed-dials. The speakerphone could still be a bit louder, but as it is, this phone is probably much louder than any of the other phones out there on the market that we've tried for her.

Reviews.Title: Recommended
Reviews.Author: Stan Bennett
Reviews.Content: very satisfied...easy to read...easy set up...good range...good battery life...delivered when indicated...price was reasonable...color was nice...construction is satisfactory and I would recommend to others

Reviews.Title: Nice and HUGE!
Reviews.Author: Lara M. Lichten
Reviews.Content: Gramma loves her new phone. The buttons and numbers on the screen are nice and big. Simple and large menu. Easy-to-press&hold; speed-dials. The speakerphone could still be a bit louder, but as it is, this phone is probably much louder than any of the other phones out there on the market that we've tried for her.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use Snapfon
Reviews.Author: Duane
Reviews.Content: My wife is both visually and hearing impaired. We needed a phone that would help us feel safe when I was not around.  We found it with the Snapfon ezTwo.  Iet is easy to use, compact and it has the features that my wife can operate with confidence. The battery has a long life and it charges quickly and is compact in size.She likes it very much.

Reviews.Title: Love this phone!!
Reviews.Author: Karen L. Dovel Parker
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my Mom who has macular degeneration and her hearing isn't the best. If the lighting isn't just right she can't see the numbers but can feel them and fast dial at least 9 people that are in her phone. I love the 911 button on the back of the phone, which now has 3 numbers programmed into it. When she hits the button, my brother, husband and I all receive a text saying that Mom has an emergency and needs our help. Her phone alarm is very loud, hopefully to attract attention. She has a good connection, as we are with T-Mobile whose tower is just down the road and up the hill:) I'm thrilled that this phone is  available for her and helps her stay more independent.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Arlie Elliott
Reviews.Content: My husband does not use his phone for anything but calls.  He can use this phone easily and the screen is large and the keypad is large and ideal for him.  Good purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great for Seniors
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: I purchased for my 84 year old mother.  She wears hearing aids and we have not been able to find a phone that she can hear and understand the other party on until now.  I can now speak with her and she will actually understand what I am saying!  Also, she is VERY technically challenged.  I did have to explain to her several times about locking the keys and how to make calls, but she finally got it.  Did I mention that she is VERY technically challenged.  This is the only cellular phone which I have found that she can use and hear with plus it is packed with extra features like when her battery is running low, it will automatically text me.  Great buy and worked fine with our existing AT&T; plan.

Reviews.Title: Good phone for parent
Reviews.Author: Zhang Zhang
Reviews.Content: Big button, big screen and big noise, my parent wouldn't miss a call even they are on BART or other public places.

Reviews.Title: Terrible sound quality
Reviews.Author: Mom of Preemies
Reviews.Content: Purchased the phone, desktop charger and case for my father who had a stroke.  Tried it out for a day so I could see how it worked.  4 out of 6 calls were bad - could not hear callers, they could not understand me.  Garbled and full of static.  Tried in several different settings so a "bad cell area" was not the issue.  Also had an issue with the desktop charger.  It would not accept the charging plug.  Broken upon receipt.  Saw these issues in a few other customer reviews but not all so I thought I'd roll the dice.  Lastly, the case fit the phone but it it was hard to get the side button to work when it was on - especially the volume buttons.  All products would have done nothing but frustrate my elderly father so they were promptly returned.

Reviews.Title: Defective phone
Reviews.Author: Marion
Reviews.Content: This phone is defective: from day one of receiving this telephone (March 6) the speed dial feature did not work;the SOS contact settings feature did not work; and by May 6, 2014, I could no longer hear the callers voiceswhile the callers could hear me.  I am now stuck with a bad product after just two months as Amazon returnpolicy expired after one month.  This is truly a shame and just bad business.  I hope the Nokia X2 phone I orderedfrom Amazon yesterday will not be of a similar experience.

Reviews.Title: Would have been great if...............
Reviews.Author: Chicago   Al
Reviews.Content: ..... this phone was more durable and was easier to access or scroll through the names & numbers. If I recall, you have to press a certain button to access the directory before you can scroll down or up for the person or place you want to call.

Reviews.Title: Good for people with hearing or sight difficulties
Reviews.Author: Bett Sundermeyer
Reviews.Content: My mother likes to use her cellphone to make long distance calls to her friends.  However, most phones are so small she was having problems seeing the buttons.  She doesn't want all the other functions like text or email, she can't figure out how to use them.  She just wanted a phone.  She is also hard of hearing and has a lot of problems hearing through most phones--she usually uses the speakerphone on her landline.  I bought her equipment that was supposed to amplify the sound in her old cell phone but it did not work.  I bought her this phone last Christmas and she has told me several times that she LOVES this phone.  It is LOUD enough for her to hear without the speakerphone on (although the speakerphone is REALLY loud too), and she can see the large numbers on it.  All in all, it has been really good for her.

Reviews.Title: It is what is said it was.
Reviews.Author: Sam L Atkinson
Reviews.Content: The Snapfon ezTwo Senior cell phone is easy to dial, see the display, lock/unlock keys.  It advertised a FM radio on to left side but came with a camera in that location which is fine.  Deleting old messaged and voice mail is a little too hard for my senior user but it work great overall.

Reviews.Title: Best senior phone
Reviews.Author: mjk
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my mom(88). Very easy for her to see and easy set-up. Nice and loud ring. So far I see no problems.

Reviews.Title: They work!
Reviews.Author: Andree M. Robert "Andree"
Reviews.Content: My 90+ inlays are able to use these phones in spite of macular degeneration, arthritis and other ailments. Whoever thought of these is a life saver. Yay!

Reviews.Title: Just Perfect
Reviews.Author: Angie
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone for my elderly dad. It's just perfect and does the job and he can still text and take pictures if he wants.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use right out of the box
Reviews.Author: Kathleen
Reviews.Content: I just stopped by Tmobile to get a sim card and this phone was a snap to set up. I was pleasantly surprised, as was the 91-year-old I got it for. He was pleased to have the one-button dialing option.I can see that if a person had used a cell phone, it might seem overly simple, but those big buttons and the simple setup/learning are a totally win.

Reviews.Title: Just what my mother in law needed
Reviews.Author: tommy johns
Reviews.Content: This unit is perfect for the eldery. My MIL just loves the simplicy, the big buttons, loud volume.... Just right.  And the SOS button is great for alerting us with an emergency text and phone call. I'm getting another unit for my mom.

Reviews.Title: Thumbs down for quality!
Reviews.Author: Sue
Reviews.Content: I was delighted with my purchase--  the big buttons, easy usage, etc. Until it broke! Unfortunately I now need a different phone, and I am very disappointed with the shoddy quality of this phone.

Reviews.Title: Great device
Reviews.Author: Nelson
Reviews.Content: It is really a good device and easy, very helpfull.Specially for people like my uncle who has seeing problem

Reviews.Title: Forget it
Reviews.Author: LinHas
Reviews.Content: This is not a great phone for seniors. There are buttons on the side that my mom kept pushing by accident when she would try and make a call. It really is inferior. WHAT I DONT UNDERSTAND WHY SOMEONE DOES NOT COME OUT WITH A PHONE WITH LARGE BUTTONS, NO TEXTING OR EMAIL JUST A PHONE FOR SENIORS?There us a huge market out there and no one is cashing in or helping the seniors whose eyes are blurry and their hearing is failing....

Reviews.Title: Phone was not either defective or just a bad phone
Reviews.Author: Evelyne O. Mobbs "EviM"
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this phone, the large easy to see numbers, the easy to use features, the SOS button and even the charging stand and lanyard we bought with it. Then we made some calls. Oh my! It was such poor quality audio, that many words were not understandable. I checked with our carrier, AT&T;, and there were no problems and we were well in range. Our other AT&T; cells worked fine. Too bad, we had to send it back.

Reviews.Title: Mom is finally happy
Reviews.Author: redlipstick
Reviews.Content: My mom has taken to this phone quite nicely.  It's wonderful to see how easy it is for her to dial and retrieve her messages.The At&T; salersperson, was shocked that it worked.  He kept doubting me but it was really easy.  Mom mom had lost her other phone and we simply went in for an SIM card.  Perfect!

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Mrs Lilac "Ms Lilac"
Reviews.Content: Bought this for senior. . . put sim card from AT&T; and works great.Just like describe. Easy to set up/operate.After trying so many non senior phones, Mom was extremely pleased with this. PERFECT, PERFECT, PERFECT.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone for Low Vision
Reviews.Author: Robert P. Rock
Reviews.Content: This phone has been a good fit for my dad who couldn't use a smart phone.  It works well with his low vision but I recommend you purchase the charging cradle at the same time because it is difficult for low vision folks to see the tiny hole to plug the charging cord into.  My only complaint is that there is static on the line occasionally and is likely due to the G2 connection.  Otherwise it was easy to setup and the AT&T; store helped with that.

Reviews.Title: Chintzy
Reviews.Author: C. Blanchett "shoe addict"
Reviews.Content: This phone almost reminds me of a toy.  It is very cheaply made.  The charger didn't connect with the phone properly so we had to send it back.  We could not get a refund from Amazon because it had been more than 30 days.  We could not get a refund from the company that makes it, because we bought it from Amazon.  They would not send a replacement until they received the original phone (unless I wanted to pay a $55 deposit).  Basically my 81 year old mother had to go without a phone for over 2 weeks until this was all settled.  Holding out breath on the new one.....

Reviews.Title: phone review
Reviews.Author: James O'Connell
Reviews.Content: phone is sub standard and outdated; keyboard is too sensitive; audio speaker is poor, call log is poorly designed and sub standard.  Amazon service and follow  up is excellent however.

Reviews.Title: great for hearing aids wearer
Reviews.Author: Libby Maxey "Liberty"
Reviews.Content: My mom really likes this phone; she has hearing aids in both ears and she is so happy to hear clearly without feedback. She can hear and recognize her own phone's ringtone and see all the keys without straining. It's a simple phone to learn. I was surprised and grateful how easy it was to use this as a replacement phone on her T-mobile account.

Reviews.Title: Just what I ordered.
Reviews.Author: Clarence Barrows
Reviews.Content: Ordering was easy and received when they said it would be delived.  Snapfon will make it easier for a 78 year old to join the electronic age, large letters and ease use are a major facter in getting a Snapfon.

Reviews.Title: Very good phone but phone book can be confusing
Reviews.Author: Rajli Bicolli
Reviews.Content: I really like the phone, it does what it's supposed to do and is easy to use for my aging parents. One thing that can be confusing is that when numbers transfer from the sim card the phone doesn't distinguish between a cell # or a home # for the same person. So you will see two entries of the same name in the directory and there's no way of knowing if it's the cell or the home #, until you dial.I like that it has a loud ring, big buttons, and the battery lasts a few days between charges.

Reviews.Title: Great phone!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Smith
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my dad and he said he loves it! It's functional and easy for him to use. In fact, I just ordered another one just today for his friend.

Reviews.Title: Not simple
Reviews.Author: Carson
Reviews.Content: I liked the big buttons and large readout.....Then you have the slide switches and various buttons on both sides of the phone; even a large button on the back side of the phone. It took me a while to figure it all out much less a senior. My 82 had no problems with her old flip phone but this was a DISASTER from the first day. Has a very weak built in flashlight or I would call it a small light, all of which is one of the slide switches on the side of the phone. Leave the light on and it kills the battery, slide the wrong switch to turn it off and you lock the keyboard.I can not recommend this as a phone and certainly not for a senior citizen.

Reviews.Title: DONT buy this phone!!!!!
Reviews.Author: patti olic
Reviews.Content: I purchased this snap phone because it was supposedly "unlocked" and could be used with the ATT network.  First off, the 800 number with phone rang in to an answering machine.  No one ever returned my call, so I wasn't able to get the phone unlocked or activated.  After days of hassling with this nonsense, I sent the phone back.  DO NOT  buy this phone, there is no customer service with it and you wont be able to activate it on another net work.  I am truly disappointed.  It looked like just what I was looking for.

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: ryan lewis "r lewis"
Reviews.Content: i bought this phone for my mom and she love it, its easy to use with a big keypad and display plus the emergency SOS button on the back

Reviews.Title: An excellent choice
Reviews.Author: Clara E Cendales
Reviews.Content: I have bought two Snapfon ezTWO to give to two of my dearest friends. One is 68 and the other one 85. Both of them are delighted because they can see the screen perfectly well without having to look for their glasses and they also found it very easy to use.They live in Colombia, South America and it works better than other well known brands.Now all of my friends want one too. I'll have to start saving.

Reviews.Title: Nice upgrade from the Snapfon 1
Reviews.Author: jrwatsio
Reviews.Content: My elderly Mom had the Snapfon 1 for a couple years. She didn't use it much since it was meant for emergencies when away from home but she kept it charged in the (optional) cradle until the plug stopped making good contact. I upgraded her to the Snapfon ezTwo and she couldn't be happier. The screen (and phone) is significantly larger plus now it is in color which is much easier to read. The charger is standard microusb-B and the new (optional) cradle is much simpler - just two pins to make contact. It can be charged using any microusb-B cable and charger although they recommend the Snapfon charger. The battery from her Snapfon 1 fits fine so if you have extras, they will work. There are other phones with more features but they just overwhelm her so this phone is perfect for a non-tech savvy user. I moved her sim card from the Snapfon 1 into the Snapfon ezTWO and it was good to go. Her phone worked and the phone numbers were intact. I did have to reset up the speed dial and SOS numbers. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for the elderly
Reviews.Author: Anna J McCurdy
Reviews.Content: My mom loves this phone. Easy to use, as simple as it gets.  Great phone for the elderly!  Thank you

Reviews.Title: Awesome phone for Argentina
Reviews.Author: Jor-L
Reviews.Content: I surely recommend it. Spanish and English supported languages!My father now calls me everyday! He's joyful and very glad I bought this for him.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for Seniors.
Reviews.Author: pearl lou
Reviews.Content: My 93 yr. old mother loves it. It was recommended by a friend of hers because my mom kept hitting the wrong icons on her Galaxy, calling people at all hours of the night. She has poor vision. It has been a big help to us all!! The phone works well, is lighter and much easier for her to use.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the senior in your life
Reviews.Author: Dee Dee (Consignment)
Reviews.Content: Mom can actually use this phone and us able to hear people.  She can use it so much easier than any other phone i have previously found,

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: MARIANA
Reviews.Content: I bought this cell phone for my mother and it is great. Because her macular degeneration, with this phone, she is able to see all the numbers and read her messages.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for Seniors.
Reviews.Author: pearl lou
Reviews.Content: My 93 yr. old mother loves it. It was recommended by a friend of hers because my mom kept hitting the wrong icons on her Galaxy, calling people at all hours of the night. She has poor vision. It has been a big help to us all!! The phone works well, is lighter and much easier for her to use.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for the senior in your life
Reviews.Author: Dee Dee (Consignment)
Reviews.Content: Mom can actually use this phone and us able to hear people.  She can use it so much easier than any other phone i have previously found,

Reviews.Title: Great buy!
Reviews.Author: MARIANA
Reviews.Content: I bought this cell phone for my mother and it is great. Because her macular degeneration, with this phone, she is able to see all the numbers and read her messages.

Reviews.Title: the phone dosent come with the charger
Reviews.Author: Mauricio Avelar
Reviews.Content: I was disapointed when í see that the charter was missing, because this phone was for muy grandmother, i dont even know if It Works.

Reviews.Title: was not unlocked!
Reviews.Author: Benny
Reviews.Content: Don't buy this,waste of money! their are better phones at a lower cost! Get something other than this one please!

Reviews.Title: My Mom loves the phone
Reviews.Author: Judy E.
Reviews.Content: This is my mother's first cellphone.  The functions and settings were very easy to teach her.  She is now very comfortable with the phone and likes using it.

Reviews.Title: excellent phone for my elderly
Reviews.Author: Rene Allamby
Reviews.Content: this phone is easy to use.  I sent it overseas ty my parents and they are very satisfy of how esay is to work it.

Reviews.Title: would make some improvements but i like it, overall
Reviews.Author: V
Reviews.Content: 1.  vol is too loud, and not ez to adjust,  2. doesn't show names of incoming texts or calls,  3. cant easily scroll back to correct spelling, ... I got it because I only text and didn't want a flip phone

Reviews.Title: recent buyer
Reviews.Author: Richard A. Gardiner
Reviews.Content: Constant static, cannot hear person on the other line.  Phone quality is very poor.  Wouldn't recommend to any one.  Where do I send it back too to get my money back.

Reviews.Title: senior phone
Reviews.Author: Lynne Marie
Reviews.Content: This phone was great. Simple, compact but numbers large enough to read. Unfortunately my father was not able to learn to use it but that was because of his failing condition not the function of the phone.

Reviews.Title: Great for Seniors
Reviews.Author: GrapevineGrammie
Reviews.Content: My mom is 89 and the dog ate her last phone so we ordered her this phone.  She has dementia so we wanted a simple system.  I typed her 5 children's names on my label maker along with their speed dial numbers and taped them on the back of the phone.  Se is able to dial them by herself.  I love the emergency button on the reverse side of the phone.  She lives with my brother and we put his number as the emergency number so they can use it like an intercom.

Reviews.Title: Best ever!
Reviews.Author: Richard Slack
Reviews.Content: Tried Trac Phone and Samsung folding models. the SnapFon 2 exceeded my expectations in every way. A great product at a great price. Perfect for Seniors!

Reviews.Title: A good enough for me phone.
Reviews.Author: katiek
Reviews.Content: Even though I'm not into the 'senior' things, this phone gives good service, ok photos, ample phone numbers and good volume at a fair price. One must get an optional cover for it since it, and all other phones I've seen, are simply impossible to hold and use without one. Ring tones are severely limited. Battery life is excellent so far...one charge lasts a full week. The display and keys are large and clear and instructions only mildly obscure, unlike the mostly foreign tainted tripe put out by most electronic gadgets these days.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone for Seniors
Reviews.Author: Monica Herrera-Soto
Reviews.Content: Purchased this for my mother.  She likes this basic cell phone.  So much so she will recommend it to her friends.

Reviews.Title: My mom loved this phone
Reviews.Author: Moazzam Khan
Reviews.Content: My mom asked me to find a phone for my dad whose eye sight has deteriorated a lot due to diabetes.We found this phone perfect for him.Another concern was if this phone is unlocked or not. We tested it and found it unlocked.Thanks

Reviews.Title: Met my dad's needs
Reviews.Author: Joan Marie Kraft
Reviews.Content: Got this for my father, who uses a hearing aid.  Although he can certainly hear well when the phone is not on speaker, he does prefer speaker.  It is also easy for him to use (big buttons, big display).

Reviews.Title: This as a great phone!
Reviews.Author: Martin goldin
Reviews.Content: This as a great phone! Wouldn't trade it for the world - great battery life, great dailing functions, great microphone!!! Cool!

Reviews.Title: Very good product,
Reviews.Author: Excellent book
Reviews.Content: Very good product, practical and saved my cell phone. I used it everyday going to work and attach it my belt, it never falls

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: Eduardo A Castro P
Reviews.Content: Great product!Very Light weight..User Friendly...Ill recommend it!More than enough.Grand Ma now is connected.Thank You!

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: Peter Mathiasen
Reviews.Content: It is much easier for my wife to use.  She is manually handicapped, but is able to lift it to her ear.  She is able to hear the caller and though her voice is very low, she can also be heard by the person on the other end of the phone.  Because of a severe stroke she is unable to dial the number herself, but all things considered it is much better than other cell phones I have tried out for a person who is severely handicapped.

Reviews.Title: Lightweight & easy to use
Reviews.Author: lisa gilmour
Reviews.Content: I love the Snapfon. I bought it for my mother for Christmas. She has never used a cell phone, and she sometimes gets lost, so it was a great gift. I love the big numbers & how the phone calls out each number as you are dialing it. I also really liked the choice of ring tones; great selection, much better than my iPhone.The only thing I felt could have been improved on is the way the texts scroll in one line across the screen & the screen is rather small & hard for my mom to read. The best attribute is how lightweight it is; not uncomfortable to hang around one's neck with the case & matching lanyard.

Reviews.Title: Perfect phone for my 70 year old Mom!
Reviews.Author: Ivette Ruiz Babylon
Reviews.Content: Bought this for a Christmas present for my Mom. She loves it, it's easy to use. I don't have to be explaining how to do things every time I see her.  Transition was easy and I thought the SOS button was a great idea combined with the case/lanyard, she can always have the phone with her.  This phone gives me peace of mind.  The only thing I didn't go crazy for was the charger, it has a very small connection that's not super "old people friendly".

Reviews.Title: 75 year old father finally had a look of approval in his eyes when I gave him this for Christmas
Reviews.Author: C. Wilson
Reviews.Content: Easy to read with big fat honkin buttons & it takes a T-Mobile micro SIM card (the extra small kind). I'm sure AT&T; cards will work as well.  Wish I could have put a special ring-tone on it for Dad, but this option isn't available on the phone.  It's thinner and wider than the last model by the same manufacturer which made it easier for him to hold on to.  It also takes pictures which just delighted ole Dad.

Reviews.Title: Snap Fon
Reviews.Author: kykim
Reviews.Content: Great phone for the price, also ordered one for my younger (mentally challenged) sister.  Easy for her to understand and use.

Reviews.Title: Phone for older parent
Reviews.Author: Vijayakumar R Bekkem
Reviews.Content: It a good phone for my parent. It is easy to use, the display is big and very readable and the buttons are big and readable. Took one star off, because of the high price. A suggestion would be to lower the price and market it to seniors and children.

Reviews.Title: Snapfon use
Reviews.Author: Crisanta de Sanchez
Reviews.Content: I like this pone very much for its friendly use, its very light to carry, number are big enough to read and its ease with hearing aids, plus the fact is open and I can use it in Venezuela.

Reviews.Title: snapfon ezTWO
Reviews.Author: Grandma
Reviews.Content: pleased with phone. light, easy to use numbers and enter phone numbers; ring tone loud enough.  great safety feature with SOS button.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Ronnie L Jones
Reviews.Content: My 81 year old Dad loves his. Bought this one for an older friend in nursing home. He loves it!!!

Reviews.Title: great phone for seniors!
Reviews.Author: Andrew P. Starger
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my 85 year old parents who were having trouble using a more traditional cell phone. The large keypad and volume controls are perfect for seniors. They haven't used the SOS button yet but I'm glad it's there if they ever need it.

Reviews.Title: Good for seniors
Reviews.Author: Susan LeGear
Reviews.Content: Good phone for seniors especially if hard of hearing and/or has bad eye sight.  After a few "false" starts my elderly friend was able to pick up on the use of the phone and could easily read the keys.  Now he doesn't know what he did without it.  Highly recommend it to seniors who have never had a cell phone or who had one that they couldn't use.

Reviews.Title: Works fine for my mom
Reviews.Author: Conciousbuyer
Reviews.Content: My 80 year-old mother is more than happy with her phone. Loud...very loud, easy to dial, easy to use. There could be an improvement in terms of the construction since it feels a little fragile, but it is still a nice product.

Reviews.Title: Just what I wanted
Reviews.Author: Kenny Arthur
Reviews.Content: I love this phone. As a 96 year old man I need that sense of independence that comes with keeping in contact with friends and loved ones, and this phone is just the right size to fit my hands.  The big numbers pad is great for my fingers, also its light weight so nothing to hang down my pocket. The best feature is that it calls out the numbers as I press them so i know if my fingers made a mistake instead of wasting time and money on wrong numbers.  The number pad slide lock is brilliant because the other phones were too difficult to lock and unlock, this is just slide. With this phone you are sure that someone gave a lot of though into how us seniors operate and it problems we encounter. GREAT PHONE.

Reviews.Title: Senior cell phone
Reviews.Author: carole giambastiani
Reviews.Content: My husband is legally blind .  This is the first phone that he has been able to adjust his needs to.

Reviews.Title: Bought for my parents, they love it
Reviews.Author: Linda Williams
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my parents, both have low vision. They love it, white letters on black, very large and easy to see. My sister liked it so much she is buying one too. It's very basic and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for your grandma
Reviews.Author: Anya Malkiel
Reviews.Content: It has a lot of good features for old people. Big buttons, bug print, very loud sound. Emergency button is probably great but we haven't mastered it yet. On the not so great side, the menus could've been a little better and It looks a bit flimzy if looks are important to you.

Reviews.Title: disappointed in this phone
Reviews.Author: acuentas
Reviews.Content: We bought this phone for our mom who has never used a cell phone. Although it is easy to use, it is cheaply made. You get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Easier to use for elderly fingers
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This was purchased for my elderly mother-in-law.  She has not had the trouble using it that she did with her previous cell phone.  It was reasonably priced for what you get.  The display is larger and easier to read.

Reviews.Title: SENIOR perfection!
Reviews.Author: Shopaholic "Ana"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 70-something Uncle who lives in Mexico. Well, he could not have been any happier. He just loved this phone. This is really made for seniors. He asked me for a phone with big buttons and this was the real deal. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Great Cell phone for Senior or when you like Big Number pad, Big sound, just pop in a SIM card.
Reviews.Author: Long Time Tea Drinker
Reviews.Content: This is great, for senior people, great sound, big letter on keypad and big letter on the display, and easy operation.  We just pop the SIM card from old AT&T; phone to this, and works like a charm.  The back red HELP button can be programmed to immediately send text to a phone.

Reviews.Title: So far, really good!
Reviews.Author: Karen "k_rap"
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my 89 year old father who has Parkinson's disease (limited tactile mobility) and some hearing loss. So far, so good. Although his vision isn't really good enough to use the menu screen, he hears voices more clearly on his cell phone than his land line. The key pad is responsive enough that he usually dials accurately.Assuming he remembers to carry it with him (a problem, since he won't wear the lanyard I bought), it improves our ability to speak with him regularly and improves the quality of his life.

Reviews.Title: Very easy to setup
Reviews.Author: Robert W Davis
