Reviews.Content: I have read some of the other reviews and am puzzled as to why people are having trouble setting this phone up with their carriers.  I bought this phone for my mother and when it arrived I just pulled the sim card from her old AT&T; phone, put it in and it booted right up without any further problems.  Tested it by calling my cell and everything was just fine.  It does note that it is not compatible with a couple of cell providers.

Reviews.Title: excellent phone for seniors!
Reviews.Author: Mystic maria
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone for my parents, and they are fascinated with it! the SOS feature is great and works superbly!

Reviews.Title: Snapfon ezTwo Review
Reviews.Author: Dan R. Spasovich "Dan"
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these phones for my parents.  I really liked that they came unlocked.  I turned off the voice that says the number dialed as they didn't like that feature.  The sound quality is good, phone numbers and screen info is relatively large, phone works fine, battery seems to have decent life before requiring a charge under normal use, and they really like the ability to turn up the volume.The only thing I did not like or appreciate is that one of the phones Snapfon sent was a return that they then sent to me.  How could I tell?  Photos taken by the previous owners were still in the phone and I deleted those.

Reviews.Title: Not great, but will have to do for now
Reviews.Author: Roseberry
Reviews.Content: This is the second Snapfon I've purchased for my mother. It is a royal pain to activate through Snapfon and Puretalk combined. I can't get this one activated; the companies don't have help desk support on weekends and limited East Coast hours (if you live on the west coast and work, you might as well forget about it). If you email them, they call, leave a message, and tell you to call their 800 number - get ready for a long long wait. My mother is 95 and needs something that is larger and that she can see, but voice quality through Puretalk has never been good. ARRRGGGHH!Phone was finally activated - apparently it was the old phone I was being assured was working. The information I received from Puretalk wasn't complete. I still wish that the service from Puretalk was clearer, though.

Reviews.Title: works well
Reviews.Author: sanwhit
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my 80 year old father.  He has trouble using his fingers but this phone is easy for him to use.  No extras, just the phone.  We did have to replace the charger after only 6 weeks, but otherwise the phone is great.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, okay quality
Reviews.Author: John P.
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone (Snapfon ezTwo, unlocked GSM) for my 92-year-old father.Works fine with an AT&T; SIM, reception is okay in our area, but seems to need a strong cell signal.Battery life is great so far ... up to 7 days between charging ... mainly because it's just a phone (no web, no data plan, etc.)Phone is relatively easy for a senior to learn to use - easy-to-press physical buttons and large clear display help a lot.Phone construction is adequate, but feels flimsy - I bought a hard-shell case (Snapfon ezTwo Tuff Case) which adds some protection without a lot of bulk.All in all, I am pleased with the purchase so far, my only concern is with the phone contstruction, otherwise it works as expected/advertised.

Reviews.Title: Reception a problem
Reviews.Author: John Adams
Reviews.Content: We bought this primarily for emergency use. Unfortunately reception is so unpredictable it can't be counted on in our home though ok in town most places. Reception varies constantly.Also there is no way of keeping track of minutes used. Should be right on the screen on start-up.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Margie S. Robinson
Reviews.Content: I put the T-Mobile SIM card in and it worked fine for about three days.  After that the screen would light up but it was blank. I took the SIM card out and tried it on another phone and it worked fine, so that wasn't the problem. Yes, I made sure it was fully charged. I'm sending it back.

Reviews.Title: A good phone for sight and hearing impaired
Reviews.Author: Ken  Larson
Reviews.Content: I like the that you can see the lights on the phone and the ring sound is loud and all the features are great and I would recomend it to my friends that have hearing and eye troubles..  For me it is a great phone--- Thanks

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Shannon
Reviews.Content: Great phone for my grandmother.  Its hard to find a simple, easy phone in today's smartphone driven world. Very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great purchase
Reviews.Author: Shannon
Reviews.Content: Great phone for my grandmother.  Its hard to find a simple, easy phone in today's smartphone driven world. Very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good option for the sight impaired (Snapfon ezTWO)
Reviews.Author: Graham Elliott
Reviews.Content: So that there isn't any confusion, this is a review of the Snapfon ezTWO.  I got this phone for my mother who has diminishing eyesight.  In the pro column:- Unlocked- Big, backlit, separated, raised keypad keys- Talking keypad option (for punching in phone numbers)- Physical controls for phone lock and volume control- Loud alarms (four of them)- Text message option to notify someone when the phone battery is running low- Long stand-by- It is lighter than it looksThe cons:- Sound quality during calls is just 'OK'- Reception can be iffyTo address the last two items, you can hear the person on the other end but you'd expect a modern mobile phone to sound better.  I've also had issues with reception but your mileage will vary here.  I've used the phone in Manhattan on AT&T; and T-Mobile and in Jamaica (W.I.) with Lime and Digicel.  In all cases the reception fluctuates wildly indoors.  I haven't determined if it is because of radio interference, if I am 'holding it wrong' or the phase of the moon but it definitely struggles more than the candybar Samsung it replaces.Finally, for entirely selfish reasons, I would have found the FM radio, present in the previous Snapfon model, more useful than the included camera but all in all it is a solid, non-too-complicated option for someone with low vision.

Reviews.Title: Good Phone for Elderly
Reviews.Author: Patricia Smith "Patricia Smith"
Reviews.Content: Purchased for 83 yr. old with no cell phone experience. User was able to learn the features in order to place and receive a call, but seemed to be worried about accidentally hitting the emergency button on the back. User probably won't use the camera-too much to learn at one time, at least for now.  Overall, simplicity and big buttons are an improvement for elderly over the usual cell phone, which is pretty much an obstacle for  those with impared vision or shaky hands.

Reviews.Title: Only the camera is a drawback
Reviews.Author: Arlen Dean Snyder
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Snapfon because it promised little else beyond the phone.  Most important to me.  If I want music, I'll get a record player or an MP3.  If I want to take pictures, I have a camera.  So, in part I won.  I also was pleased that I could use it with my pre-paid T-mobile card.  Most important for me because I seldom use a Cell phone and T-mobile makes it possible for me to not spend a fortune on a worthless gadget.  The Snapfon allows me to enjoy it.  Only drawback I've found is the buttons get too easily pressed when I'm not using the phone.I recommend it, especially for those who prefer a phone to a collection of electronics.

Reviews.Title: Its the BEST !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Reviews.Author: John R. Morgan
Reviews.Content: I like the Lanyard BUT I got myself a Phone Holster Very Pleased with it !!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! Less chance of loosing my phone....

Reviews.Title: Better off with a prepaid or limited cell plan
Reviews.Author: Tim Frasier
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone for my mother who was in a nursing home and could not use a phone well due to recent illness.  Bottom line is that the phone worked for few months and then started having problems charging. I replaced the charger and then was about to replace the battery and decided to scrap it!  It's not worth the hassle and by the time she was starting to be able to work the phone better it had died.  Go with a decent low cost prepaid phone and pay as you go or get a low cost monthly plan.

Reviews.Title: Initial problems appear fixed for now.
Reviews.Author: gkimba11
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone for my 89 Year old Mom. The screen is easy to see. She has a difficult time with the menu, which is simple for those that are used to electronic devices.  My Mom can't use the menu well and she gets confused as to what buttons do what. The volume is good and ringtones loud now that she called technical support and they appeared to fix it over the wire.  She kept having trouble with not being able to hear it ring or hear the party on the other end of the conversation. (We could not hear her either.) She is in her third week of using the phone, I hope it works out for her. If not, my wife would like one for herself.  We replaced her old flip phone which could not make or receive calls from her apartment. The Snapfon's reception works just fine.  Overall I have no regrets.

Reviews.Title: Snapfon ezTwo for Seniors
Reviews.Author: Donna M.
Reviews.Content: Like the simple features of the Snapfon that I purchased for an eldery parent. The only complaint I have is the reception is iffy with AT&T; service. We can hear callers fine but they complain of bad connection and occassionaly have trouble hearing us.Not sure if it may be the phone as other cell phones work without a problem.

Reviews.Title: See praise under lanyard
Reviews.Author: Mr. Richard Johnston
Reviews.Content: I wrote my review mistakenly under lanyard. I'm not going to type it out again. Jolly good 'phone if you please.

Reviews.Title: Keypad lock switch doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Veritas "amazon3602"
Reviews.Content: I like the concept and features of the phone, but the slider keypad lock switch is of poor construction and did not work. Unfortunately, I did not notice this until I spent (wasted) considerable time entering contact names and numbers. I suppose I will simply return the phone, since I haven't yet found info on getting a new one shipped with an RMA.

Reviews.Title: Very poor and low audio
Reviews.Author: Gary W Kennison
Reviews.Content: Phone has great features for the elderly, but it all serves no purpose because the call volume is very low.  Strangely the speaker for the speakerphone is very loud, but then using it like a speaker phone, the voice quality for the other person is terrible.  We are back to square one trying to find our father something he can both operate and conduct a conversation on.

Reviews.Title: Mixed opinions
Reviews.Author: Pat
Reviews.Content: The EZ Snapfon was the simplest cell phone I could find for my elderly Dad.  It arrived promptly and in good shape.  The price was fair.  I wish, however, it were even easier to understand.  We've only entered two people in its "phonebook", but we find it is almost difficult NOT to dial 911 by accident instead of one of the names.  Knowing that you need to use the down and up part of the menu button isn't intuitive, and hard for him to remember.  It has some features and some terminology an elderly person doesn't really need. How I wish someone would offer a cell phone that is even easier!

Reviews.Title: Good for a senior
Reviews.Author: the one thing
Reviews.Content: Got this for my 78 year old Mom. She likes it, though she had a little bit of trouble figuring it out at first. Item was as described and shipping was fast!

Reviews.Title: Cheaply made
Reviews.Author: Angela Hammond "angelhamm"
Reviews.Content: It works but doesn't pick up my micro-cell so the reception is terrible.  I bought this for my 82yr old mother and she still has a very hard time with it.  Don't expect it to be THAT simple.

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: jim
Reviews.Content: great phone older person hard of hearing loud ringtone good ringtone reveille .big numbers easy to hold ,best phone i have had since star stac a long time ago

Reviews.Title: Difficult for diabled senior to handle
Reviews.Author: Beth  Joyner
Reviews.Content: My husband has severe neuropathy in his hands and also some deafness.  The location of the toggle on the side of the phone to control volume is poorly designed.  Somehow he always gets the volume turned down and cannot hear the caller.  We do like the emergency call button.

Reviews.Title: best phone for seniors and old people
Reviews.Author: Ramy Bishara
Reviews.Content: i bought this phone for my grandma cause she stays at home by herself a lot and she falls quite often. i configured it easily and left it for her to use it. it has big buttons and the font on the screen is good, i like everything about it specially the SOS features. this phone is seriously designed for seniors. The only thing that is missing is a place for a phone hand strap which i think its essentials for seniors as they wouldnt worry about carrying it around.

Reviews.Title: Nice big buttons but dad couldn't navigate menu
Reviews.Author: CrazyGranny
Reviews.Content: Had tried another cell but flip was too much for him after his stroke.  Thought this would be answer to my prayers for dad to have a phone at nursing home but he couldn't navigate menu to make calls :( .  Had to go thru expense of installing land line an pay monthly bill

Reviews.Title: bbgh
Reviews.Author: bbgh
Reviews.Content: I got this phone for my dad. it is so easy, although I had to program it for him. It is loud for him to hear, and the dial is large to see. When he becomes to confused to use this phone, he will not be able to use any phone. The phone plan that you can get with it is awesome and cheap. no surprises on the bill.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use.
Reviews.Author: J. Bass
Reviews.Content: Good for what it is made for.  A basic phone that is not too complicated for a "senior citizen" to use.  It does tend to drop calls at times, in the same location where I have no such issues with my smartphone.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use.
Reviews.Author: J. Bass
Reviews.Content: Good for what it is made for.  A basic phone that is not too complicated for a "senior citizen" to use.  It does tend to drop calls at times, in the same location where I have no such issues with my smartphone.

Reviews.Title: Simple, easy to use
Reviews.Author: Angie
Reviews.Content: I found the search for a simple telephone extremely frustrating until I found this phone; I didn't want internet nor did I want or need the bells and whistles. This is a very simple and easy to understand telephone that satisfies my needs very well.

Reviews.Title: Very easy to use!
Reviews.Author: TD
Reviews.Content: Bought for my 79 year old Mom who was having problems using regular cell phone models.  This is easy for her to use and the emergency button is a great feature we hope to never need.

Reviews.Title: Snap Phone
Reviews.Author: jodabeans
Reviews.Content: I like the phone but, it's hard to remember how to do things on it. Sometimes I can't hear on it.

Reviews.Title: Good idlea but didn't last.
Reviews.Author: AJ
Reviews.Content: The phone is a very good idea for seniors. my mom had a great experience with hers she loved the large numbers and was able to dial with it pretty good. However, less than a year it stop working, after replacing the battery the phone had shorted out. The draw back is there is no one in my area able to fix it and the warranty is out.Snapfon ezONE-C Senior Cell Phone with Big Buttons and Easy to Use: Cell Phones & Accessories

Reviews.Title: Okay phone
Reviews.Author: chucksunn
Reviews.Content: We purchased this phone to replace our land line. It is  as it was advertized but thought it would be easier to use. Product was not as good as I expected.

Reviews.Title: Good device with some limitations
Reviews.Author: M. Stickles
Reviews.Content: My legally blind father uses this phone. He found that the display is easy to read (depending on how well his eyes are working on any particular day, of course.) He likes the easy to read send, end and numerical buttons.Texting is not too bad, but could be better. For instance, pressing the pound key multiple times toggles through different input modes (uppercase, lowercase, etc) but you also have to toggle through Spanish input and many other options, making for many keypresses to go from lowercase to uppercase and back - assuming that you want to capitalize some words. Not extremely user friendly. He finds it easier to send in all upper- or lowercase most of the time. Also, there is no "Sent" folder for texts. Not a huge deal, but it would be nice to see what you've sent - especially for older ones with a possibly poor memory.For changing sound options, they are not all grouped together. It takes 8 keypresses to change the phone to vibrate mode and another 8 to change back to audible. To change to completely silent takes only a few keypresses, however. It would be nice if all the sound options were in the same menu area (Silent, Audible, Vibrate all together) and easy to access as this is something that is likely changed often.The battery life is very good. With such a small display, it does not use much energy to power the backlight. He only has to charge it once or twice a week.The earpiece volume can be very loud if adjusted up all the way. The ringer volume is also very loud. Great for the hard-of-hearing - which he is not. He says that the ringer is, "loud enough to wake the dead."Once, he was listening to the FM radio and an incoming call completely locked up the phone. Needless to say, he will not be using the radio anymore.He appreciates the led flashlight feature and the button lock to prevent accidental dialing.All in all, he likes this phone and would buy another if this one breaks.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone: Expectations Completely Satisfied
Reviews.Author: Xavier Beltran
Reviews.Content: The phone just delivers what the product description advertises: no more no less, and it actually works like a charm!

Reviews.Title: Not quite there
Reviews.Author: Unpolitically Correct
Reviews.Content: For a so-called "senior" cell phone, the designers seemingly have left out the things most seniors need most:1. Too small for shaky seniors. Most elderly people tend to shake quite a bit and they need something substantial to grab on to. This ain't it.2. Cheap plastics. Seniors tend to drop things. One drop onto a hard floor will render this phone useless.3. Complicated menu system. Seniors want (need) to simply push a button to bring up their contacts to make a call. Not on this phone. They need to go through a series of 4 menu selections to bring up their stored phone numbers.4. Inadequate earpiece volume. Seniors simply don't hear as well as they use to and will struggle to hear anyone that calls them.Not all is lost, however. Some good points:1. Big keys that speak to you as you dial.2. Loud ringtones that seniors can easily hear.Thats it. I would look elsewhere for your senior cell phone. It's difficult to believe that nobody makes a simple, durable cell phone that seniors can actually use. I guess I'll try a Jitterbug for my mother next time.

Reviews.Title: Gr8 for seniors- and actually unlocked for international use
Reviews.Author: DeBigBri
Reviews.Content: Gr8 phone for seniors - bought it for my 84 year old mom - not the most patient or tech savvy.1-Large back-lit buttons2-Audible confirmation of numbers dialed3-Convenient SOS button conveniently located4-Very senior-friendly charger which uses a round pole to connect to the phone and not a USB-like head with subtle sidedness which requires mindful and correct insertion to avoid damaging either the charger or the phone5-Good size - easily held6-It's just a phone and can handle calls and SMS (texts) like a simple phone should.7-Used it outside of the US with absolutely no problem

Reviews.Title: GREAT USER-FRIENDLY PHONE, FOR SENIORS
Reviews.Author: LISA M.
Reviews.Content: My 83-yr.-old parents were always having difficulty with their former cell phone:  could not locate buttons easily, could not see the small numbers very well nor the "speaker" button.  Although this phone does not have to capability to be linked to a car's integrated Blue Tooth, they have found it is absolutely not a problem.  They just push the large, easy-to-see speaker button, and they are good to go!  And the volume is fantastic.  They love this phone!  When I was researching "phones for seniors", I had read that this is the ONLY phone which was specifically created with seniors in mind; with the aging demographics, you would think there would be more competitor companies doing the same.  Just be sure that you confirm that this Snapfon is compatible with your cell phone provider's plan...buy it from Amazon, bring it into your cell phone provider store, and they will have it working in 5 minutes.

Reviews.Title: The Perfect Phone
Reviews.Author: Pamela J. Thomas
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a simple- to- use phone for my mother-in-law, and this phone fit the bill.  The phone is easy to program.  The speed dial is a great feature.  Now all she has to do is push one number to make a call.  The keys are large, the read out is easy to see, and the ring is loud and clear.  This phone has restored my mother-in-law's contact with her family and friends.

Reviews.Title: Worked great!
Reviews.Author: TES
Reviews.Content: My dad has MS, hands don't work so hot + he's let's say "cell phone challenged". Push numbers and send. That's about all he wants and this phone does it well! Simple, easy to read and navigate the contacts.

Reviews.Title: Snap On Phone is just what my husband needed
Reviews.Author: Nancy
Reviews.Content: The phone has everything a technically challenged person could need, simplicity in making/receiving calls,loud ring that illuminates incoming number with large numerals that are easy to read, suited all his needs.  We are having problems with the battery, not sure if it's the battery itself, but the phone will not stay charged for more than a few minutes, and we charge it to what we feel is a full charge,  and the same thing happens.  We were hoping to get a little more out of this phone, as we have only had it a few weeks.  We are having someone trouble shoot the issue, and we do hope it can be resolved.

Reviews.Title: Nice phone for Seniors!
Reviews.Author: Ruben Rosario
Reviews.Content: It was a gift to my Mom and she love it! can't miss the numbers when she make a phone call...Radio signal is only the problem..

Reviews.Title: Snapfon ez One
Reviews.Author: Three Angels
Reviews.Content: Purchased this phone for my mother in law who is in her 80's.  She needed a phone with a large display and big buttons because dexterity in her hands is lacking.  This phone as worked out great for her.  Its simple to dial and it doesn't have any complicated buttons.  It was a little difficult to setup so I had to do it for her, but once completed she had no problems.  Love it!

Reviews.Title: Great for Sight Impaired
Reviews.Author: Stephen F. Shick
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my wife with a vision impairment.  She doesn't need all the bells and whistles that are on the new smart phones.  She really likes it.  She can see all the numbers very clearly.

Reviews.Title: Very LOUD simple phone.
Reviews.Author: L.Loo
Reviews.Content: I got this phone for my mother who is extremely hard of hearing and do not speak English. This phone is definitely very LOUD and simple. The buttons are large and the screen is bright. Programming is a challenge since it is not a smartphone and is limited, but do-able. So far it is still holding up considering how many times it was dropped.

Reviews.Title: What a Great Value!
Reviews.Author: Completely Satlsfied
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Snapfon ezOone-C Senior Cell Phone for my mother. I was afraid that the phone would be "cheap" as most senior phones that I had seen were much more expensive. Since the first day that she got the phone, my mom has been delighted. The phone is very good quality. It is very easy to see, and it has a loud ringer. This was a great value and is a great little phone. My mom loves it! Thank you guys for providing a phone that is reasonably priced for seniors to use.

Reviews.Title: Nice cell phone
Reviews.Author: john m
Reviews.Content: Got this phone to replace a lost Snapfon for mom.She enjoyed the old phone but lost it in a cab going to the doctor.She she was so upset and felt lost without her cell.Being xmas was 3 weeks away i told her not to fret and that i would give her this new one for xmas.She says it is slightly different than the older model but i can't see any difference.Numbers are large so that mom ,who is 92,can see them with no problem.Seems easy to operate for her and that's all that counts.Cell phone carrier is AT&T; which is not the greatest provider..

Reviews.Title: My father is FINALLY happy with a phone
Reviews.Author: J T
Reviews.Content: My father has said for years that if he could find a cell phone that just had a dial on it (remember the old-fashioned dial phones?), that he would be happy.  Trying to find a phone that is simple in design and easy to use is a tough thing now days.  A couple of years ago, we bought him one of the simpler touch screen phones.  He tried very hard to understand and use the phone but he was so frustrated by it that we generally found it to be turned off.  It was useless to him.And then we found this phone.  Simple enough to use with large numbers for easy visibility.  We simply moved over the SIM card (AT&T;) from his old phone to get this one up and running.  My father also really enjoys the radio that is built into the phone.I like that he will keep his phone on now.  And I really like that he is finally happy.We will all be old one day and it is sad to see how few phones are made for seniors.  I regret how my father's old phone made him feel bad about his own abilities.  I wish the marketplace would have more phone choices that are appropriate for people of differing abilities.  Fortunately, this phone is just perfect for seniors!

Reviews.Title: Good product but defective
Reviews.Author: Sissy Cervantes
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone for my mother as a Christmas gift.  The numbers are large and back light is bright, so I have no doubt this will work for her.  But when calling out we noticed that the caller was unable to hear her, thus I had to return the phone.  I have ordered another, hopefully this one will work better. She and I both like the phone, just thought the one we purchased was defective.  I would purchase a replacement and still recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: Nice phone for my grandma!!!
Reviews.Author: J. Adolio Cascante "George Adolio"
Reviews.Content: Up to this moment this purchase has been very good since the phone is used mostly by my grandmother. Currently she has not experienced any problems with it. Before this purchase me and my mother had several problems trying to get a phone for elder people to use easily since here in Costa Rica there are a few stores that offered this type of devices. Fortunately after doing a little research I was able to locate this phone that offer very easy instructions in order to use it as soon as you take it out from the box.Overall a good purchase. Hope to get another phone in a near future!!!

Reviews.Title: Best around
Reviews.Author: prolove
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my 89 year old mom.  The size of the keys were the biggest around for her arthritic hands. The red panic button makes her feel better that many people are getting called for she lives alone.  The large screen makes it easier for her to see and the best thing is the docking station which makes it easier for her to charge, find the phone and view it.  SHe also likes the flash light because she keeps it by her bed so she can walk to bathroom at night..she charges during the day in the kitchen in the docking station..Thank you so much.I compared it to many products out there..this is by far the best..don't forget to get the docking station which was free with order just had to send away for it with the coupon that came with it..

Reviews.Title: Snapfon ezONE
Reviews.Author: Roger Lee Fook
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a phone for my 85 year old mother who had problems with the average phone on the market (small buttons, tiny font, Ph.D required to navigate) and was pleased when I saw/read the reviews on the Snapfon. I received it quikly after purchasing and all that was advertized was in the box. Having set up the phone for my mother, I however have two (2) concerns, the first being that I have not found a way to delete contacts from the phone book on the sim card; secondly reading text messages is difficult as on scrolling the text does not aligne properly in the display.

Reviews.Title: Excellent phone for disabled or visually impaired people.
Reviews.Author: Brenda Lebby
Reviews.Content: I originally bought this phone for my dad who has some cognitive disabilities. He has had it for over a year and he loves it. It is very easy for him to use. My mom has become visually impaired and also has arthritis in her hands so dexterity is sometimes a problem.  I just bought a Snapfon for her too. I set all the family members up on speed dial so she only has to press one button to connect to one of us. The buttons are large enough for her to see without difficulty. If there is one thing I would improve it would be to make the phone a little bit larger.One other feature that I thought was really great is the SOS button on the back of the phone. With the push of that big red button you can connect to 911, an emergency contact person, or just set off a loud personal alarm that will let others know you are in danger and need help.

Reviews.Title: Good phone for senior
Reviews.Author: Consumer
Reviews.Content: This is a great mobile phone for seniors.  Large buttons & loud volume are appreciated. It is a definite hit.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my shakey Mom!
Reviews.Author: Gary Wilson
Reviews.Content: This phone seems to be the end-all of my multi-year search for my mother's usable phone.  She has essential tremors which make it difficult to push buttons.  She also needs the security of the "Panic Button" while she is out walking at 88 years of age.Other phones I have given her just end up in the box.  They are too complicated and tiny for her needs.  She can pin down the Snapfon on her lap and push the pre-programmed single button to call me, my brothers, neighbors and friends with one touch.She also has the holster-type charger which enables her to recharge the phone.  She cannot possibly plug in the itty bitty pin.  But she can use the holster!She also enjoys her favorite FM radio station on her walks!  It is the best phone I have found for my shakey Mom.

Reviews.Title: GREAT PHONE
Reviews.Author: lisa
Reviews.Content: BUY THIS PHONE for any seniors in the family. Sooo easy to use, great ringtones...all around super! Extra big buttons nice backlight. Perfect

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Brandi Brandon "Brandi"
Reviews.Content: Phone came promptly as promised and is great. My grandma loves it and feels better being left home alone! I recommend this for all seniors.

Reviews.Title: Snapfon ezONE-C
Reviews.Author: Ramace P.
Reviews.Content: Got this phone for my dad. It's amazing for seniors. Big keypad and display screen makes it ideal for older people.

Reviews.Title: Thumbs up
Reviews.Author: Lauren Sierra
Reviews.Content: Great product for my hard of hearing dad.  Very user friendly, but best of all when using the speaker portion of the phone he can actually hear what is being said to him.

Reviews.Title: Mom Can Read it!
Reviews.Author: Jennifer Randall
Reviews.Content: Yes no glasses required and easy to use!  I had my 84 year old mother using it entering contacts etc in 3 minutes.Although still working on checking messages and how to do that.

Reviews.Title: Good choice for those with limited vision.
Reviews.Author: BILLY M BURWELL
Reviews.Content: The big buttons and simple design is why I got this phone for my 85 year old dad. He recently moved to a retirement facility and I could add this phone to my existing AT&T; plan for $10 a month.  He learned to use it fairly quickly and the quality seems to be good.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for aging folks
Reviews.Author: JAMES A NICHOLS
Reviews.Content: I got this phone for my Dad after he was really struggling to get the hang of other cell phones and he is able to work this one with no problems.

Reviews.Title: Great FIRST cell phone for my 82year OLD mom
Reviews.Author: Donald S.
Reviews.Content: The phone has worked our really well for my 82 year old mother.  I programmed the one touch dialing for all her important numbers (press + hold--- works great.)  The Panic button on the back is a very nice feature--it sends out a preprogrammed text messages to the whoever ( up to 4 respondents) that are programmed to receive them, it then calls the 1st number and then the next if the previous number does not answer.  The limitation is the phone can not distinquish between a voice mail or someone actually answering the call.  Hence, if a respondent has voice mail and does not personally answer, it does not continue dialing the next number.  This of course would not be a problem if it was programmed to dial 911 as the first respondent.  This doesn't work for my mother since she does not speak english well and I'm concerned with a false alarm.

Reviews.Title: Great little phone!
Reviews.Author: Janster
Reviews.Content: I had a ZTE phone that would die after three hours of conversation. I was out of my contract. I had NO desire for a smartphone. I wanted a phone that would keep a charge for a long time, had large keys, good sound, and was GSM. I didn't want a web browser, email or anything else. I just wanted a phone that had good sound and would hold a charge for a long time.I have found it in the Snapfon. It's simple. It's got big keys. It's got a good sound. It has an FM radio and a flashlight. Now, the flashlight isn't a spotlight. It's not a 34,000 lumen Cree flashlight. It's not a tactical flashlight. Your local SWAT team would laugh itself collective self into a hernia over this flashlight. But if you're trying to get into your house at 10:30 at night and you don't want to dig through your purse for your Fenix or Polarion, this illuminates the lock on your door just fine.The user guide is simple and easy to follow.On top of all that, it's loaded with the Benny Hill, Andy Griffith, Hawaii Five-O, James Bond and Dragnet themes in addition to a couple of regular old phone rings and bell sounds for ringtones.For $58.00, I think it's a great deal.

Reviews.Title: good phone
Reviews.Author: T. Nakad
Reviews.Content: very good phone, the reason i gave 4 and not 5 stars is because of the language; i wanted french language but it didn't have this option. too bad.

Reviews.Title: Great senior citizen phone
Reviews.Author: Stacy L. Wagenbast
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my 73 year old mom in the nursing home. It was easy to set up and easy to teach her to use - no small feat. She is thrilled with how easy it is for her to use with her rheumatoid arthritis crippled hands and being able to hear a conversation on it.  Great useable features for her needs too.  I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Finally a simple phone...
Reviews.Author: student
Reviews.Content: The phone is simple,and easy to use for anyone that just wants to make calls. My husband is vision impaired so the big numbers are great. You don't have to be a senior or elderly to enjoy this phone.

Reviews.Title: bought for elderly mother
Reviews.Author: sittie74
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone to replace a go-phone my 82 year-old mother had been using for years. Since she is a very active senior citizen, but is hard of hearing, I was looking for something with large numbers,loud volume,and that I could place an existing SIM card in.  This phone has all of those features. However,from the SET UP process, thru actual use, I found this phone to be very complicated. It is not easy for her to use since she has to go through several steps just to make a call. For example,in order to find her phonebook listings she has to scroll up to PHONEBOOK, press OK when BROWSE appears on the screen, scroll through her listings, then she must press OK again when DIAL appears on the screen.  Also, in order to call her speed dial numbers, she has to hold down the number she wants to speed dial for a longer period of time before it starts to dial that number, otherwise the speaker will just say the number. Then she must press NO and try to speed dial again. While I am pleased with the volume, large buttons and overall size of the phone, I think it is way too complicated for most people, especially older people, not to mention those who are truly elderly.

Reviews.Title: Great little phone
Reviews.Author: KIW242
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone for my grandmother.  It is quite easy for her to use.  Additionally, we don't live in the US, and there was no problem using our sim card.

Reviews.Title: Great phone, Exc Service
Reviews.Author: Cliff
Reviews.Content: I purchased the phone for my 74 y/o father who recently entered an assisted living center. A landline through the local telecom was nearly $60/mo. On his tight budget, it just wasnt an option. I purchased the phone, shipped it to him, and explained the following to him:1) Charge it when you arent using it as it has a battery.2) Push the number buttons and then the Green button to make a call.3) Push the green button when it rings4) Push the red button to hang up.It's still a challenge for him. Not sure why, but it's not because of the phone.The pricing has been great from Snapfon. Their customer service is A+...now if I can just get dad to understand it.

Reviews.Title: GREAT BUY
Reviews.Author: SKEPTIC
Reviews.Content: THIS PHONE WAS A GREAT BUY, I BOUGHT IT FOR MY HUSBAND WHO IS VISUALLY IMPAIRED.  IT IS A SIMPLE AND EASY PHONE TO OPERATE.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for seniors
Reviews.Author: CMHDDS
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my 90 year old father.  The large number buttons make it much easier to use for him than his previous mobile phone.  It can be set to allow a loud ring tone which is another advantage for those with some mild to moderate hearing loss.  I would give it a five star rating if it came with a case and car charger.

Reviews.Title: Great for 91 year olds!
Reviews.Author: Gail M. Burkey
Reviews.Content: My Mother didn't use her older cell phone for many reasons! Everything was too small, too dark and not loud enough! Now, she can use this phone much easier and even asked me to turn the volume down! It "talks" the numbers dialed which helps her know she is dialing correctly, and it's easy to see everything! Thanks for developing this so at least my Mother CAN use her phone! The 911- HELP button is also a good idea!

Reviews.Title: The Cell Fone I've Been Looking For
Reviews.Author: J. Paul Cunningham "meritman"
Reviews.Content: Its numbers are big enough for feeble fingers.Its navigation can be learned without going to night school.At a reasonable price, and just the right size.It's the best cell Fon for the money I've seen.The Meritman

Reviews.Title: nice big buttons that talk. radio will not work w/out headphones.
Reviews.Author: lsc88
Reviews.Content: the reception isn't so great either. we're on AT&T.; dad likes it on the whole. for the life of me can't get the speakerphone to work. maybe it's defective. i already called cust. support. i don't think dad will want to send it back and be phoneless in the meanwhile though :(

Reviews.Title: OK for a direct-dialed call only
Reviews.Author: JAH
Reviews.Content: My husband, who is computer illiterate, was given this phone as a gift.  I had to get one in order to figure it out so that I could fix it when he messed his up.  It has large, easy-to-read numbers and works great if you are just dialing a number that you know, but trying to use the menu to access the phone book or check messages is very unweildy and trying to delete something turns into an adventure.  At least my husband will carry this phone, but very rarely uses it.  Neither do I.

Reviews.Title: Dad's Phone
Reviews.Author: Tony C
Reviews.Content: Bought  this  phone  for  my  Dad  who is  87  and  has  severe  arthritus and  is  confined  to anursing  facility .....the  volume  level is  good  and  easy  to  use  basically  ...just  wish  the  buttons  on  top  were not  so  easy  to push  it  has  caused  some  issues  with  Dad,  inadverently  changing settings  ...ie:  going  to  silent  mode  etc

Reviews.Title: Just the ticket
Reviews.Author: Doug in CA "Doug in CA"
Reviews.Content: I was worried my father might be insulted by this phone. But I thought it was perfect for him since he has some conditions which make using a regular cell phone difficult to use. He is 78 and had a mild stroke which affected his left arm. His eyesight is also poor. This phone was just the ticket. He was really happy with it. Not insulted at all.

Reviews.Title: Good practical/basic phone
Reviews.Author: Tonyo
Reviews.Content: Bought phone for my Mother....phone, as others have reported is actually smaller then it appears, but it is a GREAT phone for seniors or anyone who wants a basic functional phone! Ring is loud, buttons clear and FLASHLIGHT is a GREAT bonus...I would recommend!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: She loves it!
Reviews.Author: Daughter
Reviews.Content: Bought this phone for my 86 year old mom. She's not tech savvy and a little hard of hearing. Reasonably priced, was able to use SIM card from her other phone, super easy to use and volume can be set to really loud. Directions even have large print. No regrets - highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: B. Smith
Reviews.Content: I got the phone for my 80 year old mother.  She is very set in her ways and opinions.  She has not used other cell phones in the past, but a lawyer insisted that we get her a cell phone NOW and she actually agreed to do it!  I got it on Amazon.  I ordered a red cover to make it easier to find in her black purse.  The numbers are easy to read.  The sounds let you know if and which number has been pushed.  It is fairly simple, but I did not find it as intuitive as I would have hoped.  I had to call 2x for explanations, but the phone was answered by a person and the issues explained to my satisfaction.  Mom is still not using the phone as much as I would like, but she has tried to use it and has kept it charged.  There is a lot of new stuff for her to learn right now, just having moved to a retirement community, but I am hoping that as she gets more comfortable in the new surroundings, she will begin to use the phone more.  I like that it does not have a camera, and that I can turn off voice messaging.  I have programmed in speed dial numbers, but she is a bit confused about dialing them--I find it very simple.  AT&T; added this phone to our family plan for $15.00 a month, no contract, which I think is very reasonable.  Now if she would just use it more!

Reviews.Title: Great senior phone
Reviews.Author: Gary Maiden "sky hawk"
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely the simplest phone to use and is very senior friendly.  It even has a "life alert" button that will auto. request help when pressed.No contracts. You won't go wrong on this phone.

Reviews.Title: Good phone
Reviews.Author: J. Wooster
Reviews.Content: Purchased this phone for my 68 year old Mother.  She needed something simple to use with large numbers.  This phone fits the bill.  She can see the numbers and there are not a lot of options to confuse her.  The only thing I would change is the ability to remove 911 from the Browse contact feature.  Since it is the first one on the list, she has accidentally call 911 a couple of times.  Other than that, good phone.  Works well with Straight Talk phone plan also.

Reviews.Title: Probably a good phone for most
Reviews.Author: A. M. Martin
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my 82 year old mom. It is probably one of the easiest phones to use but with her memory problems she just can't get the hang of it.  In order to look up family numbers she has to scroll down using the middle "button".  However, if the button is scrolled up, it goes to the menu and she needs to press the "end" button several times to get it back to the main screen.  She just can't remember this part. The menu screen is unimportant for basic use; make a call or answer.  I wish it was not on the same button. One plus is that you can attach a lanyard which enables carrying the phone around the neck. I like the bright orange color she doesn't lose it so easily in her purse.

Reviews.Title: Large button senior phone
Reviews.Author: ddavids30
Reviews.Content: There are two brands of large button phones, Doro and Snapfon. I first owned a flat as opposed to a flip Doro phone and it was defitely a 5 star phone. The charging mechanism on the phone broke and I tried to find another all over the intenet but could only find a flip Doro phone. I am 82 years old and cannot easily operate a flip phone.Since I could not find a flat Doro phone I purchased a large button flat Snapfon phone from Amazon It is ok but not as sophisticatated as the Doro. It is not as easy to use as the Doro phone and the directions for using it are very poor and took me and hour trying to figure how to get all the settings set correctely.Since I could not find another flat phone Doro, the Snapfon phone is really the second best for senior citizens and I do recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Happy Camper
Reviews.Author: schimmel1885
Reviews.Content: I am a happy camper with this big-button phone.  I like the loud ring and the ease of calling and receiving.  For me speakerphone is an important feature.  When I retired and moved I planned not to have a phone.  However, I found it necessary to have a phone number for online ordering. etc.  Also, to cancel some old accounts e.g. landline phone, I had to use a phone.  (How dumb is that?)  I can not see/use my husband's tiny-button phone.  There are many "frills" on this phone that I do not need e.g. address book, messaging, light, radio, voice mail...  An Amazon search found this phone and accessories for me. $10 a month is much less than I was paying for a landline phone - and many more minutes than I will ever use.

Reviews.Title: Good for us stoneagers!!
Reviews.Author: Ellen E. Stapleton
Reviews.Content: Having had to make a long road trip, I didn't want to worry about making or getting phone calls while driving. This Snapfon ezOne was great. It does what it says, the numbers are large and lighted, and all the features worked well. I only had one complaint, and that is with the instructions. I like them to tell me how to do anything teckie with the attitude that this person needs the most inane and simple steps. The companies could make them with all pix or really as simple as humanely possible, then I could follow them. Still felt a little stupid trying to follow instuctions provided, but that's me.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for a senior person
Reviews.Author: Pasky
Reviews.Content: This phone is great for the price...It is great for an elderly person who has poor eyesight and lives alone...The SOS button does exactly as it says. sends text messages to four saved numbers and dials the first one...

Reviews.Title: Snapfon for Seniors and Visually Impaired
Reviews.Author: Gwen
Reviews.Content: The Snapfon is perfect for me. I have Macular Degeneration and had trouble seeing my cell phone.  This phone makes it easy for me to dial and can be easily locked when carried in my purse.  My minutes were  transferred from T-Mobile with no trouble at all.  A great help to me

Reviews.Title: Great phone, great price
Reviews.Author: John E. English
Reviews.Content: We replaced my 84-year old mother-in-law's near antique flip phone with an unlocked Snapfon.  I inserted the sim card and within a few minutes had the programming completed.  This is an ideal phone for anyone who wants a basic phone with large, easy to read and press keys.  Other features are well thought out for older users.  Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Elegantly Simple
Reviews.Author: Catherine
Reviews.Content: This phone is just what I was looking to get for my Dad.  He's 75 and uses the cell only as a backup to their not-so-reliable Comcast landline.  I took it to my AT&T; store and they were able to add it to my plan for only $9.99 a month.  Now I don't have to worry that his old Go-phone needs topping off.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: wildrich
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my mother in law who was having trouble with her cell phone. This phone is much easier for her to use and she loves it. She is in her 70's and says this is the one phone she truly enjoys. Her friend saw it and also is planning on getting one for herself also. Highly Recommended for senior citizens.

Reviews.Title: great phone but greater with a few changes
Reviews.Author: cmac
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my elderly father who had never used a cell phone before.  I love the phone's large buttons and its ease of use; however, for my dad who was not familiar with cell phones there were a few things he had trouble with.  The first thing was the size of the phone and the position of the volume and lock buttons on the sides of the phone rather than on the front face of the phone.  It is a standard size bar phone, but for my dad it is a bit too small.  He can't handle the phone without either switching the phone to "lock" position or hitting the volume button (which adjusts both the volume of the ringtone and volume of the sound in the earpiece).  He's in a nursing home and he'd call in frustration saying he couldn't dial out (because he accidentally switched the lock button) or couldn't hear me well, or at all (because he had accidentally bumped the volume button).  Because my dad has moderate dementia and is unfamiliar with cell phones when I tried to explain what was wrong, he couldn't follow me and I'd have to make a trip to the nursing home or ask the staff there to mess around with his phone.  I have been able to use a heavy grade clear packing tape to cover the sliding "lock/unlock" button to keep him from accidentally sliding the button. I can't, however, figure out a way to keep the volume button in one position because it's a toggle switch rather than a slide like the lock button.  I would recommend that SnapFon find a way to enable users to lock the volume in place or move the button to a place less likely to be affected when picking up and using the phone.

Reviews.Title: Nice little phone for my 83-yr-old mother
Reviews.Author: Judy V
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my 83-yr-old mother because she never used her other pre-paid phone. I think she was intimidated by it.  This phone could not be simpler, and I was impressed by the features for the price.  I just set up her contacts in speed dial and taped them to the back of the phone with instructions how to listen to her voice mail.  Now to get her to take it with her when she leaves the house . . .

Reviews.Title: It works in Israel
Reviews.Author: Eyal
Reviews.Content: The special features of SOS does not work the rest radio flashlight and talk is great. oeration system in spanish and english

Reviews.Title: Excellent  phone for anyone not wanting "high tech".
Reviews.Author: iigor
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my husband who has difficulty using a small key pad. It is very easy to set up and use.  The instruction manual is in large print and simple to follow.  I did call Snapfon with a question and they gave me the information quickly and in an understandable manner. This phone would be good for anyone who does not need all the bells and whistles.  While it is designed for a "senior", I think it would also be good for a young child or a developmentally disabled person.

Reviews.Title: Bought one for my husband; liked it so much that I bought one for myself!
Reviews.Author: Jean Heather Akins
Reviews.Content: Updated review on Nov 1, 2012:  Customer service at Snapfon is outstanding!  My Snapfon stopped working Saturday morning, Oct 27th.  I called and left a voice mail message.  I also emailed them.  On Monday, October 29th I received a call from Larry at customer service and he was very helpful.  He determined that the problem was most likely the battery, so he mailed me a free replacement Snapfon battery via first class mail from Tennessee to California.  Snapfon is great at honoring the year-long warranty.  He said that if that didn't work, to contact him again.  I received it Wednesday, October 31st.  Replaced the battery, gave it a good four hour charge to make sure it was fully charged and my Snapfon works just fine now.  Thank you, Larry at Snapfon!  Sincerely, Jean************************************I bought one for my 64 year old husband because he wanted a simple mobile phone without all the fancy bells and whistles.  The big keys are a plus, as he has trouble with tiny keys.  I have to be the one in the household to handle the Comcast TV remote because he makes mistakes using it, so a phone with big keys is a must for him.  Removing the back cover before we could insert the SIM card and battery was a challenge, but once we were able to complete that, we were pleased with the phone.  The clarity of the sound is excellent.  Very simple and easy to use.  Snapfon's website has a support page where users, for example, can find out how to edit contacts they've entered into the phone book, etc.  The Snapfon also has a fun choice of ringtones that include the theme to Hawaii 5-0, The Andy Griffith Show, Dragnet and James Bond.  I also like the tone setting you can set it for when an incoming text message comes in:  female voice states:  "SMS text message received", in a futuristic space-age style, sort of a female version of SID from that UFO tv series.  I currently have an LG phone, but I like this Snapfon so much that I've ordered one for myself and will cancel the service to my LG phone.  I can save money because the monthly rate with PureTalkUSA is less than what I'm paying now.  Thank you, Snapfon!

Reviews.Author: MyAmname
Reviews.Content: Very good for basic functions i.e calling and receiving. I bought it for a beloved elder person with weakening eye sight and it is perfect for him. He can see the numbers well, and the voice function that confirms what number you have dialled is very usefeul too. He is happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Great phone!
Reviews.Author: Ali
Reviews.Content: Everything that it is advertised to be.  Purchased for my grandmother who recently had a stroke and eyesight is failing.  She is back in touch with her friends and I know that she can call me if she needs anything.

Reviews.Title: Snapfon ezOne
Reviews.Author: A. Valenzuela
Reviews.Content: It seems to be a great product. I bought two for my elder parents. I have not idea how they will like them, but I tried them with my sim card and I am happy with the purcharse. I feel that it will be very easy for them to use.

Reviews.Title: Good Phone for Seniors!
Reviews.Author: Alfredo Sosa "Chamo Sosa"
Reviews.Content: Hello everyone, this phone is very good for young kids and Senior citizens. Me and my wife bought this phone for my father in law and he enjoys it very much. Due to the big sized number key pad, he can type any number he wants and at the same time gets a voice feedback of the number dialed. The ring tones are very loud though selection is small. the most importan feature is the SOS button. He suffers from diabetes and the other day he was by himself and sufferd a low blood sugar level crisis and he pressed the button. instantly all of the five contacts on the SOS button were notified and went to his aid. Gladly he is in good health now, but the phone sure helped the cause. I recommend 100%. Don't expect many bells and whistles on this phone its pretty strait forward. Green call, Red hang up, and sms. But overall a good phone for the tech impaired.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use, but...
Reviews.Author: Burin "Burin Kantabutra"
Reviews.Content: The phone is quite easy to use, and customer service is excellent. Numerals are large and easy to read. The manual is printed in large, easy-to-read type. Manual doesn't' tell know how to delete a SMS or a single contact.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone for elderly or sight impaired!
Reviews.Author: subond
Reviews.Content: Purchased this phone for my elderly 80 year old father.  He has just had surgery and is headed to rehab for a hip replacement.  This phone is loud enough for him to hear, it lights up so that he can easily find the numbers and the are very large!! The largest keys that I have found.  The phone is user friendly and I reccomend this phone to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: Best Parolee phone
Reviews.Author: Patricia W. Livingston
Reviews.Content: I spent hours on end for days and wasted a couple of weeks with one "false start" (locked phone sold as unlocked)before finding this phone for my son whose life depended upon his ability to make phone calls but was under restrictions to find a "talk and text only" phone. This Snapfon, combined with the unlimited plan offered by PureTalk USA was the least expensive and ONLY option available on the market. It was reassuring to find it on Amazon.com, for I knew that if for some unforseen reason it too wasn't workable, being able to return it to a reputable company wouldn't bring with it any other unfortunate suprises. Thanks, Amazon!

Reviews.Author: zephyr
Reviews.Content: This phone was bought for an elderly friend who had gotten out of the hospital after receiving radiation and chemotherapy.  He was having difficulty using his old phone which was a flip top phone.  I bought him another phone which was a phone with a touch screen....it was too difficult for him to operate.This phone perfectly suits his needs.  It is easy for him to understand how to use, and is easy for him to use.  My only nit pick is is that the phone is almost like a toy made of cheap plastic.  This should be made of metal....so that it is more sturdy.

Reviews.Title: Ageless
Reviews.Author: Dc
Reviews.Content: Great phone!!Easy for seniors to use my mother in law loves it !I can't thank you enough for the product !

Reviews.Title: Great phone
