Reviews.Content: Great phone. Bought this for my memory impaired mother that I recently moved into assisted living. The numbers are big, operation fairly simple, only problem I found was sometimes she cut the call off and then turns off or the ringer somehow. I don't know what she does to turn the phone ringer off, but does happen frequently. It was a simple hooked up to the T mobile flat $30 for 1500 minutes to learn on.

Reviews.Title: easy to use
Reviews.Author: OnlineBuyer
Reviews.Content: This is great for seniors, I bought for my mom and she has an easier time than other phones to use this device.

Reviews.Title: great phone for seniors
Reviews.Author: KimC
Reviews.Content: nice large buttons with speech. bought for my father who has sight issues. nice display easy to use (he still has issues using the menu) though it is quite clear and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Phone use for stroke survivor
Reviews.Author: Feedback
Reviews.Content: This is a good phone.  This is our second phone in the past two years.  It is easy for my mother to use.  However, we do need to understand why the power is not working on the second purchase.  The large keys are a plus also.

Reviews.Title: Great phone.  No complaints on it.
Reviews.Author: irat
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my father and tried it out so I could instruct him on it.  I don't think he will get it.

Reviews.Title: Simple
Reviews.Author: Ira
Reviews.Content: This phone does exactly what it is suppose to do nothing extra which is great for why I ordered it. The Flashlight and radio are great that are both actually built into the phone. I recommend this phone for elderly and people who have trouble seeing are people who just want a simple phone.

Reviews.Title: SnapFon is a Snap to Use!
Reviews.Author: Goat1080
Reviews.Content: I was looking for just a basic phone without a lot of unwanted and unneeded features.  I found just what I was looking for - just a phone that's just that.  The battery life is very good, the display large and easy to view and it has good audio quality - all important to me.  It also works on multiple networks including the T-Mobile network which I currently use.  I also like the fact it can be used overseas by simply inserting a SIM card.

Reviews.Title: Good phone & value for seniors
Reviews.Author: Scott W. White "kibbled_bits"
Reviews.Content: Got this phone for my father who has had issues with other phones.  He is able to operate this phone pretty well which he struggled with using other phones.

Reviews.Title: snapeasy
Reviews.Author: peachant
Reviews.Content: I bought the phone for my mom. She likes it. Very senior friendly. The big numbers makes it eisier for her to dial. Thanks Snapfon.

Reviews.Title: Excelente el equipo - Recomendado
Reviews.Author: Jaime Vazquez
Reviews.Content: Excelente el teléfono celular para personas adultas mayor, pràctico, teclas manejables, sonido fuerte. Se les hace un poco dificl enviar MSM por lo chica de la pantalla donde no caben frases largas y son solo 2 lineas visibles, por el resto, super.

Reviews.Title: Good phone for seniors
Reviews.Author: Soucie
Reviews.Content: I got this phone for my almost 85-year old mother, and I like the big buttons, ease of use, and the simple menus.  The only problem I am having is how to delete unwanted sms messages from the inbox - the instructions don't tell you how to do this, and I haven't been able to figure it out!

Reviews.Title: Great Phone  for the price
Reviews.Author: O. K. Adams
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my 87 year old father. He is on a plan now that is limited to 1200 minutes a month and runs out of time every month. Now this man has plenty of money in the bank, but won't spring for an unlimited plan. Go figure. Anyway, he did not like this phone because it is not a "flip" type. Otherwise, the phone is great and I have no complaints about the merchant. Just can't understand old people sometimes.... :)

Reviews.Title: A Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Miss. Missy "Missy"
Reviews.Content: I am 76 years old and this is a wonderful phone for me. Easy to use,easy to see and I like the SOS for me in case I need help. All in all it is a great phone for any age. I ordered it from Amazon and it was so easy to order and delivery was fast. I would recommend it for anyone.

Reviews.Title: snapfon ezONE
Reviews.Author: Vicki
Reviews.Content: Great phone, reasonable price, fast service, would gladly do business with company again.  My husband needed a cell phone with larger numbers and easy to use, this worked perfectly.

Reviews.Title: Great Phone
Reviews.Author: Bella Donna
Reviews.Content: My mother is almost blind, and this phone is great...nice big numbers, easy to ready and easy to use. The ring is nice and loud. It's perfect for her!

Reviews.Title: i can hear you now!, lol...
Reviews.Author: Bert K Igawa
Reviews.Content: It is a great phone, loved that I bought it for my Dad, he actually says it's too loud, but the tv is always still louder!?, I would recommend it for anybody, old, young, etc.. great basic use phone, also has FM radio and a flashlight (things that matter).  Oh of course the S.O.S. button and big number display is helpful too...

Reviews.Title: Very Easy
Reviews.Author: Okie girl
Reviews.Content: This was for a relative in a nursing home. It is very easy to use and for her to understand. It was also helpful to control the volume when she needed more.  We are very happy with this purchase. I would do business with this company again.

Reviews.Title: Just too hard for older people to use
Reviews.Author: Kind Woman
Reviews.Content: Well, we have given this phone an honest try, but my mother just couldn't use it. First she broke off the little prong on the charger on her second use. We got a new charger and the company very kindly credited us for most of the cost. Then, despite many sessions with her children assisting her in it's use, she just can't seem to work it. She often turns it off by accident because she holds the buttons down for too long.The menu is also pretty confusing for anyone, and virtually impossible for someone accustomed to a traditional, old-time phone. It looks simple, but the same buttons have multiple uses, depending on where you are in the menu. Just too hard for an octagenarian.She has been receiving junk text messages as well. Isn't it possible to have a truly simple phone that can't even receive texts. It's just not simple enough. We wasted some money here.

Reviews.Title: The SnapFon ezONE-C was junk-replaced 2
Reviews.Author: JesusFreakJoel
Reviews.Content: The SnapFon ezONE-C Senior cell phone was supposed to be an easy to use phone replacement and this was so cumbersome and full of glitches that it needed to be pulled from the market.  I'm a techie who works with VoIP and all types of cell/ smart phones and this was junk.  The first one would lock up and not be a useable phone or it would dial the preset numbers on its own and send out the texts.  We used it on our AT&T; plan and had to return it for an exchange after they inspected it for a few weeks and then shipped one out.  The replacement unit was equally as bad, but it would drop off the network so you couldn't call it.  I picked up a $30 flip "go" phone and now we're much happier.  I preferred the button, but what's the point if it wouldn't work most of the time anyway.  I am still within warranty and was told that I would have to pay $79.99 to upgrade to Junk-fon #2 when I only paid $59 for Junk-fon #1 that is STILL supposed to be under warranty.  I'm just keeping the go phone and avoiding the extra hassles at this point since #2 could be more like a doodie #2 anyway.JD

Reviews.Title: ezONE-C senior cell phone
Reviews.Author: Good Customer
Reviews.Content: I was encourage to purchase this cell phone in an effort to provide comfort and ease of use for my 70 year old mother; she disliked it completely. Unfortunately, I would not recommend the purchase of this product. It is not user-friendly, difficult to store contacts in address book, in fact, it does not store them! Even with the volume set at the highest, i.e. 7, it is very difficult to hear. The reception/signal is awful. However, the flashlight and lock key are good features; but that's about it. I will make an effort to return it, hopefully the seller will realize that it is a poor quality product.

Reviews.Title: Snapfon ezONE
Reviews.Author: Little Shepherd
Reviews.Content: The Snapfon was every bit as good as its sales description. Even on arrival I found its battery almost fully charged! I got an AT&T; SIM installed in it.One gripe: Somehow I found that some business(es) got my phone number and were posting SMS messages on my phone. I consider this intrusive SPAM. How did they get that number?  I turned off the reception of SMS messages, but learned that their further calls to send them were still being charged to my airtime budget.  How do I prevent that entirely?It is still too early to report on the voice loudness or quality when I use it to speak with other people. How well do they hear me?A minor disappointment: I could not find any way to lower the volume of the chime when I turn the phone on or off.

Reviews.Title: Great phone
Reviews.Author: Shmuel Malov
Reviews.Content: I got this phone for my father after he complained that the keys on his phone were too small. I did some shoppping around and came upon the only cell phone in the world withblarge keys. This phone is perfect for him. No tech, no problems.

Reviews.Title: Great phone for a senior
Reviews.Author: Pam A
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my elderly father.  He is 81 and it has been a great benefit to him.  The key pad is large and easy to see as well as the screen font.  I really like that it has a cradle that it can be placed in to recharge, plus the ring is loud enough for him to hear it throughout the house.  That is a real plus.  I have programmed in the SOS numbers and that gives me a good comfort level.  This phone does not have all the typical gadgets you would see on a cell phone, but my father would never use those anyway.  It is perfect for an older adult.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Solution for Elderly Mother
Reviews.Author: Ellen Rich
Reviews.Content: This phone was difficult to use and I had to throw it away as my mother could not navigate through the system.  The speaker phone was very poorly designed and one has to hold the zero down until the right level is reached each time the phone is used.  This is a big problem as the volume at the highest level was not high enough to start the call.  All and all a waste of $80.  Try Jitterbug.

Reviews.Title: Do not buy if you have PureTalkUSA
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Both Snapfone and PureTalkUSA told me this phone would work for my grandparents when I added them to my plan on PureTalkUSA's network.  The SIM cards all worked on the free phone that I got from PureTalkUSA, but the phone that I bought from Amazon, made by Snapfone, screwed everything up.  The phone would work, then not.  It has nothing to do with service, because my free phone has never had a problem or interruption in service.  There is nothing wrong with PureTalkUSA's service.  It is clearly the phone that does not work with it.  This phone may work with other services, but not with PureTalkUSA.On the bright side, my grandparents loved the huge numbers and the speed dial.  They also liked that it was lightweight, had a radio, and flashlight.  I really like the panic button option.  I could have it call me, my parents, and 911, and if the first the didn't answer it would send a "HELP" text.  Cool idea, but terrible execution with PureTalkUSA.

Reviews.Title: need better instructions
Reviews.Author: edward tarowsky
Reviews.Content: Nice phone. Working well. Didn't realize you had to remove a piece from the charging stand if using the phone w/cover until I read a review. Better instructions would be helpful.Also recommend the up/down voice volume button be moved from the side of the phone. When my mother talks on the phone her fingers touch the down button and then she can't hear the caller. Thought the phone was going bad, but no -she was lowering the voice volume of the person she was talking to.

Reviews.Title: Can't decide which is worse -- the phone or the customer service
Reviews.Author: Fussy Shopper
Reviews.Content: I purchased a snapfon for my mother because I wanted her to have the SOS button.  The phone arrived and immediately seemed problematic. The writing on the screen was distorted and jumbled. Sometimes the phone worked, but often when she tried to make a call, it would say connected but you couldn't hear the other person and they couldn't hear you. The voicemail was garbled. Snapfon's customer service is awful: they told me they would examine the phone to see if there was anything wrong with it, and then decide whether it needed to be replaced. I said that was absurd because it meant my mother would have no service for weeks. I asked them to send a replacement phone in the meanwhile, and I would return the broken one. They refused unless I gave an additional deposit. Remember, this is a company whose website says: "handset replacement included in every plan, no deductible, no shipping cost." If they won't replace the broken one they just shipped me without a hassle, are they really going to replace one that breaks a few months later?  I am cutting my losses and sending back this flimsy piece of junk. Here are some things to keep in mind. The 30-day satisfaction guarantee is from the moment you order. So if it takes a week to arrive, you lose that time on your trial. I thought I could try it with our ATT Sim card, but the snapfon no longer works with ATT Sim cards, so I had to close my mother's ATT account to start this one. Today I spent many, many hours on the phone getting the original account restored.  Snapfon has been a complete disappointment and a huge hassle.

Reviews.Title: Snapfon fills a need and then some!
Reviews.Author: Lois Yowell "LoLo"
Reviews.Content: I recently purchased the Snapfon for my mother for Christmas.  She gave up her previous cellphone, thinking she didn't use it enough to justify paying for a plan.  Then I researched the Snapfon.  She hasn't received it yet, but I think it will work beautifully for her needs.  With the help of the technicians at Snapfon, I was able to set her phone up in no time at all.  Chelsea was most helpful in getting the phone activated and instructed me on general information I needed to know to program her contacts as well as answering any questions I had.The phone has many great features, but the one I like best for my mom who, is in her 80's, is the SOS button on the back.  If there is an emergency of any kind, for example if she should fall and is unable to dial numbers, she simply pushes the large red button on the back and it will immediately send out text messages to four numbers that are programmed into the SOS feature of the phone.  Once the text messages are sent, it will start dialling the numbers that are programmed until there is an answer.The sound is clear and the signal is great.  But most of all, the service representatives at Snapfon are top notch!  I feel secure knowing that if my mom should have any technical issues, she will be politely talked through a problem and will be able to handle it on her own which contributes to her sense of independence which she values so much.Thank you Snapfon for making such a good product and for putting into place individuals who put customer service as a top priority.

Reviews.Title: Wrong battery
Reviews.Author: iappraise
Reviews.Content: Phone worked for a couple years.  Tried to order the replacement battery.  Wrong battery sent.  My dad's phone is now dead and will probably just replace the whole phone.

Reviews.Title: I return it..................  it is poorly made
Reviews.Author: Winston "Hello"
Reviews.Content: Now you can buy better phone than this.. not worth the price.. my senior parents hate it and don't want to use it.

Reviews.Title: PLEASE SEND ANOTHER BATTERY OR I'LL BE SENDING YOUR PHONE AND ACCESSORIES BACK!
Reviews.Author: Dee
Reviews.Content: Looked like this phone was going to be the answer for my 85 year-old mother-in-law who is hard of hearing and tech-challanged,  Was very impressed and happy with the loudness and ease of use for her initially.  Within one week, the phone would no longer charge and was useless.  Larry whom I contacted on 8/28/13 with my issue, decided it was probably a bad battery and that he would ship one right out to me to arrive to arrive within 2-3 days.  On 9/5/13, had still not received the battery as promised.  Thank God I had not  yet trashed my mother-in-law's previous phone as yet.  On 9/5/13, I spoke to Katie who indicated that Larry had  not followed thru on shipping the battery and that she would do so that day.  Today is 9/11/13, and still no battery.  If I don't get this battery very soon, you'll be getting the whole phone with accessory back.

Reviews.Title: Flimzy, screen broken in 6 months
Reviews.Author: Dmitriy Yegorov
Reviews.Content: (review is for ezONE)My grandpa liked it, the buttons were big but the phone is flimsy.Screen stopped working after a few months.

Reviews.Title: wouldn't recommend
Reviews.Author: Peggy Salsman
Reviews.Content: Display and keys were fine. BUT, worked a couple months then started dropping calls all the time.  was not dependable

Reviews.Title: Difficult To Use
Reviews.Author: James Brenneman
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my mother. I expected that she would have to get use to this phone but the process has been extremely difficult. She is constantly accidentally deleting contacts or "copying" them so she has 3 or 4 of the same person. She accidentally turns the volume down and then can't hear me when I call.  She did have another cell phone before I got her this one so she does know the basics of how to use one. The buttons are big and easy to see and use but what seems perfectly intuitive to me just evades her as she tries to use it.

Reviews.Title: fragile charging cord: CAREFUL
Reviews.Author: Edward Rickers
Reviews.Content: The phone works well enough and my 83 year old father appreciates it.However, there are still confusing menus to navigate to speed dial, etc... Making a senior friendly phone is a lot more than just loud ringers and big buttons, although I appreciate that. Biggest problem was that after a week the fragile charging input jack broke off inside the charging receptical. Not sure what to do now with this $100 phone that can't be charged because the jack is broke off inside.

Reviews.Title: Just okay
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "askimauto"
Reviews.Content: The good, large buttons, fairly large screen, Emergency button is a good idea.  Not so great, feels kind of cheap, and the menu and address book is not easy for an 85 y/o to navigate.

Reviews.Title: Perfect phone for older people.
Reviews.Author: Yipcusing
Reviews.Content: Was excited to show it to my Dad, however excitement quickly turned into disappointment to find out that the phone was unable to charge. Returned for refund.Wish Snapfon has better QC.

Reviews.Title: Common battery issue
Reviews.Author: Radar "realboy"
Reviews.Content: Bought it for old parent, the phone was not able to be turned on except the flashlight part, followed the customer service instruction to return it back under my own shipping expense. The same phone was shipped back, was able to turn on and made the calls ...........until battery had no power. Tried number of recharge, never able to turn on. Finally it works after put in a Nokia battery.Of course then found out this product has a common battery issue that not last long.Plus the phone is only very basic for call & text only, you have no way to check your acct. like a real carrier phone.

Reviews.Title: Snapfon  ezONE-C for Seniors is just OK..could be better for the price!
Reviews.Author: Autoharp Lady "PC to Apple Newby"
Reviews.Content: OK, so we bought this for my Mom so she could feel safe when walking around her apartment and to the store.  AND...by the way the providers, all of them that workedwith phone do not have good reception inside her apartment so part of her reason for getting a cell phone was lost...ie; falling down far from her land-line.  The instructions that came with the phone, while in large print (which was helpful for some folks I am sure) were poorly written in that they left out certain steps critical to the initial set up of the phone.Large buttons are great, but do not make up for the difficulty in certain functional screen menus.  Also, the emergency red button function was a joke.  Since it was easy to accidentally just hit #1 and then you got an auto dialing of 911...a felony for a false call.  The phone turned out to be too large to hang around her neck and too large for herpocket since it seemed to turn its face on, even in the "locked" position for the keypad.  This bugged my Mom...who declared she "didn't like it".  She is going to keep it anyway,but our monitoring of her use shows she isn't using it!  There is definitely room for improvement.  First:  I would add a cover, or flip up aspect to the phone, make it slightly smaller,  and even if this sacrifices minimally the size of the buttons.

Reviews.Title: Terrible phone, died in a few weeks
Reviews.Author: cantbackup
Reviews.Content: The function for setting the date was not working, so I just blew it off; don't need a phone to know the date.  But, after very little use, it could no longer be turned on.  I threw it away as it was out of warranty and got a go phone from AT&T;

Reviews.Title: Emergency question.
Reviews.Author: Hector Santos
Reviews.Content: Hi, my father is blind and I was wondering if this cellphone is able to read the name of uncoming caller.This is a very important characteristic.

Reviews.Title: Home charger plug doesn't fit
Reviews.Author: Corey J. Brown
Reviews.Content: The charger for the snapfon doesn't fit the phone correctly, hence the phone doesn't charge.  Had to buy lighter adapter outlet and use existing car charger for house use.  Wrote company but never got a response back.

Reviews.Title: mixed review
Reviews.Author: Senior Junior
Reviews.Content: This phone is a great idea, and for the most part it does what it says--i.e. makes it easier for a senior to use a cell.  But there is a major problem.  You can set up speed dial so that your senior in theory needs to press just one button to make a call. BUT unfortunately lots of random spam calls and SMS messages come into the phone, and the screen notifies you how many of each you missed.  To get past those notifications in order to use speed dial requires pushing another button (the red Power button) twice, and then the speed dial number.  That's nothing for most of us, but not for a senior--if they have to press three keys to make a call, it really makes it not that much more convenient than a standard cell or landline.  Given the whole sales pitch, it defeats the purpose.  Seems like something they should be able to fix or give you the option of turning off the notification, but their tech support says no.  So thumbs down from this user.

Reviews.Title: Snapfon Charger Review
Reviews.Author: Vid King
Reviews.Content: Our Snapfon works fine but the charger quit charging.  We were in a bind as my father who uses the phone needed a charger asap.  We paid the extra delivery charge for 2 day shipping and the new charger arrived on time but was damaged.  An inch and a half strip of plastic was curled outward from the side of the charger exposing some of the inner parts.  Luckily the damage doesn't affect the charger's operation and some black electrical tape covered up the opening.  Normally we would send it back due to the damaged condition but we were in a bind as my father needs his phone.

Reviews.Title: Came without the battery
Reviews.Author: Eduardo E. Farkas Sosa "boldogfa"
Reviews.Content: The phone seems great and good quality.  Unfortunately it came without the battery. It's faster and relatively cheaper for me to buy a new one...

Reviews.Title: hard for my mom to navigate
Reviews.Author: Lindakatiny "booklover52"
Reviews.Content: this phone was to hard for my mom to navigate. She would call me every week to help her with this phone. Ultimately i had to get her another phone.Sorry but I wasted my money on this phone.Linda

Reviews.Title: Unhappy
Reviews.Author: Barroon
Reviews.Content: Bought this product as a gift for an elderly person for christmas 2011. It worked well for one month, then the speaker just stopped working! The loudspeaker is working well and so is the earphone but the regular speaker just stopped. Tried everything the site suggested to troubleshoot but nothing!

Reviews.Title: Run to the exit (and take your wheelchair bound parent with you)
Reviews.Author: Sharon K. Bland
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone for my senior mom with Rheumatoid Arthritis.  Phone is great.  However, SNAPfon connected and disconnected the phone twice, once due to a porting problem for our longstanding landline number, and then because the credit card expired, leaving us without service for multiple days each time.  When the credit card expired, they sent an e-mail 4 hours before cutting off the phone, even though the service was overpaid (because they charged my mom's credit card twice).  Then two weeks later, the battery died.  No charge, no go, no phone.  I ran around trying to find a battery, forget that.  I called SNAPfon, and they sent a new battery, but would not overnight it (for which they want over $50.00). No, SNAPfon is not compatible with ANY other battery, so forget Radio Shack or Battery Warehouse.Frankly, seniors don't need this, and surely cannot afford to be left without 911 service. There is absolutely no excuse.  This is a classic example of a smart idea with extremely poor management.  When I asked them why they didn't call to update the credit card, they felt I should have known to change the expiration, which expires every 5 years.  In this day and age, one expects a little bit more communication, particularly given that Seniors don't have the capability to keep track of these types of details and a simple report off of a basic data system could alert SNAPfon to those users whose credit expiration is about to expire so this issue can be dealt with without loss of critical phone service.  I digress.In my state, there is a law which makes it illegal to disconnect the phone of a senior if it will cut off 911 service.  SNAPfon clearly is unaware of this legislation, and clearly did not care one way or the other, utterly refusing to change their policy.You'd be better off with a TracPhone

Reviews.Title: JUNK
Reviews.Author: Vincent Williams "hiwestman"
Reviews.Content: PIECE A JUNK.  BOUGHT THIS FOR MY HARD OF HEARING FATHER.  TOOK IT TO ATT AND BOUGHT A SIM CARD AND HAD THE GUY AT THE COUNTER CALL ME ON IT.  NOT LOUD AT ALL.  RINGS LOUD BUT PHONE IS NOT LOUD AT ALL.  LIGHTWEIGHT FLIMSY PRODUCT THAT DOES NOT WORK AS ADVERTISED.  ENDED UP BUYING A PHONE WITH BLUETOOTH AND BOUGHT A WIRELESS SPEAKER KIT FOR IT THAT AMPLIFIES THE PHONE AND ACTS AS A MICROPHONE AS WELL - LIKE YOU WOULD PUT IN A CAR FOR HANDS FREE OPERATION.  WORKS GOOD.  NOW I USE THIS PHONE AS A $100 DOOR STOP.

Reviews.Title: Not practical for our needs
Reviews.Author: gene Medel
Reviews.Content: Snapfone product is good , but  just not found to be practical for our current needs for what we where looking for.

Reviews.Title: Not for Srs.
Reviews.Author: joyce Matcham
Reviews.Content: I could not program with contact nos., could set up voice mail. Very poor instructions or none at all. The back was hard to remove if  a person has arthritis, this phone is not for SR. citizens. The nos. were easy to read.

Reviews.Title: Nowhere near loud enough unless you put it on speaker (hard for an older person to remember)
Reviews.Author: T. Simmons
Reviews.Content: I got this for my dad due to the large numbers and thought the speaking the number option was good so he could hear what # he pressed.  But here are my gripes.1) The volume even at max volume was so low I had trouble hearing it unless I put the thing right up to my ear and it was very low then so my dad who's 89 and wears hearing aids would have trouble hearing that in any location that was not particularly quiet.2) The only way to put it on speaker phone is to wait till the call is connected (hopefully you hear them say hello) THEN you have to press the OK button twice in succession. ?  There is no menu option to leave it in speaker phone mode and you cannot go into speaker mode until the call is connected.  My dad isn't going to remember all of that.3) the back plate was very hard to remove to put the sim card and battery in.  If you have strong, sticky hands then maybe you'd fare better than I did4) The FM reception was crap.  Basically useless.5) Although not a huge gripe, w/o a flip top, you must press OK to answer and the power button ONCE QUICKLY to hang up and my 89 year old dad isn't going to remember the difference between pressing the power button ONCE QUICKLY and ONCE HOLDING IT.  He was 18 in 1945 so none of this stuff is easy and he is pretty much technology ignorant.So, I actually returned it and got the Jitterbug phone which is working much better.  Louder, flip top so he only has to open/close to use it (no worry about off/on or accidentally pressing buttons), dedicated speakerphone button that works even BEFORE the call is connected, and although I've had problems getting the ringer to stay on though it could be that it's resetting due to some software flaw or updates, it's working better for my dad than the Snapfon.Just my opinions after actually getting the phone and using it.  Your mileage may vary.

Reviews.Title: poor quality of sound system
Reviews.Author: Sally Dietz "Sally D"
Reviews.Content: I returned the Snapfon because of the poor quality of the sound system on the Snapfon. I do not recomment the Snapfon.

Reviews.Title: Signal strength poor
Reviews.Author: Fred B. Eiseman, Jr.
Reviews.Content: I bought an AT&T; no contract card for my Snapfon from AT&T.; They installed it in the phone and pronounced it OK. However, the signal strength is poor, and I have not been able to send or receive using the Snapfon. I have two other AT&T; phones with similar cards, and, at the same location, they work normally, so that the fault is with the phone not the location.It is a great idea, but a lousy phone. I have returned it for credit to Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Low quality cell phone
Reviews.Author: Douglas
Reviews.Content: After two weeks of little use it became broke. Especifically the S.O.S button was shifted from its place.The other drawback is the menu. It is not user friendly at all.The only possitive feature of this cell phone is the size of the keys.Not recommended at all. Look for a better quality device.

Reviews.Title: Phone Works about 10% of the Time, an Support Can Not Be Reached
Reviews.Author: Albert
Reviews.Content: I bought the phone for my mother of 80 years old.  I thought this would be good because she cannot speak English, and this phone's alert system, if working as says, would alert me and others by SMS and phone calls so I can contact emergency if required.  Yet in our tests, the phone only works about 10% of the time at best.  I have the phone months now but because my mother lives in another city, and she thought she did not know how to use the phone or phone lines were busy when she tried to call, I never knew that the phone does not work most of the time until I visited her.The phone seems OK with my T-mobile SIM card sometimes, but most of the time, despite full bars of signal, it keeps having dial failure, or it seemed to try to dial out but there was actually no dial tone.  Honestly, I have tried dialing many times, and I tried installing different SIM cards in the phone, and the problem is the same: it works about 10% or less of the time.I sent two messages to support@snapfon.com, and after a day or two, the messages bounced back.  The echo error in the bounced message did not say the email address was wrong.  The message is:Delivery to the following recipient has been delayed:  support@snapfon.comMessage will be retried for 2 more day(s)Technical details of temporary failure:The recipient server did not accept our requests to connect. Learn more at[...]. [50.56.33.144]:25: Connection refused]-------------------------I called Snapfon technical support, and what I got was a greeting message telling me to leave contact info and a detailed description of the problem.  I have yet to hear from them.Yet, there website claims that technical support is always available !The phone is a good idea.  It is a piece of junk unless it works reliably.  I wished I could give them negative number of stars.

Reviews.Title: Bad Phone and Bad Service
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: I purchased this phone in good faith assuming that the company was actually going to be of help to me considering I am on a fixed income.I couldn't have made a bigger mistake!!!The only thing wrong with the phone is; when I tried to remove the back cover, I almost broke the phone due to the difficulty I had removing it. It was stuck on.The PureTalk service is a scam!!!!Their customer support is nearly nonexistent. I have been trying for a month to get the conformation e-mail to send in for my $10.00 rebate.Also, there is no way to cancel your service or cancel your card once you sign up.I am contacting my State's Attorney General Office to file a formal complaint against PureTalk USA.

Reviews.Title: Snapfon ezone-C Senior Cell Phone
Reviews.Author: June
Reviews.Content: It's a great phone, nice large numbers good size.....but you have to use their phone service provider.  We were looking for a phone we could just transfer our present company & number to because we have Verizon and found out after that you can't transfer to another company, you have to use their company.  Not what we were looking for.

Reviews.Title: DON"T BUY THIS PHONE WITHOUT CHECKING COVERAGE
Reviews.Author: jphpoohpka
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone in November.  It appeared to have all the features that my elderly mother needed.  Snapfon didn't offer coverage in Tomah, WI.  They advised me to use T-Mobile.  I did.  When we tried the phone it appeared to work.  HOWEVERit only worked in certain areas of her house.  We didn't find this out until she had an emergency.  I contacted T-Mobileand they said that although there service SHOULD work in the Tomah area the signal was not strong (of course this was after numerous contacts with T-Moblie, Service Technician calls and vists and finally a new SIM card.)WELL to make a long story short T-Mobile refunded my money.SNAPfon told me "TOO BAD SO SAD"  They said that I hadn't contacted them in 30 days.  I told them that my mother livesin WI and I live in IL and after setting the phone up it appeared to work, it just DIDN"T work for the EMERGENCY that shehad.THEY REPLIED SORRY!!!!  AND WOULD NOT GIVE A SOLUTION OR REFUND!NO CUSTOMER SERVICE!  I will tell any and ALL who will listen about this HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE experience!Try JITTERBUG or JUST5.  Don't wasted your time with this phone......you will be out of money if you experience problems!!

Reviews.Title: Power NO - you gotta be kidding -
Reviews.Author: Burt Hill
Reviews.Content: Power NO ? What more needs to be said or written.BTW, I just got a Just5 (essentially same as SnapFon C) from WalMart - it simply does not work. Other party can't hear a word - even after 'mute' 'unmute' and volume to max.
